description: The separatist insurgency in Chechnya, a predominantly Muslim republic, has gained a religious tone in its war against Russia.

title: An Olympics in the Shadow of a War Zone
description: BAKSAN, Russia  On Friday, exactly a week before the Olympics were set to open just 180 miles away, Russias security forces appeared on Makhov Street at 8:30 a.m. and cordoned off the area around a brick and stone house. One of the men inside called his father, who said it was the first he had heard from his son in 10 months.

title: Arthur Ortenberg, a Liz Claiborne Founder, Dies at 87
description: Arthur Ortenberg, who teamed up with his wife, the designer Liz Claiborne, and a third partner to build a billion-dollar enterprise clothing career women in stylish but casual outfits at moderate prices, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (Nat Geo) HUNTING HITLERS STOLEN TREASURES: THE MONUMENTS MEN In advance of this weeks release of The Monuments Men, directed by and starring George Clooney, this special weaves together film clips, archival videos and photographs, journals and personal accounts to tell the story of the scholars charged with rescuing Europes art during and after World War II.

title: Philip Seymour Hoffman: A Filmography
description: From Scent of a Woman to Synecdoche.

title: Russell Hemenway, Champion of Reformist Politics, Dies at 88
description: Russell D. Hemenway, who rose from reform politics in New York City to help orchestrate national strategies to advance liberal candidates and ideas, died on Jan. 30 at his home in Rhinebeck, N.Y. He was 88.

title: Arthur Rankin, 89, Dies; His Puppet Animation Was a Holiday Hallmark
description: Arthur Rankin Jr., who created a canon of childrens holiday television using stop-motion puppet animation, including Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer, one of the longest-running annual network specials, died on Jan. 30 in Harrington Sound, Bermuda, where he had lived in recent years. He was 89.

title: White House Announces 7 Regional Climate Hubs
description: WASHINGTON  On the heels of the Senates passage of a long-awaited farm bill, the Obama administration announced the creation of seven regional climate hubs on Wednesday to help farmers and rural communities respond to the risks of climate change, including drought, invasive pests, fires and floods.

title: Corrections: February 5, 2014
description: NEW YORK

title: Indonesia Reports Slowest Growth in 4 Years
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesias economy grew last year at an annual rate of less than 6 percent, the countrys Central Statistics Agency reported on Wednesday, the first time that has happened since 2009.

title: Wagner Looks to Team Event as a Chance to Bounce Back
description: SOCHI, Russia  Since falling last month at the United States figure skating championships, Ashley Wagner has changed her long program, lost weight to improve her jumping and tried to get back on her feet for the Olympics.

title: North and South Korea Set Dates for Family Reunions
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North and South Korea agreed on Wednesday to hold family reunions later this month in which hundreds of elderly relatives separated by the Korean War would meet for the first time in six decades.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Feb. 5, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Philip Seymour Hoffmans Death and the Heroin Trade
description: In Hoffmans Heroin Points to Surge in Grim Trade, J. David Goodman writes about a seedy New York City underground where heroin sells for as little as $6 a bag.

title: Whose Turkey Is It?
description: It is still a marvel to behold Recep Tayyip Erdogans self-confidence, even after 11 years of his rule. In recent weeks, a new poster featuring Turkeys prime minister has appeared throughout Istanbul, on highway billboards and mass transit. Wearing his usual dark suit, Erdogan looks to be in purposeful motion, like an action hero. Two large words in block letters, SAGLAM IRADE, Turkish for Iron Will, accompany him. Surely some of his supporters appreciate this evocation of 1930s-era masculinity, but for others, it must feel like an invasion of personal space. The enormous billboards intensify the claustrophobia that many Turks have felt for years: that Erdogan is everywhere, in every tree or open space sacrificed for a building, in every traffic jam, in every newspaper column and pro-government tweet and call to prayer. The poster, which a group of his supporters claims to have put up, begs to be defaced, and Turks have torn at it or covered it with new slogans: Iron Fascist, Iron Corruption, Iron Enemy of the People.

title: Add a Little Turf to the Surf
description: I dont subscribe to the belief that everything is better with bacon, but small amounts of meat do often improve many dishes  even those with fish. While there are plenty of classic fish stews that dont use meat for flavoring, including bouillabaisse, there are also many that do. (Clam chowder, anyone?) Think about it: When youre making stew, everything is fair game.

title: It Takes a Village to Protect a Rhino
description: Ami Vitale is a photographer and filmmaker who has worked in more than 85 countries. She is a contract photographer for National Geographic and works with the Photo Society and Ripple Effect Images, and is represented by Panos Pictures. She is currently crowdfunding to complete a photography and multiplatform media project in northern Kenya, begun with the Nature Conservancy, on how local communities are protecting their wildlife from poaching. Her interview with James Estrin has been edited.

title: What Memorable Experiences Have You Had on Facebook?
description: Facebook turns 10 this week, and the Times Technology section asked readers to tell them about specific experiences they had  whether positive or negative  because of it.

title: Times Minute | Texting to Help Teenagers
description: Also on the Minute, the Senate passes the farm bill and Robert Frost's letters.

title: Times Minute | Texting to Help Teenagers
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: A Treacherous Wintry Mix
description: Updated 12:09 p.m.

title: U.N. Panel Criticizes the Vatican Over Sexual Abuse
description: In a hard-hitting report applauded by victims as a landmark in the Roman Catholic Churchs clerical sexual-abuse scandal, a United Nations committee on Wednesday called on the Vatican to remove all child abusers from its ranks, report them to law enforcement and open the churchs archives so that bishops and other officials who concealed crimes could be held accountable.

title: Protests over Creation of Telangana Disrupt 1st Day of 2014 Parliament Session
description: NEW DELHI  The Lok Sabha, the lower house of Parliament, spent a total of nearly one hour in session during its first day back from the winter break before protests by Andhra Pradesh lawmakers, who were upset over a plan to create the state of Telangana, forced an early adjournment.

title: Samsung Reins In the Theatrics for Galaxy S5
description: TOKYO  Dont expect a lot of singing and dancing when Samsung Electronics introduces the next generation of its flagship smartphone, the Galaxy S5, this month.

title: Scientists Warn of New Bird Flu Strain in China
description: Chinese scientists have raised concerns about a new strain of avian influenza that killed an elderly woman in December and infected another person last month.

title: Google Settles Its European Antitrust Case; Critics Remain
description: Google has agreed to a settlement with European competition regulators that leaves the company with a few bruises, yet victorious over all  and would end half a decade of wrangles with antitrust authorities across the globe.

title: CVS Vows to Quit Selling Tobacco Products
description: CVS Caremark, the countrys largest drugstore chain in overall sales, announced on Wednesday that it planned to stop selling cigarettes and other tobacco products by October.

title: What I Took Home From My Business in 2013
description: Pick any workday, and most weekends, between 1986 and the middle of 2013, and you probably could have found me at my desk, doing the work of trying to sign up new customers. That effort ate six or more hours of every day, with the rest devoted to all of the other tasks involved in running a small business. So it was quite a change for me last year, when I finally handed all sales duties off to Don, Nate and Mary.

title: Daily Report: Target Pledges to Speed Adoption of Anti-Fraud Technology
description: A top executive of Target told a Senate committee on Tuesday that the company was accelerating plans to adopt a technology widely used in Europe but rare in the United States that reduces potential for credit card fraud, and lawmakers from both parties called on other businesses to do the same, Hilary Stout reports.

title: Deutsche Bank Is Said to Fire 3 Currency Traders in New York
description: Deutsche Bank has fired three currency traders in New York as regulators worldwide ramp up their investigations into potential manipulation of the $5-trillion-a-day foreign exchange market, according to a person briefed on the matter.

title: Shaun White Pulls Out of New Event to Focus on Halfpipe
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Shaun White does not finish in second place often. Anything less than victory has little meaning for someone who has dominated snowboarding for so many years.

title: Deutsche Bank Names Co-Head of Fixed Income
description: LONDON  Deutsche Bank has chosen a veteran trader in London to serve as the new co-head of its fixed-income trading business.

title: How Google Glass and Netflix Will Fill the Air
description: Cisco has released its annual projection of the growth of mobile broadband over the next five years, and once again its a doozy.

title: What Kind of Thinker Are You?
description: FourSight, based in Evanston, Ill., creates training tools to help individuals and teams solve problems. Below is an abridged version of its assessment to identify thinking styles. Complete each sentence by checking what best describes you.

title: A Creative Class Assignment
description: IN INTRODUCTION TO CREATIVE STUDIES at Buffalo State College, Cyndi Burnett tells her class to walk around campus for an hour and write down 100 things that bother them, then come up with ways to overcome the annoyances. They are using divergent thinking, so the ideas could be outlandish, she says. The main goal is to have them begin to think about their problems as opportunities. Here are edited excerpts from their log entries, and some of the big ideas students developed later in the class.

title: Students Get Creative
description: Readers share their creative problem-solving.

title: Learning to Think Outside the Box
description: IT BOTHERS MATTHEW LAHUE and it surely bothers you: enter a public restroom and the stall lock is broken. Fortunately, Mr. Lahue has a solution. Its called the Bathroom Bodyguard. Standing before his Buffalo State College classmates and professor, Cyndi Burnett, Mr. Lahue displayed a device he concocted from a large washer, metal ring, wall hook, rubber bands and Lincoln Log. Slide the ring in the crack and twist. The door stays shut. Plus, the device fits in a jacket pocket.

title: Philippine Leader Sounds Alarm on China
description: MANILA  President Benigno S. Aquino III called on Tuesday for nations around the world to do more to support the Philippines in resisting Chinas assertive claims to the seas near his country, drawing a comparison to the Wests failure to support Czechoslovakia against Hitlers demands for Czech land in 1938.

title: The Woody Allen Debate
description: In the wake of an open letter by Dylan Farrow, the adoptive daughter of Mia Farrow and Woody Allen, that renewed her allegations of abuse against the filmmaker, the Internet has been awash with responses, examinations and further details.

title: Special Delivery in SoHo
description: Dear Diary:

title: Daily Report: Google Reaches Tentative Deal in European Antitrust Case
description: Google reached a tentative settlement with European antitrust authorities on Wednesday, ending a lengthy competition investigation into the American tech companys practices that could have led to billions of dollars in penalties, Mark Scott reports.

title: A Debt Downgrade for Puerto Rico
description: Standard & Poors lowered the debt of Puerto Rico to junk status on Tuesday, sending shock waves through the investor community, which has long enjoyed the tax-exempt interest generated by the islands municipal bonds. While S.&P. only dropped Puerto Ricos rating to BB+ from BBB-, the one-notch downgrade has intensified a cash squeeze for the commonwealth, Mary Williams Walsh writes in DealBook.

title: Two of Venture Capitals Senior Women Start a New Firm
description: Two of the most senior women in Silicon Valleys venture capital industry are leaving their well-known firms to start a new firm together.

title: The Find | Studio Services
description: After achieving success on the West Coast as one half of the furniture design duo Meier/Ferrer, Charlie Ferrer has branched out on his own and opened a meticulously curated Manhattan showroom that also doubles as his one-bedroom apartment. The 32-year-old has pooled pieces by a number of behind-the-scenes talents, like the sought-after industrial designer Billy Cotton and the lighting expert Kacper Dolatowski, both of whose work had only been available to decorators seeking custom commissions. The handmade designs Ferrer displays, in a range of materials from brass to oak to plaster, feel classic yet current. I dont like to call it a showroom, which feels static, Ferrer says. Its really more of a studio, an active place where artists refine, resolve and share their ideas.

title: Clip: 'Gravity'
description: A scene from the film featuring George Clooney and Sandra Bullock, with music by Steven Price.

title: Rain of Terror
description: OK, thats not helpful  todays class on the Great Recession has been cancelled due to weather. The good news is that its not snowing. The bad is that were getting freezing rain instead. The slides for the cancelled class are here (pdf). Now I have to figure out how to cover all the scheduled material in a reduced semester.

title: Lazards Profit Rises 35%, Aided by Asset Management
description: Lazard said on Wednesday that its profits rose 35 percent in the fourth quarter, as it benefited from improvements in its advisory and asset management businesses.

title: Cyberabads Swagger Returns as Native Son Takes Top Spot at Microsoft
description: HYDERABAD, Andhra Pradesh  Not sinceMarch 24, 2000, when President Clinton addressed a gathering of technology entrepreneurs here, has the Hyderabad software industrys swagger been more pronounced, now that Satya Nadella, a Hyderabad native, has been named the chief executive of Microsoft.

title: Revenue Grows, but Profit Slides 12% at Time Warner
description: Time Warner reported on Wednesday that its profits in the fourth quarter shrank by 12 percent, citing higher programming costs at its Home Box Office and Turner units and reinvestments in the business that cut into the bottom line.

title: Maine Governor Cites Troubling Epidemic of Addicted Babies
description: With the countrys attention focused on overdoses and deaths because of heroin, Gov. Paul R. LePage of Maine on Tuesday turned the spotlight on babies that have been born in his state to drug-addicted mothers.

title: Obamacare and the Reverse Notch
description: Because I was teaching from 6 to 9 last night, Im behind on the big wonkverse thing of the day, the new CBO report that, among other things, increases the budget office estimates of labor supply effects; it now says that affordable care will reduce labor supply by the equivalent of 2 million jobs.

title: 3 Arrested on Drug Charges as Police Pursue Hoffman Case
description: The three had come from different backgrounds and met through New York Citys networks of music, night life and, the police said, illegal drugs.

title: Ice and Snow Create Hazardous Travel Conditions
description: Updated, 1:54 p.m. A second winter storm in three days has created hazardous travel conditions in the Northeast and Midwest, slathering roads and runways with more snow, sleet and layers of ice on Wednesday. The severe weather paralyzed air travel, suspended rail service and caused multiple serious car accidents from Washington to Boston.

title: Colds During Pregnancy Linked to Asthma in Children
description: A new study suggests that having a woman having repeated colds during pregnancy may increase the risk for asthma in her child.

title: Salt Shortage Adds to New York Regions Wintry Mess
description: Normally fleet-footed New Yorkers moved in slow motion on Wednesday as a mix of rain, snow and ice delayed trains, turned roads into a mushy mess and transformed street corners into unleapable lagoons.

title: Gewandhaus and Budapest Orchestra in Great Performers Series
description: The Gewandhaus Orchestra of Leipzig, Germany, led by Riccardo Chailly, will play Bruckners Symphony No. 7, which the orchestra gave its premiere in 1884. Ivan Fischer will conduct the Budapest Festival Orchestra in Brahmss Third Symphony. And Michael Tilson Thomas will conduct the London Symphony Orchestra, with the pianist Yuja Wang, in a program of Gershwin, Britten and Sibelius.

title: Love for the Littlest
description: Some of Valentines Days happiest participants must be children, who can enjoy mimicking the conventions of courtship without suffering its uncertainties. Among the picture books created with the holiday in mind, some seem destined to be bought by adults for one another. These four are more obviously intended  and appropriate  for children: Though all take a different approach, family and friendship are at their hearts.

title: Improving Economic Diversity at the Better Colleges
description: Last month, 80 college and university presidents convened at the White House to discuss ways to get more capable low-income students to and through top colleges.

title: 1914: New Seasons Afternoon Dresses to Have Short, Loose Bolero Jackets
description: The principal occasions on which afternoon dresses are worn at present appear to be teas and receptions at which the tango is danced, for it is curious to notice how much the custom of paying calls is decreasing.

title: Seeking Balance Between Environment and Economy
description: LONDON  Can the European Unions environmental aspirations coexist with industrialists like Lakshmi Mittal, the steel mogul? That question is very much influencing the debate about how Europe should go about combating climate change in the future.

title: Islamic Militants Extend Battle Into Another Iraqi Province
description: BAGHDAD  A powerful jihadist group that has been fighting in Iraqs Anbar region has taken over parts of a neighboring province, seizing three villages on Wednesday after a battle with government forces, according to security officials.

title: This Time, Ready to Take Charge
description: LOS ANGELES  At a production house here last month, a director and editor worked on an episode of the second season of Netflixs House of Cards. In the darkened room, they toggled back and forth over a scene in which Representative Francis Underwood, played by Kevin Spacey, and his wife, Claire, played by Robin Wright, are in their bedroom with a laptop, looking at clips from his political career and talking about the road they have chosen.

title: Reverse Notch Blogging (Extremely Wonkish)
description: OK, this discussion of the CBO report on labor supply effects of health reform has given me a professional itch I need to scratch  I wont rest easy until Ive done some funny diagrams showing how pre-reform work hours could have been too high, so that a reduction of labor supply is actually a move in the right direction.

title: Sharing Is Caring, Unless It Costs You Your Job
description: For travelers trying to economize, the ability to rent someones spare bedroom is a real breakthrough. Cities like New York, London and Paris are easier to visit than they have been in many years.

title: Anheuser-Busch InBev Buys Blue Point Brewing Company
description: Anheuser-Busch InBev, the countrys largest brewer, has agreed to buy the Blue Point Brewing Company in a move that could help it capitalize on the popularity of craft beer.

title: He Can Carry a Tune, but Can He Carry the Race?
description: WASHINGTON  Clay Aiken, the 2003 runner-up on American Idol, officially announced on Wednesday that he is running for Congress in North Carolina. Now it is time to ponder some questions he might face on the stump:

title: French Cultural Services to Present Visual Arts Festival in New York
description: The cultural services of the French Embassy and the French American Cultural Exchange, in a partnership with 46 museums, galleries and universities, mostly in New York City, are presenting ART, a monthlong visual arts festival. The events have an academic tilt: museum curators, administrators, critics and artists will present exhibitions, panels, lectures and workshops meant to explore some of the practical and philosophical issues that animate the art world.

title: Training to Bobsled
description: Chris Fogt is a U.S. Olympic Team bobsledder. He demonstrates some of the exercises in his workout, which is designed to improve the skills his sport requires.

title: New Yorks Top Financial Regulator Investigates Currency Trading
description: The business of trading currencies is in a state of flux as top executives leave and traders are suspended or fired in the face of investigations into potential manipulation of the $5 trillion-a-day foreign exchange market.

title: The Workout: Training to Bobsled
description: Being an Olympic bobsledder is a job that requires a precise balance of speed, muscle and weight. The athletes must explode off the starting line while pushing nearly 500 pounds of bobsled at full speed. They need to be strong enough for a powerful launch so the sled will reach speeds exceeding 90 miles an hour. But the athletes also need to be lean in order to lighten the load and wind resistance as they hunker down in the sled.

title: Maintaining Ethics in the Move From Regulator to Regulated
description: Sheila Bair took a banking job last week  an occasion for breaking out the axes and giving them a good grinding.

title: New York Philharmonics Archives Going Online
description: Just a year after the members of the brand-new New York Philharmonic adopted their first constitution in 1842  players were to be paid $25 a season for three concerts, to rehearse every other Saturday and to be fined $5 for missed concerts  they passed some new bylaws.

title: A Weekend in Hungary, Chosen at Random
description: Was I ferfi or noi?

title: Once Again Navigating an Icy, Snowy New York
description: It snowed again.

title: Roy Chois Taste of South Korea
description: Roy Choi grew up navigating the back streets and alleyways of a dozen Los Angeles neighborhoods. After immigrating from Seoul with his parents at age 2, his childhood was spent exploring South Central, Crenshaw and West Hollywood with a house key tied around his neck, while his parents tried to establish a business.

title: Woodrow Wilsons Family Home Reopens in South Carolina
description: The Woodrow Wilson Family Home in Columbia, S.C., reopens on Feb. 15 after eight years of research and restoration. South Carolinas only presidential site and the only home owned by the parents of the 28th president of the United States features artifacts, period vignettes and multimedia exhibits exploring the Wilson familys life within the context of the Reconstruction era.

title: Times Minute | Google's Antitrust Deal
description: Also on the Minute, Shaun White focuses on the halfpipe and a visit to Germany where to a former N.S.A surveillance hub is now a haven for graffiti artists.

title: Liberals, Obamacare and Work
description: So far, nearly all of the left-of-center responses to the latest C.B.O. projections on Obamacare and workforce participation have emphasized the upside of the downward trend the fact that what were seeing is just the end of job lock in action, which gives parents the freedom to cut their hours, near-retirees the chance to stop working a job they hate a little early, and so on down a sympathetic list.If Obamacare really does cause millions of people to voluntarily leave full-time employment, Matt Yglesias writes in a representative piece, that shows us how much avoidable suffering the earlier system was causing, and you can find roughly similar arguments from Jonathan Cohn, Jonathan Chait, and others too numerous to name.

title: Homes for $450,000
description: This weeks properties include a colonial in Maine, a midcentury modern in Austin and a Craftsman in Nashville.

title: What You Get for ... $450,000

title: F.C.C. to Change Program That Connects Schools to High-Speed Internet Service
description: Updated: Details explaining the F.C.C.s plans have been added to this post. |

title: Wheelies: The Flashing Lights and Free Speech Rights Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Freshly Spruced Up, Historic Tavern on the Green Is Set to Reopen
description: If Central Park is quiet enough, and you listen closely enough, you can almost hear Tavern on the Green exhale in relief.

title: Times Minute | Googles Antitrust Deal
description: In the Video

title: As Minimum Wages Rise, Businesses Grapple With Consequences
description: Dolores Riley has many questions and few answers. Along with every other employer in New Jersey, she woke up on New Years Day to a new minimum wage  $8.25 an hour, up from $7.25. Even before the increase, Ms. Riley, who owns Grammas School House Childcare and Learning Center in Cinnaminson, had been operating on the razors edge.

title: A Domino Theory for Marriage
description: Matchmaking is a dicey endeavor, and not simply because of potential guilt or awkwardness if the pairing doesnt take. Donald Margulies explored more complex ramifications in his Pulitzer Prize-winning drama Dinner With Friends, which is being given a revival by the Roundabout Theater Company. In the play, one couple long ago helped two friends get together and the four were inseparable for years. But one marriage eventually shatters, and Mr. Margulies, instead of focusing on what went wrong, steers our attention to some collateral damage: the surviving couples contentment begins to fray in the aftermath.

title: The Beatles in the U.S., 50 Years On
description: I can still remember the first time I heard a Beatles song. It was the fall of 1964, my second year in an American school after my family moved back from overseas, and I was standing on the corner of 64th street and First Avenue with my friend Larry Campbell. I had a brand new, red, plastic transistor radio, and he tuned it to WABC AM and Love Me Do came on the air. The soundtrack of my life changed at that moment, with The Beatles becoming the recurring and dominant theme.

title: Acrostic
description: Acrostic puzzle for February 9, 2014

title: Acrostic Answer
description: Acrostic answer for February 9, 2014

title: Giving Up the Ultimate Bachelor Pad
description: Before he moved to New York two years ago, Brad Chatellier had been living out of a suitcase. For months, he had traveled the world and pursued wildlife photography.

title: Todd Lodwick to Carry U.S. Flag at Opening Ceremony in Sochi
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Todd Lodwick, who will be competing in his sixth Olympics, was named the United States flag-bearer for Fridays opening ceremony at the Sochi Olympics.

title: Architect Named to Transform Courtyard at MoMA PS1
description: Every summer, an emerging architect gets the chance to transform the outdoor courtyard at MoMA PS1 in Long Island City and, in the process, gets put on the map as a talent worthy of attention.

title: Can This Business Survive a Hike in the Minimum Wage?
description: As discussed in an article we have just published, Dolores Riley, along with every other employer in New Jersey, woke up on New Years Day to a new minimum wage: $8.25 an hour, up from $7.25.

title: LEDs Change Thinking About the Light Bulb
description: Lights are no longer just for lighting.

title: Times May Publish Response From Woody Allen on Dylan Farrows Accusations
description: Woody Allen has asked for, and may get, a chance to respond  in an Op-Ed piece in The Times  to a recent column and blog by Nicholas Kristof in which the filmmakers adopted daughter detailed her memories of his sexually abusing her.

title: Subway Strike Hobbles London, Underground and Above
description: LONDON  A strike on the London Underground crippled much of the citys transportation network on Wednesday, disrupting the plans of millions of travelers and forcing commuters to cram into overcrowded buses and trains or walk or cycle to work.

title: Russia Blocks Yogurt Bound for U.S. Athletes
description: The relationship between the United States and Russia is deeply strained, with recent disagreements over weighty matters like the Syrian conflict, arms control, human rights and the granting of asylum to Edward J. Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor who has leaked troves of documents detailing the governments eavesdropping programs.

title: Gallery | The Stars of New Yorks Old Downtown Scene, Like Youve Never Seen Them Before
description: Three years ago, the French-born, New York-based photographer, stylist and designer Maripol shared a secret box with her assistant, Adle Jancovici. It was full of intimate Polaroids shed taken in the 70s and 80s of herself, lovers and friends. Dont tell anyone, she said. But when Jancovici founded Le Livre Art Publishing in 2011, she knew she wanted to make those photos the subject of the companys first release. Im not good at keeping secrets, she admits. Maripola X, a collection of approximately 171 Polaroids, 69 of her poems and a bonus CD with two of her songs, will be released in a limited edition of 600 signed and numbered copies on Feb. 7 with a signing at Bookmarc.

title: And Now For Some Good News
description: Gail Collins: David, I thought wed go rogue today and talk about things we think President Obama is doing well. Unless, of course, you have a more pressing topic.

title: App Smart: Finding Love
description: As Valentines Day approaches, smartphone apps can play a part in finding love, celebrating love and sharing things love-connected.

title: Sweet Ways to Romance Your Valentine
description: Valentines Day is near and love is in the air. This ancient love fest goes back centuries, but it has gone high tech in recent years. In 2014, this means your smartphone apps can play a part in finding love, celebrating love and sharing things love-connected.

title: A.I.G. Seeks to Delay Bank of America Mortgage Settlement
description: The American International Group is continuing its quest to upend an $8.5 billion settlement between Bank of America and a group of mortgage securities investors.

title: Billie Jean King Wont Join U.S. Olympic Delegation
description: WASHINGTON  Billie Jean King is no longer scheduled to join the presidential delegation to the Olympics in Sochi, Russia, the White House announced Wednesday. King cited the failing health of her mother, Betty Moffitt, who is 91 and lives in Arizona, in her decision to stay behind.

title: Zell Backs Tom Perkinss Arguments About Class Warfare
description: The Silicon Valley venture capitalist Tom Perkins drew no small amount of criticism for drawing parallels between attacks on San Franciscos wealthy class and Kristallnacht, a comparison for which he has since sort of apologized.

title: An Invisible Message from Jane Austen?
description: Objects associated with Jane Austen tend to draw intense scrutiny, whether its the turquoise ring bought at auction by the singer Kelly Clarkson or the proto-paper clips used to attach the manuscript pages of her abandoned novel The Watsons.

title: Commuters Share Woes of Transport Chaos in London
description: Commuters documented the chaos of getting to work on Wednesday, the first day of a strike on the London Underground that disrupted service for millions of people.

title: Inviting a Picky Eater Into the Kitchen Pays Off
description: So far, changing this familys picky eating habits has been easier than expected.

title: Philomenas Audience With the Pope
description: The story of Philomena Lee  which began in the 1950s when she was a teenager forced by nuns to give up her child for adoption and includes an Academy Award-nominated film, Philomena, based on her search for her son decades later  can now add one more chapter.

title: Classical Playlist: Andrew Parrott, Jeroen Van Veen, Ildar Abdrazakov and More
description: MONTEVERDI: LOrfeoTaverner Consort and Players; directed by Andrew Parrott(Avie; 2 CDs)There are many fine recordings of Monteverdis landmark LOrfeo, the first great opera, composed in 1607. A superb new recording features the distinguished conductor Andrew Parrott, directing the impressive singers and period-instrument performers of the Taverner Consort & Players. This account is exceptional for its fluidity, elegance and tenderness. The cast is headed by the poignant tenor Charles Daniels in the title role. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: What Made Me | Rachel Comey
description: The fashion designer talks about the cool teenagers she observed growing up, her early days in New York City and a very special gift her grandmother gave her over the course of many years.

title: Pussy Riot Members Take Tour to New York
description: Two young women from the Russian punk group Pussy Riot said Wednesday that their 21-month incarceration in Russias penal system for having staged a political protest in a Moscow cathedral had emboldened them to speak out more forcefully against President Vladimir V. Putin, partly because of the global support they received.

title: Elton John Plans Animated Film of Technicolor Dreamcoat
description: LOS ANGELES  Elton John on Wednesday said that his movie production company had acquired the film rights to Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat and planned to make a feature-length animated musical.

title: Iraqi Tribes to Take Lead in Falluja Fight, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Iraqi Army is planning to cordon off a key Sunni city now occupied by jihadists so that Sunni tribes can lead the mission to secure it one neighborhood at a time, a senior State Department official told Congress on Wednesday.

title: French-Canadian Style in Portneuf
description: A three-bedroom French-Canadian-style home, built in 1820, is on the market for $493,993.

title: House Hunting in ... Quebec
description: A RESTORED FRENCH-CANADIAN-STYLE HOME IN QUEBEC

title: What Tim Duncan Deserves, but Never Seems to Receive
description: We know what N.B.A. All-Star voting has typically been: a chance for fans to participate in the selection process for a showcase. No registration is required to prove that one knows Kobe Bryant from Krusty the Clown. Its a popularity contest that cannot be taken seriously.

title: What Made Me | Rachel Comey, Fashion Designer
description: Over the last 12 years, the designer Rachel Comey has built a cult following for her distinctive prints, feminine dresses and signature jumpsuits, not to mention the personal relationships she has fostered with some of her most loyal fans. In the first installment of What Made Me, a new T video series that explores the influences and life experiences that shape creative figures, Comey talks about the cool teenagers she observed growing up in Connecticut, her early days in New York City and a very special gift her grandmother gave her over the course of many years. Comey, who plans to open her first boutique in SoHo this spring, will show her fall 2014 collection tonight in Red Hook, Brooklyn.

title: First the Doughnuts, Then the Debates
description: A shout-out to whoever brought the brownies to Beertown. They were tasty, as were the butter cookies. I didnt try the powdered doughnuts or the cake  I was busy getting my souvenir T-shirt  though they looked a bit too sweet.

title: A Reports Real Message: It Wasnt About Health Care
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: New Recordings Made the Old-Fashioned Way
description: It started off as a way to put an unusual acquisition to use. In 2010, Alex Steyermark, a director and music supervisor for films, and Lavinia Jones Wright, a music journalist, found a couple of Presto Model K8 recording machines, and though these 78-r.p.m. directto-disc recorders are generally regarded as antiques, of relatively low utility in these days of digital sound, they decided to buy them.

title: No, Obamacare Isnt Killing 2 Million Jobs
description: Opponents of the Affordable Care Act yesterday seized on a Congressional Budget Office report on the labor market, claiming it indicated that health reform would kill 2 million jobs. Actually, as our editorial on the subject explained, the C.B.O. predicted a reduction in the number of full-time workers. That may sound like a distinction without a difference, but its not. Job-killing implies layoffs; whereas the report found that many workers would choose to leave their positions  because they no longer have to depend on their employers for health insurance.

title: From Breaking Bad to Broadway
description: Bryan Cranston visits the New York Times photo archive in preparation for his role as President Lyndon B. Johnson in the Broadway play All the Way.

title: Presidential Chemistry
description: With his rich baritone hinting of the American West and craggy handsome looks, Bryan Cranston seems custom built to play outsize heartland characters. Where was he, you wonder, when Sam Shepard was writing Buried Child and True West? Even at his most relaxed, when he leans in and taps your knee to drive home a point, you dont want to be caught spacing out.

title: The Gun Report: February 5, 2014
description: Researchers at Chicagos Cook County Hospital began screening victims of urban traumagunshot wounds, stabbings and other violent crimesfor post-traumatic stress disorder in 2011. While they expected to find some cases, they were shocked at just how many: 42 percent of the 307 patients surveyed had signs of the disorder. Patients with gunshot wounds were 13 times as likely as those with falls and twice as likely as those in a car accident to test positive for PTSD.

title: Lazard Swims With the Big Fish
description: Lazard has put its feet firmly in the big boys camp. The advisory and asset management firm didnt just make progress on financial targets that its chief executive, Kenneth M. Jacobs, set two years ago. Its bankers also goosed revenue in the second half of the year. That makes Lazard look more like Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan Chase than smaller rivals like Evercore Partners and Greenhill.

title: Citadel Defied a Market Slump in January
description: In a dismal month for the stock market, one big hedge fund company in Chicago managed to record gains.

title: Orley: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Hurdles Ahead for Beckham and M.L.S. in Miami
description: MIAMI  The soccer star David Beckham delivered a long-awaited but in many ways provisional commitment to Miami on Wednesday when he confirmed it as the future home of a Major League Soccer expansion team that he will own  alongside partners not yet named  and run.

title: Whats Happening off the Runway During New York Fashion Week
description: New York Fashion Week begins today, and out-of-towners and locals alike are making their final preparations for another season of back-to-back shows and snow-covered streets. Here, a guide to surviving (and enjoying) the festivities.

title: CBO: ACA OK
description: What with the fuss over the CBO estimates of employment effects of health reform  Appendix C  everyone seems to have overlooked Appendix B, on the reforms effects in doing what it was supposed to do: cover the uninsured. How has the disastrous initial rollout affected CBOs projections about reforms near future?

title: Jack Butler, a Top Bankruptcy Lawyer, Will Move to Hilco
description: One of the bankruptcy bars biggest names is planning to leave the law to take up a different perch in the world of restructuring.

title: Economists Sound the Alarm on Deflation in Europe
description: PARIS  Whether or not Mario Draghi and his European Central Bank colleagues plan to do anything about it at the monthly meeting Thursday, many economists are sounding the alarm. It is time, they say, to act defensively against the danger of deflation.

title: Germanys Clean-Energy Plan Faces Resistance to Power Lines
description: BERLIN  Germanys resolve to embrace a clean-energy future may soon face another test of not-in-my-backyard public resistance.

title: For Seattles Celebration, Russell Wilson Is an Unofficial M.V.P.
description: Russell Wilson was the most valuable player on Sunday when Seattle routed Denver to win the Super Bowl. Wilson did not win the actual award  that honor went to one of his teammates, linebacker Malcolm Smith, who returned an interception for a touchdown and also recovered a fumble.

title: 3 Arrests, but Violin Is Not Recovered
description: Two men and a woman have been arrested in the recent theft of the Stradivarius violin played by the concertmaster of the Milwaukee Symphony Orchestra, Milwaukee police officials announced Wednesday. But the instrument, which dates from 1715 and is valued at $5 million, is still missing.

title: Instagram Envy Chain: Sochi Edition
description: This years Olympic Games in Sochi, Russia, have come under some criticism for their expense and expansiveness, so Iwanted to see how Russian photojournalists were covering Sochi on their Instagram accounts, given that Russian authorities have apparently tried to police the types of images to come out of the area. Time for another Instagram envy chain!

title: European Official Takes Measured Tone on Ukraine Aid
description: KIEV, Ukraine  On a visit to Ukraine to try to prod the countrys embattled president and his opponents into resolving a volatile standoff, Europes foreign policy chief, Catherine Ashton, said Wednesday that a package of economic assistance was in the works but dampened hopes of a sudden infusion of cash.

title: An Italian Hotel Will Be a Guest Star in California
description: Amalfi Coast cuisine and style will merge with those of Los Angeles from Feb. 19 to 26, when Shutters on the Beach in Santa Monica, Calif., will host Le Sirenuse, the hotel in Positano, Italy.

title: CBS Will Broadcast Thursday Night Games
description: CBS decided that carrying Sunday afternoon N.F.L. games, playoff matchups and, every third year, a Super Bowl was not enough. So it announced Wednesday that it would carry eight Thursday night games in 2014 on a one-year contract that was believed to be worth at least $250 million.

title: When Love Hits, It Can Really Send You Reeling
description: Almost, Maine, that darling of regional theaters, now back in New York, is basically a higher-concept and more clever version of Hollywood hits like Love Actually and Valentines Day. But this rom-com leans on shrewd writing rather than star power in its nine interlocking love stories, all happening in the same New England town on the same moonless night.

title: Frozen Is the Soundtrack of the Season
description: The Grammy Awards last week brought expected sales gains for some of the nights big stars, like Lorde and Daft Punk. But the top seller on Billboards album chart this week has nothing to do with the Grammys: the soundtrack to Frozen, an animated Disney film, earned its fourth No. 1 with 94,000 copies sold, according to Nielsen SoundScan.

title: Study of Drug for Blood Clots Caused a Stir, Records Show
description: The makers of the blood-thinning drug Pradaxa were so worried that an internal research paper would damage drug sales that some employees not only pressured the author to revise it, but suggested it should be quashed altogether, according to newly unsealed legal documents.

title: Below the Line: Scoring Gravity
description: The previous film scores by the British composer Steven Price have included action comedies like Edgar Wrights Worlds End and Joe Cornishs Attack the Block. The music often competed with the busy sounds of action. But his latest composition, for Alfonso Cuarns space thriller Gravity, is frequently competing with silence, or the voice of its main character Ryan Stone (Sandra Bullock).

title: Clip: 'The Lego Movie'
description: A scene from the film directed by Chris Miller and Phil Lord.

title: Google Appoints Its Most Senior Woman to Run YouTube
description: The most senior woman at Google, Susan Wojcicki, who has been a senior vice president of advertising and commerce, is changing jobs at the company to run YouTube.

title: South by Southwest Announces Midnight Slate
description: This year, South by Southwest audiences in Austin, Tex., will witness a frightful forest creature, a killer loose at a musical theater camp and yet one more teenager who has sold her soul to the devil. Its another installment of the festivals Midnighters program, which organizers announced Wednesday.

title: New York Fashion Week: Michael Bastian Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Rebecca Smeyne.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Central African Republic, South Sudan, Pakistan and New York.

title: Missing Sprite Leaves Only Her Shadow
description: Joyce Carol Oates, now in her mid-70s, is the author of some 140 books  approximately two a year from the moment she was born. I half expect someday to learn that she kept a real-time journal of her eviction from the birth canal.

title: A Singular Artist Is Staking His Claim
description: At a certain point, it all comes down to voice. The story hip-hop has often told about itself is that its a game of lyrical one-upmanship, an ecosystem of artistes looking for words others couldnt possibly use better. But just as often  more often  its a runway show of vocal eccentricity. Words, and how theyre arranged, take a back seat to how theyre delivered, the fresh paint on the tired old car.

title: Early Start to Upfronts, as The Real Cast Meets Advertisers
description: Upfront Nation, rejoice. It is that time again, when purveyors of video programming on television and online woo marketers and agencies to spend advertising dollars on commercial time ahead of the coming season.

title: Even the Dancers Huddle for Warmth
description: All dancers, but in particular those devoted to ballet, spend their lives in front of mirrors. Im so glad they cant see themselves in Bal de Couture, a dismal Peter Martins creation that dates to New York City Ballets 2012 fall gala, with costumes by Valentino. Sadly, it wasnt, as Tuesdays program promised, a Scenic Delight.

title: Coca-Cola to Buy 10% Stake in Green Mountain Coffee
description: Coca-Cola agreed on Wednesday to buy a 10 percent stake in Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, as it seeks to cement ties with the fast-growing coffee company.

title: User Growth for Twitter Starts to Slow, and Stock Dips
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Twitter has finally acknowledged what any newcomer could have told the company within five minutes of signing up: The messaging service is too hard to use.

title: Toward a Kingdom Without Kitsch
description: The colorful blocks and cheerful figures of the Lego world have entertained generation after generation of children worldwide and remain a source of artistic expression for adults, too. Now, theyve been assembled for the first time in a full-length feature film.

title: Your Best Selfie
description: A test of four top smartphones to find out which forward-facing camera takes the best selfie.

title: Narcissists Dream: Selfie-Friendly Phone
description: Selfie was Oxford Dictionaries word of the year in 2013. And selfies are powerful business; #me is the third-most-common tag on Instagram, appended to more than 184 million photos, according to the apps Web viewer, Webstagram. (Numbers 1 and 2 are #love and #instagood.)

title: Youre Who? Not Even Close
description: With the alighting of fashions air-smooching society, this weeks tempest of runway shows, private dinners and after-parties offers endless opportunities for gate crashers seeking social validation and free vodka. But prospective infiltrators beware: the sentinels of such entry points have added new weapons to their defensive arsenal.

title: Qatari Court Rejects U.S. Couples Request to Return Home
description: DOHA, Qatar  An American couple standing trial on charges they starved their 8-year-old adopted African daughter to death in Qatar last year were dealt a setback on Wednesday when a court denied their request for permission to visit their two other adopted children, who are in the United States.

title: A Last Centennial Tribute to Britten, in Five Songs
description: Benjamin Brittens centennial year ended on Dec. 31. But 2013 brought few tributes to him lovelier than that delivered on Monday evening at Alice Tully Hall by the mezzo-soprano Sasha Cooke.

title: With El-Erian Leaving, Pimco Says It Is Better
description: Wall Street was stunned when Mohamed A. El-Erian announced last month that he would step down as chief executive and co-chief investment officer of Pimco, the giant asset manager where he was considered the heir apparent.

title: Ballads With a Big Dose of Melodrama
description: When a voraciously needy performer stirs up an audience by wringing the last drop of melodrama from a song, its known in the trade as schmacting. Audiences tend to embrace such shameless hamming. And on Thursday evening, the Broadway veteran Michele Lee, who is 71 but looks two decades younger and has stamina and enthusiasm to burn, schmacted up a storm at 54 Below, where she appeared with a pop quintet directed by Ron Abel.

title: Channeling the Style and Emotional Heat of a Tuneful Era
description: Whatever happened to uncomplicated male passion in pop music? That question nagged at me during John Lloyd Youngs nostalgic concert of rock and R&B ballads at Caf Carlyle on Tuesday evening.

title: You Can Run, but Dont Hide These Shoes
description: Sneakers have never been more chic. At the couture shows in Paris last month, first Dior and then Chanel showed spring confections with sneakers, albeit bedazzled ones. At Chanel, every model strode the runway in sneakers embellished with lace, tweed, python and pearls. It may be a stretch to think that Jennifer Lawrence will wear haute couture trainers with her Dior on the red carpet, but they seem totally reasonable with everything else. The ones here, which include Rick Owenss architectural wonders designed in collaboration with Adidas, are surely as statement-making as any pair of heels. Expect to see some of them in the front row this week.

title: New York Fashion Week: Orley Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Pussy Riot at The New York Times
description: Pussy Riot members Maria Alyokhina, 25, and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova, 24, visited The New York Times editorial board Wednesday morning. They were on The Colbert Report Tuesday night and will appear at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn tonight. This is why theyre getting so much attention.

title: Simplicity of Movement Translated Into Something Much Larger
description: Some of the dance steps, phrases and constructions by the choreographer Pam Tanowitz are among the finest being made anywhere today. They feature memorable footwork, strikingly elegant and witty combinations of lower- and upper-body movement, and complex, subtle, fascinating uses of stage space. And yet shes an eccentric. Whats notable  especially in the 50-minute double bill of world premieres that opened at the Joyce Theater on Tuesday  is that her eccentricity is intimately connected to orthodoxy. Much of her dance vocabulary is taken from ballet and from Merce Cunningham technique, both of which she employs in ways that should often impress devotees of either genre.

title: Disney Reports Strong First-Quarter Earnings, Helped by Animated Film Frozen
description: LOS ANGELES  A white-hot Walt Disney Company reported a 33 percent increase in quarterly profit on Wednesday, as the animated musical Frozen demonstrated why media giants still chase movie hits although investors prefer less risky pursuits.

title: Louise Brough Clapp, Tennis Champion at Midcentury, Dies at 90
description: Louise Brough Clapp, whose powerful serve-and-volley game propelled her to 35 championships in Grand Slam tennis tournaments of the 1940s and 50s and made her one of the most brilliant doubles players in the womens game, died on Monday in Vista, Calif. She was 90.

title: Jeff Westheimers Imaginative Play at Bridge Semifinals
description: Jeff Westheimer made a very imaginative opening bid in the diagramed deal from the semifinals of the 1970 team trials. Westheimer, one of the top players of the game in the 1960s, 70s and 80s, died on Monday at 79, in New York City, his hometown.

title: A Generous Spritz to Set the Mood
description: Of all the things that stood out at Prabal Gurungs show last year  the clear plastic curtain, the satiny pencil skirts, the mannequin-like models  fashion editors still recall the one thing they couldnt see: the smell.

title: Fall 2014 Show Calendar
McConaughey, Savoring the Underdog Role
description: Over his career, Matthew McConaughey has transformed from romantic comedy star to character actor. No matter the role, Mr. McConaughey says that he loves feeling like the underdog.

title: Potions, Lotions, Emulsions, Decisions
description: The fashion designer Nanette Lepore, 49, who recently dressed New York Mayor Bill de Blasios wife, Chirlane McCray, and their daughter, Chiara de Blasio, for his inauguration ceremony, is releasing a line of products for the home this month. Born in Youngstown, Ohio, she lives and works in Manhattan. Her beauty habits, like her fashion, are flirtatious and youthful.

title: Olympics Spotlight for Russias Musical Profile
description: Valery Gergiev is considered a lock to conduct. The Russian diva Anna Netrebko is widely suspected to be singing. And a host of top Russian ballet stars are expected to dance.

title: Ex-King of Rom-Coms Finds Serious Success
description: Theres a little private thing that Matthew McConaughey likes to do to relax, a sort of call and response with his own body, a chest-thumping, masculine-humming rhythmic trance that he finds centering.

title: Fortress of Solitude
description: In 1978, the English decorator Charlotte Scott decamped to the remote, semi-mountainous region of Andalusia. Fourteen years and four children later, she opened the doors at Trasierra, a 400-acre Anglo-pastoral guesthouse that she transformed from a crumbling 16th-century olive mill into a sanctuary of whitewashed courtyards, cushioned verandas and resplendent gardens. Starting in April, Scotts 29-year-old daughter, Amber, who trained in Nepal and London as a yoga teacher and massage therapist, will be offering guests daily yoga classes. There will also be weekly retreats focused on meditation, hiking and massage sessions, combined with a delicious menu created by her sister Gioconda. Though Ambers full-immersion programs happen in May and October, made-to-measure stays for parties of six or more are welcome year-round.

title: How Did Your Recent Peace Corps Service Affect Your Life?
description: Serving in the Peace Corps can be both challenging and rewarding. Former Peace Corps volunteers often have good stories to tell  about their experiences in the field, what they learned and how those experiences shaped their lives after their service ended. Times journalists are writing about recent Peace Corps volunteers.

title: How Eroding the Middle Hits Economic Growth
description: Since my article on Monday about the narrowing of the customer base for midtier restaurants, retailers and other consumer-oriented businesses like hotels and casinos, much of the discussion has focused on what that trend says about whether and how the American middle class is indeed shrinking.

title: And on Drums, Jazzmen Who Take the Lead
description: The first and last sounds on 303, Rudy Roystons sit-up-and-take-notice debut album, involve a tranquil, mysterious, cooled-out funk groove, like an interlude on an early-2000s neo-soul production. Anchored by a soulfully simple bass vamp, with a smoky overlay of horns and guitar, the tune  Mimi Sunrise, an opener that resurfaces as a hidden track  calls barely any attention to Mr. Roystons specific purview, which is drumming. Therell be time for all that, he seems to imply.

title: The Fashion Diaspora: Designer Shows Spread Out
description: Driver, thank God youre here. Take me to ... where again?

title: Presidio Asks Filmmaker to Try Again
description: National parks are open to everyone, even to the filmmaker George Lucas. That is the message from the Presidio Trust in San Francisco, which this week rejected proposals by Mr. Lucas and two other finalists to build a cultural institution of distinction on prized bayside parkland and then turned right around and invited him back.

title: Small Dreams Set Afire on Marcos-Era Streets
description: Lino Brockas Manila in the Claws of Light begins with a whisper and ends with a howl. In between, there are grace notes, escalating horrors and the peripatetic journey of a country mouse, Julio (Rafael Roco Jr., later known as Bembol Roco), in the big city. Its a story of struggle, survival, endurance and defeat that Brocka, perhaps the most celebrated of Filipino directors, filmed down and dirty in Manila when the Philippines was still in the grip of the dictator Ferdinand E. Marcos. Brocka, a political activist as well as a prolific filmmaker, died in a car accident in 1991 at 52, and is ready for rediscovery.

title: Unsealed Court Documents in Pradaxa Case
description: Unsealed court documents made public by a federal judge who is overseeing thousands of lawsuits filed by patients and their families who say that Pradaxas manufacturer failed to properly warn them about the risks of taking the drug.

title: Times Minute | Vatican Sexual Abuse
description: A U.N. panel assails the Vatican over sexual abuse by priests. Also on the Minute, New York's wintry mess and an international yogurt feud between the United States and Russia.

title: Times Minute | Vatican Sexual Abuse
description: In the Video

title: The Life of a Poet Allergic to Endings
description: LYNCHBURG, Va.  It was snowing hard on a recent afternoon, but Anne Spencers house glowed like a Vanessa Bell mural, more Bloomsbury than Old Virginia. Though Spencer, an iconoclastic poet and Harlem Renaissance figure, died in 1975, her singular house, with its purple, yellow and green rooms, its boldly patterned wallpapers and upholstery, its sheaves of newspaper clippings, photographs, N.A.A.C.P. ledgers, political fliers and her own copious writings that spill out of notebooks and climb the walls (Spencer was an enthusiastic wall-writer), is so vibrant that you would swear she was still living there.

title: Like a Strand Within a Strand
description: Fabrics featuring art by Sonia Delaunay, Marc Chagall and Alexander Calder are among the 200 objects in Artist Textiles: Picasso to Warhol, at the Fashion and Textile Museum in London. The exhibition, which runs through May 17, also includes a Joan Mir dress and a Salvador Dal tie.

title: Breaking From Its Usual Pattern
description: The new Lotta Jansdotter collection for Dansk is a departure for this nearly 60-year-old American company, which routinely hires Scandinavians to design its goods. We havent always been known for pattern, said Glenn DeStefano, Dansks president. Weve been about shape and high design, with wood and contrasting materials. Ms. Jansdotter, who was born on an island between Sweden and Finland, has produced organic forms and whimsical scribbles ever since she started her company in 1996. Here, the imagery floats on plates and repeats on cups and bowls meant to be mixed and matched. Available at Bed Bath & Beyond, the line features five dinnerware patterns and four additional motifs on mugs and bowls only.

title: Clay Aiken, Able to Carry a Tune but Hoping for a District
description: WASHINGTON  North Carolina has become difficult terrain for Democrats since the Republican-controlled legislature redrew congressional districts in 2011 with the goal of more or less eliminating them from the states House delegation.

title: My Brothers Bunkmate
description: Caleb and Harper cannot share a bedroom forever. For now, Rachel Goldstein cites a number of not-unconvincing reasons to keep her 7-year-old son and 4-year-old daughter together in the familys Park Slope brownstone.

title: Sales at Gretel Home, Love Adorned and Others
description: Gretel Home is discounting many items up to 60 percent, while supplies last (a Folk Stripe tray by Ary Trays, originally $59, is about $35; the Ombre House money box by Ferm Living, originally $39, is about $23); 786-247-9003, gretelhome.com.

title: Outfitting an Atelier in Mine and Yours
description: Piet Boon, the Dutch architect and designer, recently opened a temporary studio at 404 Park Avenue South (28th Street), in a 1917 building that is being converted into 58 luxury apartments. Mr. Boon led the design team that outfitted the development, called Huys. He has furnished his atelier with his own creations, including Sam chairs upholstered in indigo fabric, shown with an oak Gerrit table. The studio also features other designers works, like Roderick Voss MaMa vase (on table), Frederik Molenschots brass numeral sculptures (on wall) and a Great JJ floor lamp by Centro Stile in Italy (shown in white). Though these items cannot be purchased on site, Mr. Boons staff can direct you to a dealer. The ground-floor space will be open until June, and then it will give way to a bank. Information: huys-nyc.com.

title: New York Fashion Week: Jack Spade Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Kevin Tachman.

title: Creating Effortless Luxury
description: Reed Krakoffs collection will be his first since leaving Coach.

title: Flocks, Flecks and Flicks
description: Jennifer Lawrences wardrobe in American Hustle was one thing, but lets talk about her kitchen, with its matching blue blinds and phone. Judy Becker, the movies production designer, was responsible for the 1970s-inspired dcor, every square foot of flocked wallpaper. Now she has her first Oscar nomination (shared with Heather Loeffler, the set decorator). Speaking by phone from Cincinnati, where she is working on the Todd Haynes film Carol, Ms. Becker, who said she is in her late 40s, described her immersion in disco-era taste as an education. She even acquired some stuff. (This interview has been edited and condensed.)

title: Boutique Sinks for Small Bathrooms
description: As far as most people are concerned, a bathroom is a bathroom, and there are only a couple of things its good for. Thats not how John Beckmann sees it.

title: Plucky Horses, Lucky Year
description: This Lunar New Year is not just the Year of the Horse, but the Year of the Wood Horse. In recognition of the pairing, Lane Crawford, the Chinese luxury department store, commissioned Squint Limited to make a lucky group of rocking horses.

title: A Place to Park Himself
description: James van der Velden wanted something out of the ordinary in a home. But not in the conventional sense. He wasnt interested, for example, in any of the beautiful 17th-century townhouses this city is known for.

title: Behind the Garage Door
description: An architect renovates a 1950s garage, turning it into a home filled with antiques (but not the four-wheeled type).

title: With Snow Sports, a New Olympic Vocabulary
description: Snowboarders and skiers have an extensive repertoire of spins and flips. Some tricks are named for their technical requirements, others for their flair. Here, some of the best riders describe the joy and fear that come with these jaw-dropping maneuvers.

title: Making His Name His Own
description: Dana Taylor, a model, stood straight as a maypole as Reed Krakoff circled, paused, then peered intently at his handiwork. Ms. Taylor was wearing Mr. Krakoffs cobalt-blue sleeveless officers coat, a sample from the fall collection he will show on Wednesday, a piece stripped to its essentials: welted seams, slant pockets and a pair of outsize lapels its only embellishment.

title: The Victims of Human Trafficking
description: To the Editor:

title: Death Panels: A Pine Box of Ones Own
Reversing the Drug Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: Sorry? Not Really
description: To the Editor:

title: Bushwick Gang Is Putting Its Brand Back Together
description: Scott Campbell, a tattoo artist to celebrities like Marc Jacobs and Sting who has lately made a name as a fine artist, recalls the shock he felt upon boarding an flight from New York to Los Angeles a few years ago and seeing a passenger wearing a pair of jeans by his go-to denim brand, an obscure label known as Deth Killers of Bushwick.

title: Video: This Teacher Isnt Stuffy
description: MICHAEL DONKOR

title: Jury in SAC Case Requests Documents Related to Defense Witness
description: Deliberating for a second day, jurors in the insider trading trial of Mathew Martoma, a former top portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors, on Wednesday requested documents supporting the defenses claim that he is not guilty.

title: U.S. to Return Painting to Poland That Was Seized by Nazis
description: An 18th-century painting that disappeared from Warsaws national museum about 70 years ago during Nazi occupation will be returned to Poland by the United States government on Thursday, officials said.

title: The Opportunity Society
description: To the Editor:

title: Klinsmann: The Door Is Still Open for World Cup Roster
description: After a monthlong January training camp and an exhibition victory over South Korea, United States national soccer team members have gone their separate ways until the team's next game: an international friendly at Ukraine on March 5.

title: A Closet Is the Highest Form of Flattery
description: A few weeks ago, the designer Lisa Perry gave a tour of her 300-square-foot closet at her art-saturated Manhattan penthouse on Sutton Place. The closet, built a year ago, is nestled between the kitchen, where there is a Larry Rivers painting, and the bedroom suite, with its entrance demarcated by one of Damien Hirsts medicine cabinet sculptures.

title: Apple Takes Down a Bitcoin App
description: Apple has taken down one of the last remaining iPhone mobile applications that allowed users to buy and sell Bitcoin.

title: The Courtship of Bill de Blasio
description: In the waning days of the Michael R. Bloomberg administration, there was no shortage of tributes to the outgoing mayor as he finished up a 12-year run in City Hall, including a private dinner given at the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Dec. 3 by the designers Oscar de la Renta and Diane von Furstenberg.

title: Heat System Called Door to Target for Hackers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Investigators say they believe they have identified the entry point through which hackers got into Targets systems, zeroing in on the remote access granted through the retailers computerized heating and cooling software, according to two people briefed on the inquiry.

title: Preserving Routine Amid Rising Violence
description: BAGHDAD  Struggling for a decade against Iraqs misery, Hani Jari Hattab assembled what passed for an empire in his neighborhood, including a cellphone kiosk, a computer store and a supermarket stocked with goods from abroad.

title: If the Size Fits, Build a Following
description: At 5 feet 8 inches, with a slender build, Peter Manning says that finding clothes for his proportions has been a challenge his entire adult life.

title: Skiers Risk Injury to Fuel Progression
description: In this episode of Teton Gravity Researchs Behind The Line, professional skiers Dash Longe and Dylan Hood search for new terrain and new tricks in the Selkirk Mountains.

title: Long-Form Journalism
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Write an Editorial
description: The New York Timess editorial page editor Andrew Rosenthal provides seven tips for writing an effective editorial.

title: Openings, Events and Sales Starting the Week of Feb. 6
description: Fashion Week

title: A Solution for Bad Teaching
description: PHILADELPHIA  ITS no secret that tenured professors cause problems in universities. Some choose to rest on their laurels, allowing their productivity to dwindle. Others develop tunnel vision about research, inflicting misery on students who suffer through their classes.

title: Video: Skiers Risk Injury to Fuel Progression
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: In Spain, Fired for Speaking Out
description: MADRID  FOUR decades ago, I interviewed the New York Times columnist Tom Wicker about the relationship between the government and the press. It was the Watergate era, and journalism appealed to me as a noble calling.

title: Gloria Leonard, Publisher, Pornography Star and Advocate, Dies at 73
description: Gloria Leonard, who became a pornographic film star in her 30s and then a mens magazine publisher and a prominent spokeswoman for her industry, died on Monday in Waimea, Hawaii. She was 73.

title: The Stories We Tell
description: We tell ourselves stories in order to live, Joan Didion famously wrote in her essay collection The White Album. Its a haunting line, because its so universally applicable. We tell ourselves stories not only for profound reasons but for mundane ones as well: to process the ambiguous and complex events that unfold every day around us, or even to try to understand the issues presented in a major Supreme Court case.

title: Babys All Right
description: As the Williamsburg scene drowns under waves of tourists and condo dwellers, Babys All Right has swiftly become a night-life preserver. The expansive bar, restaurant and music space, which opened in October on Broadway, has hosted an event for Opening Ceremony, held a New Years party with a performance by Dev Hynes, and booked acts like Smith Westerns. Among Southside insiders, nights now begin or end here.

title: Williams, the Princess and the Gender Pay Gap
description: One day when my twins, a boy and a girl, were about 7 years old, we were out running errands.

title: Michelle Obama Urges Students to Apply for College Aid
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  Michelle Obama told a group of high school students and parents on Wednesday not to let financial concerns stand in the way of a college education as she urged them to apply for federal student aid.

title: Magic Johnson Steps In to Rescue Los Angeles Sparks
description: LOS ANGELES  More than three decades after guiding the Los Angeles Lakers from mediocrity to excellence, and nearly two years after helping purchase the bankrupt Los Angeles Dodgers, Magic Johnson rescued another local team.

title: Israel: Final Approval Is Given on East Jerusalem Apartments
description: A city committee on Wednesday gave final approval for more than 500 new apartments in Jewish neighborhoods of East Jerusalem, a routine bureaucratic step that nonetheless could cause ripples in Washingtons efforts to broker a peace agreement between Israel and the Palestinians. The neighborhoods, in territory Israel captured during the 1967 war and later annexed, are considered illegal settlements by most of the world. Saeb Erekat, the chief Palestinian negotiator, has insisted that such moves undermine the peace process, and on Wednesday was quoted on the Times of Israel, a website, as saying, The international community must hold Israel accountable for this policy.

title: Tech Industry Flexes Muscle in California Race
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif.  Here in the land of technology start-ups, Ro Khanna is its political version. Backed by many of Silicon Valleys top investors and executives at Google, Facebook, Yahoo and other tech companies, Mr. Khanna, a 37-year-old patent lawyer who has never held elected office, has mounted an aggressive campaign for the seat from the 17th Congressional District in the heart of the Valley.

title: Trading Faces and Fashion in Ultas New Online Campaign
description: COSMETICS advertising often features celebrities, but even the most optimistic consumers recognize that makeup might not make them look like a starlet or supermodel.

title: Investors Appear to Shrug Off Puerto Ricos Debt Downgrade
description: Investors faith in Puerto Ricos debt appeared undaunted on Wednesday after Standard & Poors cut the islands credit rating to junk a day earlier.

title: At 90, This Doctor Is Still Calling
description: We in journalism tend to cover airplane crashes, corrupt officials and loathsome criminals with gusto, but lets take a break and applaud a hero.

title: Doctors Charged in Drug Scheme at Clinic Controlled by Traffickers, Authorities Say
description: It is not an uncommon scene: a waiting room filled with patients hoping to see a doctor. But the crowd of up to 100 people that gathered each day outside the Astramed clinic at 1228 Southern Boulevard in the Bronx, clamoring to get a prescription for the painkiller oxycodone, was a different story, the authorities say.

title: Calling All Candidates
description: I dont know if youve noticed, but were now in an election year.

title: My Husbands Things
description: My husband, Stuart, died last June after a decade-long struggle with cancer. He was 77 years old, a former journalist and public relations executive, a marathon runner, and a man beloved and respected by family and friends.

title: Virtual School on Snow Days
Study Suggests Misplaced Fears in Longer Childbirths
description: Epidural anesthesia lengthens the second stage of labor, the one in which women push. But a study published on Wednesday has found that epidurals are associated with an even longer duration in the second stage than is generally recognized, suggesting that some women may be subject to unnecessary interventions by doctors who wrongly fear labor has become prolonged.

title: A Different Gates Is Returning to Microsoft
description: SEATTLE  The last time Bill Gates played an active role at Microsoft, as chief software architect, he witnessed the company muffing its earliest efforts to become a major player in search, smartphones and tablet computers.

title: Party Predictions Differ in Texas on Impact of New Voter ID Law
description: DALLAS  Texas is preparing for the first major test of its hotly debated new voter ID law as Democrats and Republicans offer sharply differing assessments of its impact on the states March 4 primary.

title: Jihadist Return Is Said to Drive Attacks in Egypt
description: CAIRO  In just the last two weeks, Islamist militants have detonated a car bomb at the gates of the capitals security headquarters, gunned down a senior Interior Ministry official in broad daylight and shot down a military helicopter over Sinai with a portable surface-to-air missile.

title: A Missing Argument on Contraceptives
description: One of the most anticipated showdowns of the Supreme Courts current term will take place March 25, when the justices are scheduled to hear two cases brought by secular, for-profit corporations whose owners want an exemption, based on their religious beliefs, from the requirement that employers health plans cover the full range of contraceptive services without a co-payment.

title: Knee-Deep in Traffic-Jam Scandal, Christie Keeps Talking
description: He is Oscar quality, this governor, even during this walk across his bridge of sighs.

title: The U.N. Confronts the Vatican
description: A United Nations report excoriated the Vatican on Wednesday for failing to live up to international commitments to protect children, finding the widespread sexual abuse of children by priests had been compounded by church policies that allowed abusers to continue to prey on youngsters.

title: Detroits Immigration Solution
description: The governor of Michigan, Rick Snyder, wants to fix Detroit with smart immigrants.

title: Democrats Grab for a Chance to Halt Christies Rise
description: Democratic Party operatives have churned out 11 different videos depicting Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey as a revenge-happy gridlock maker who cannot keep his story straight.

title: A Rough Final Winter for New Yorks Sanitation Chief
description: New York City has faced a messy meteorological start to the year, a spate of storms that has sapped the patience of even its most stoic residents.

title: Despite Revamp, Figure Skating Gets Mixed Marks
description: SOCHI, Russia  A figure skating judge ordered a quick bowl of soup for lunch at the Cup of Nice international competition in France. She did not finish the meal that October day in 2012, putting her spoon down and walking away in shock and anger.

title: Ukraine Chief Loses Support in Stronghold
description: DNEPROPETROVSK, Ukraine  As violence flared late last month in Kiev after Parliament approved a draconian law against dissent, two of the richest men in this industrial city 300 miles to the east of the Ukrainian capital met in an expensive Italian restaurant that they own and made a fateful decision.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 5, 2014
Who Needs Stopwatches? From the Shadows, Judges Take Starring Roles
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Whether Shaun White wins another gold medal in snowboardings halfpipe competition will be determined by a panel of six judges. Their only official criterion is overall impression.

title: Defenders of SodaStream Confuse Boycotts of Israeli Settlements With Movement to Boycott Israel
description: Last Updated, Thursday, 9:10 p.m. | It may be too soon to tell if SodaStream made a wise investment by hiring the actress Scarlett Johansson as a brand ambassador for the products it makes in a factory in the occupied West Bank  although its share price has dropped sharply since then, that could be just because the company also missed an earnings target the same week. But one thing is already clear: criticism of the deal from a charity the actress represented for nearly a decade, Oxfam, has been a publicity bonanza for a Palestinian-led movement to counter Israels military dominance with a campaign of boycotts, divestment and sanctions.

title: Bond Hearing Is Held in Killing at Theater
description: DADE CITY, Fla.  After fatally shooting a man after an argument over texting in a movie theater, a retired police captain pushed his glasses back and said, I cant believe what Ive done, a witness to the shooting testified Wednesday at a bond hearing.

title: Saving Sochi's Stray Dogs
