Colin Farrell plays the thief who breaks into her mansion to steal the silver  and absconds with her heart. And Russell Crowe, rejoining Akiva Goldsman  the writer for A Beautiful Mind, making his film directorial debut  is the gangster intent on putting their love asunder.

title: For a Sage Tenor, Its All in the Timing
description: I dont have more than this one life, the tenor Jonas Kaufmann said in a recent conversation at the Metropolitan Opera. I dont have more to offer. And Ive still got a family that I, from time to time, need to see. And thats a problem.

title: Their Time Is Now
description: On a recent Sunday afternoon, David O. Russell, the director and screenwriter whose most recent film, American Hustle, is nominated for 10 Academy Awards, including best picture, best director and best original screenplay (which he co-wrote), arrived at the Beverly Hills home of the fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg like a gentleman caller with something to prove.

title: Molding a Troupe to His Footprint
description: I do miss it. Its a wonderful thing to be a dancer, the former American Ballet Theater principal Ethan Stiefel said recently, in an uncharacteristic moment of quasi-wistfulness. Mr. Stiefel was speaking by phone from Wellington, New Zealand, where, since September 2011, he has been the artistic director of the Royal New Zealand Ballet.

title: Olympics Opening Ceremony Offers Fanfare for a Reinvented Russia
description: SOCHI, Russia  With an outsize extravaganza that reached deep into the repertory of classical music and ballet, traversed the sights and sounds of the worlds largest geopolitical expanse, soared into outer space and swept across millenniums of history in a celebration of everything from czarist military might to Soviet monumentalism, a swaggering, resurgent Russia turned its Winter Olympic aspirations into reality on Friday night.

title: Pope Francis Harley-Davidson Sells for $327,000 at Paris Auction
description: PARIS  A private buyer on Thursday purchased Pope Francis 2013 Harley-Davidson Dyna Super Glide for about $327,000 at a Bonhams auction in Paris. The price far exceeded the $16,000 to $22,000 presale estimate.

title: The Gun Report: February 7, 2014
description: In November 2012, Michael Dunn fatally shot Jordan Davis, 17, following a spat over loud music at a Jacksonville, Fla., gas station. Davis and three friends had stopped for gum and cigarettes, and Dunn, who was sitting in his Volkswagen, asked the teens to turn down the bass-heavy music blaring from their car. A verbal back-and-forth ensued, and Dunn opened fire into the car, hitting the victim three times.He then exited his car and fired off another half-dozen rounds. Dunn claims he saw a gun in Daviss car, but a subsequent search turned up a basketball, some clothing and a camera tripod.

title: Would You Lie for Me?
description: WHAT is the chance that you could get someone to lie for you? What about vandalizing public property at your suggestion?

title: Through Russia, With Love (and a Few Leaks)
description: The 4-wheel-drive Lada Niva may be the closest thing to an automotive version of the Russian soul, as a 1,000-mile drive from Moscow to Sochi attests.

title: Sochi or Bust: Have Niva, Need Hammer
description: SOCHI, Russia  Vlad Ketkovich, a documentary producer from Moscow, picked me up outside Domodedovo International Airport in a 4-wheel-drive, 4-door Lada Niva. He had rented that car in the belief that it is the closest thing to an automotive version of the Russian soul, and by far the best vehicle for the long drive ahead.

title: Emotions Churning Under Armor
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  Veena Sud, the creator of the dark television procedural The Killing, remembers first hearing about Joel Kinnaman when her casting team told her that a phenomenal actor from Sweden had put himself on tape. The minute I clicked on the link, I knew we found Holder, Ms. Sud said of the rumpled, soulful homicide detective Mr. Kinnaman plays on The Killing. He felt like a real guy, edgy. And he had amazing tats.

title: Gramercy Park Condop, Man-Cave Included
description: A sophisticated ninth-floor aerie with panoramic views of historic Gramercy Park from its loftlike great room, which has a 22-foot expanse of floor-to-ceiling windows facing south, is poised to enter the market at $8.75 million.

title: Modern Dishes, Served Fireside
description: When Februarys deep freeze sends us looking for a snug spot with a fireplace and hearty food and friendly people to tend us, the Tack Room at Peter Pratts Inn will do quite well. This cellar room, in a mid-18th-century house, flaunts its age: A whitewashed stone foundation supports a dark ceiling of hand-hewn beams, but the tables are dressed in white linen finery and nosegays of full-blown white roses, soothing reminders that spring is less than six weeks away.

title: Exclusive | 50 Gramercy Park North
description: A ninth-floor condop with panoramic views of Manhattans historic private park is about to enter the market at $8.75 million.

title: Aid in Dying Movement Takes Hold in Some States
description: DENVER  Helping the terminally ill end their lives, condemned for decades as immoral, is gaining traction. Banned everywhere but Oregon until 2008, it is now legal in five states. Its advocates, who have learned to shun the term assisted suicide, believe that as baby boomers watch frail parents suffer, support for what they call the aid in dying movement will grow further.

title: Lenos Farewell Drew More Than 14 Million Viewers
description: Jay Leno pumped his ratings muscles one last time for NBC Thursday night, ending his 22-year run as the Tonight show host with a huge audience of 14.6 million viewers.

title: Maxine Kumin, Pulitzer-Winning Poet With a Naturalists Precision, Dies at 88
description: Maxine Kumin, a Pulitzer Prize-winning poet whose spare, deceptively simple lines explored some of the most complex aspects of human existence  birth and death, evanescence and renewal, and the events large and small conjoining them all  died on Thursday at her home in Warner, N.H. She was 88.

title: Franois Hollande: Casanova or Lout?
description: Franois Hollande is acting liberated now that he has dismissed his live-in companion, Valrie Trierweiler, and eliminated  Pravda-style  all traces of her as first lady from the official lyse Palace website. The French president is smiling more, telling colleagues he feels relieved that his relationship is over. During a trip to Turkey last week, he bantered with French journalists. The next day he decorated the Turkish chanteuse Candan Ercetin as a knight of Arts and Letters, kissing her on both cheeks before gushing over her interpretation of Edith Piaf songs, including Non, je ne regrette rien.

title: Arrivederci, Roma. Ciao, Bank Street.
description: It might be a challenge to try to maintain the ambience of a Roman trattoria in downtown Stamford, especially when the temperatures dip down to near zero.

title: Making a Broken Family Whole Again
description: Eric Fleiss recently recalled the first words that his wife Susan said to him after she learned she had colon cancer in early 2011: I need to find you a new wife.

title: The Move From Celebrity to Ubiquity
description: LOS ANGELES  Priyanka Chopra had a problem: what to do with the light.

title: Review: 2014 Jeep Cherokee Limited
description: The original Cherokees design was so square, it could be mistaken for the box it came in. Jeep has revived the name for 2014 and has put quite a curve on the styling.

title: The M.T.A. Switches Ad Agencies After 22 Years
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is changing advertising agencies after 22 years, parting ways with the firm that helped popularize the cautionary phrase If you see something, say something.

title: Jason Wu: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Signs of Life in Home Building
description: In a perfect world for the housing industry, the employment picture contains a virtuous cycle in which housing drives jobs and jobs drive housing. Some analysts found evidence of that Friday in the January jobs report.

title: When Doctors Leave the Building
description: Forget images of hulking X-ray machines and pocket-size exam rooms framed by cinderblock. Forget the lingering odor of rubbing alcohol. New York doctors offices have come a long way over the years. And in their latest incarnation, these spaces are increasingly attractive as residential properties, enticing buyers with their prime locations, sometimes-lofty ceilings and unrivaled privacy.

title: Chrysler Recalls 9,700 Ram Vans for Sticking Accelerator Pedal
description: Chrysler is recalling about 9,700 Ram ProMaster vans from the 2014 model year to correct a problem that can allow the accelerator pedal to stick in the wide-open position, the automaker said in a news release Friday.

title: N.S.A. Program Gathers Data on a Third of Nations Calls, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  The National Security Agencys once-secret program that is collecting bulk records of Americans domestic phone calls is taking in a relatively small portion of the total volume of such calls each day, officials familiar with the program said on Friday.

title: New York Fashion Week: General Idea Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Clip: 'Child's Pose'
description: A scene from the film, directed by Calin Peter Netzer.

title: Graphic Novels to Graphic Prime Time
description: Shuffle ... stagger ... chomp! Shuffle ... stagger ... chomp!

title: Winters Chill Turns to Springs Love in the Forest
description: Blow, blow, thou winter wind begins one of the songs that echo in the frosty forest of Arden while its denizens shiver through the middle scenes of As You Like It. As Shakespeares story progresses and its various romances blossom, however, the melancholy snows of winter gradually melt away into the greenery of spring, even as his characters are transformed for the better by love and kindness.

title: Lord Zog, Your Ride Is Ready
description: TESTED Nissan Juke Nismo

title: Same Name, but Gentler in Attitude
description: FREDERICK, MD.  But is it a Jeep?

title: Reversal of Good Fortune
description: Theres something about a dessert that can be served with the bottom on top.

title: From Private Repository to Public Forum
description: The divide between public and private has lessened considerably in recent decades as social media reveals what near strangers had for breakfast and corporations and governments collect personal data for their own uses. Artists have taken note, and Dear Diary: Update on All at the Neuberger Museum of Art at Purchase College offers a global look at how the diary form evolved, as the gallery release puts it, from a private repository to a public forum in which the personal becomes a platform for social interaction, reflection and activism.

title: Morgan Stanley Adds 4 Executives to Operating Committee
description: Morgan Stanley has named four executives to its operating committee, the banks most senior group of managers.

title: The 7-Day Digital Diet
description: At first blush I may not seem like a prime candidate for a digital detox.

title: Missed That Note? Wait a Few Minutes, and Itll Return
description: Many new scores languish unheard after the fanfare of a premiere; for a work to have its American premiere and its second performance on the same program, as happened at the Miller Theater on Thursday evening, is fairly rare.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Africa and Elsewhere
description: Photos from South Africa, Kosovo, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Indonesia.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: A Greenwich Village loft; an Upper West Side Co-op; and a unit in a Park Slope building.

title: On the Market in the Region
description: A converted barn in Stamford with a soaring ceiling; and an English manor in White Plains with eight bedrooms.

title: A Not Quite Merry Christmas Reunion
description: It is often bad news for a family when one of its members decides to write a memoir, since the focus is likely to be a miserable childhood or a calamitous event the others would rather forget. The Wyeth family at the center of Jon Robin Baitzs crackling Other Desert Cities, now at the John W. Engeman Theater at Northport, faces that unwelcome situation.

title: Jazz Brimming With Ideas
description: Danilo Prez began his early set at the Jazz Standard on Thursday night with a busily efficient overture, laying out many of his themes and protocols for the ensuing hour. Within the first minute of the piece, Rediscovery of the South Sea, there was an intriguing bramble of push-pull tensions between bass, violin and percussion; a more spacious motif that Mr. Prez unhurriedly teased out at the piano; and a hale-sounding Yoruban chant by Roman Daz, providing his own punctuation on a bat drum.

title: Scores Detained in Russia Before Olympic Ceremony
description: MOSCOW  From St. Petersburg to the Caucasus, the authorities detained at least 61 people on Friday for holding unauthorized protests ahead of the opening ceremony of the Winter Olympics in Sochi. The detentions underscored the governments efforts to stifle protests even far away from the Games.

title: De Blasios Pick for Planning Puts Focus on Housing
description: From its perch as overseer of New York Citys growth, the City Planning Commission has helped mayors put their own stamp on the landscape, whether with luxury Midtown towers or a revitalized waterfront. But Mayor Bill de Blasio mostly sees the realm of zoning and land use as another means to address economic inequality.

title: McDonalds Opens in Vietnam, Bringing Big Mac to Fans of Banh Mi
description: HANOI, Vietnam  When Nguyen Hoang Anh and Nguyen Thi My Hao started dating, the 23-year-olds agreed to disagree about food: Mr. Anh adores Western-style fast food, but Ms. Hao mainly eats pho, a popular noodle soup, and other northern Vietnamese foods she has loved since childhood.

title: Wine-Braised Oxtail
description: Melissa Clark braises oxtail with red wine, carrots and celery root for flavorful, fork-tender meat.

title: Adversity, Relayed in Emoticons by a Troubled Gay Teenager
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The first thing to know about David Roussves Stardust is that you never actually see its protagonist, a black gay urban teenager named Junior. The voice at the heart of this 80-minute dance-theater piece, which had its regional premiere on Thursday in Montclair State Universitys Peak Performances series, speaks to us via text messages, projected on the back wall of the theater.

title: A Jeep That Serves Two Masters
description: The 2014 Jeep Cherokee Trailhawk faces a challenge: it must compete with the likes of the RAV4 and CR-V for the suburban market. and still get some respect from the Cherokee nation.

title: Latin America Venture Capital Fund Raises New $135 Million Fund
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Despite the turbulence currently hitting emerging markets, the venture capital fund Kaszek Ventures, in Buenos Aires, recently raised a new $135 million fund, signaling that the regions long-term prospects remain promising.

title: Finding Warmth and Comfort in Noodle Soup
description: At Noodles and Company in Garden City on a recent afternoon, Matt Neary, 44, of Merrick, lifted a bowl to his lips and drained what was left of the Thai curry noodle soup at the bottom. A repeat customer at the restaurant, at the Gallery at Westbury Plaza mall, Mr. Neary said he had been craving the coconut curry broth laced with ginger, cabbage, shiitake mushrooms and rice noodles. Its got to have some kind of noodle in it, he said. Thats what makes it a one-pot meal.

title: The Marriage, Pragmatic; The Relatives, Troubling
description: Patience sometimes seems to be a lost art in creepy entertainment. The makers of such stuff, whether a television show about a hunt for a serial killer or a slasher film for the popcorn crowd, seem in a rush to get a scary abduction or bloody corpse onto the screen, as if they fear viewers will bail if they dont see something ghastly in the first three minutes.

title: Priyanka Chopra: The New Face of Guess
description: Priyanka Chopra is a household name in India. But she is a relative unknown in America, where she spent a part of her childhood. She hopes that being the new face of Guess will change that.

title: On the Market in the Region
description: Click the slide show to view the On the Market properties in the region for this week: A converted barn in Stamford with a soaring ceiling; and an English manor in White Plains with eight bedrooms.

title: For a Plucky Upstart, Icy Industry Tundra
description: LOS ANGELES  The Legend of Sarila is Canadas first 3-D animated feature film. The movie boasts a fine voice cast, including the Canadian-born Christopher Plummer and Genevive Bujold, and a story that draws its inspiration from Inuit culture and legends. There are blizzards and avalanches, sled dog rides through twisting ice tunnels and mystical battles between rival shamans. After its premiere at the TIFF Kids International Film Festival in Toronto, the film opened in Canadian theaters; the producers later signed deals to distribute Sarila in more than 22 countries, including Germany, Russia, Israel and China.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: Click the slide show to view the On the Market properties in New York City for this week: A Greenwich Village loft; an Upper West Side Co-op; and a unit in a Park Slope building.

title: Rodriguez Drops Suits Against Baseball and Union
description: After a year of warring with Major League Baseball, Alex Rodriguez effectively ended his battle on Friday, dropping his lawsuits against baseball and the players union over his doping suspension.

title: Ode to a Slow-Cooked Oxtail
description: A slice of oxtail terrine, with silken shreds of boneless beef molded into a neat square on the plate, is a refined and elegant dish. The meat is so soft and succulent you can eat it with a spoon. Teeth are purely optional.

title: Bill Cunningham | Whiteout
description: Men in dress shoes leaping over slush-filled curbs added a humorous if precarious postscript.

title: As Olympics Open, Social Media Is a Prism for Protests Against Russias Anti-Gay Law
description: As my colleagues in Sochi write in their live-blog, the Winter Olympics have officially begun with the completion of the opening ceremony, and social media is again being used as a stage for expressions of L.G.B.T. rights.

title: Sit Back, Relax and Enjoy the Show
description: Meals at Moroccan restaurants typically begin with salads, and if you begin yours at Marakesh with the mix of cold salads known as the sampler, you might want to come back and order it again the next day.

title: The Singers Artifice, Flickering on Film
description: In Joan Didions Broadway adaptation of her memoir The Year of Magical Thinking, Vanessa Redgrave played a character named Joan Didion. Simple enough, but it suddenly gave a new twist to Ms. Didions large body of nonfiction, much of it written in the first person. While I used to take the authenticity of her narrative voice for granted, The Year of Magical Thinking reminded me that her I is as artificial, as carefully calibrated a construct, as any figure in a play or novel.

title: Marc Jacobss Plans for the Future, The Duchess of Cambridges New Style and Zac Posens Bridal Designs
description: All the fashion news of the week thats fit to reprint.

title: For Many Older Americans, an Enterprising Path
description: WHEN Marilyn Arnold was 9 years old, her mother, a skilled seamstress, patiently taught her to sew on a vintage Singer treadle sewing machine.

title: Gearing Up the Time Machine to Go Back to the 90s
description: Gorgon City

title: Ex-Contractor at State Dept. Pleads Guilty in Leak Case
description: WASHINGTON  Stephen J. Kim, a former State Department contractor charged with leaking information from a highly classified report about North Korea to a Fox News reporter in 2009, pleaded guilty on Friday and agreed to serve a 13-month prison sentence.

title: Work by Graffiti Artists From 5Pointz on Display
description: Subway riders who saw the graffiti-coated warehouse buildings in Queens known as 5Pointz from the 7 train and planned to visit them someday will never have the chance.

title: Infusing tudes With a Kaleidoscope of Flavors
description: Almost exactly one year after his Carnegie Hall recital debut, the young Russian pianist Daniil Trifonov returned to its main auditorium. Word of that triumphant debut, in which the then-21-year-old demonstrated his uncommon technical gifts and poetic sensibility in works by Scriabin, Liszt and Chopin, and the recent release of its live recording, contributed to the crush of ticket seekers outside the hall on Thursday evening.

title: A Jeep That Must Serve Two Masters
description: The 2014 Jeep Cherokee Trailhawk faces a challenge: to compete with the likes of the RAV4 and CR-V for the suburban market, and still get some respect from the Cherokee nation.

title: Loyalists Hit Closets as Zero Becomes 15
description: To her fans, she is an artists artist. Maria Cornejo has been dressing stars of the art, film and music worlds since she introduced her label, Zero & Maria Cornejo, in the late 1990s.

title: Cushnie et Ochs: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: His Death, Their Lives
description: In the first hours and days that followed Philip Seymour Hoffmans death from an apparent overdose of heroin, there was an outpouring of grief on Facebook, on Twitter and in columns by recovering addicts and alcoholics like the journalist Seth Mnookin and the screenwriter Aaron Sorkin about their own struggles with sobriety and the rarely distant fear of relapsing back into the throes of active addiction.

title: Fashion Week Galas Worth the Weather
description: Neither rain nor sleet nor snow can keep the fashion flock from its appointed rounds during New York Fashion Week.

title: First Resale in Walker Tower Flipped for Near $3 Million Profit
description: The renaissance of Walker Tower, the 24-story Art Deco office building at 212 West 18th Street that put Chelsea on the skyscraper map after Ralph Thomas Walker designed it for the New York Telephone Company in 1929, has been emphatic.

title: Volvo Plan: 1 Platform for All Cars
description: In an audacious reinvention of itself, Volvo Cars will replace its entire model line over the next few years, staking its immediate future on a single chassis architecture with one basic engine and transmission.

title: Child Crash Deaths Decline 43%
description: Deaths of children 12 and younger in motor vehicle crashes fell by 43 percent from 2002 to 2011, the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said in a report released on Tuesday. Still, automobile accidents remain a leading cause of death among children in the United States.

title: Protesters Sack Government Offices Across Bosnia
description: Updated, Saturday, 5:27 p.m. | As protesters fed up with economic and political stagnation sacked government buildings in cities across Bosnia, journalists and bloggers on Friday shared images and firsthand accounts of the unrest on social networks.

title: The Week in Pictures for Feb. 7
description: Subjects include: Super Bowl Boulevard, Chinese New Year and another snowstorm.

title: For a Power Girl, Cheers and Disses
description: Among the many chart-topping musicians who appeared at the Grammy Awards on Jan. 26, Lorde, the 17-year-old singer of the hit Royals, was the most mentioned on Twitter that night, according to the social media companys blog. With her fingers dip-dyed in black (more reminiscent of the designer Michle Lamy than a typical teenage pop star) and signature jerky dance moves, some young fans were giddy at her success. Lorde might win four Grammys when I cant even win the affection of my crush from school, one wrote.

title: Spunky, Sexy, Cool
description: WHOJennifer Lawrence

title: Jennifer Lawrences Red Carpet Fashion Choices
description: Ms. Lawrences style can be defined as spunky, sexy and cool.

title: Trapped by a Fire on the 20th Floor
description: It was the wailing from the hallway rather than a beeping smoke alarm that told us something was wrong.

title: Jeff Westheimer at Mayfair House of Bridge in 1970
description: Jeff Westheimer, who died last Monday, and his then-new bride, Valerie, played the diagramed deal at the Mayfair House of Bridge in 1970. In it, declarer missed an instructive inference.

title: Once Upon a Revolution: A Story With No End
description: CAIRO  The discussion started decorously enough. The novelist Alaa al-Aswany had screened The Square, the Oscar-nominated documentary about the Egyptian revolution, at his monthly salon two weeks ago, and he opened by lamenting that the film focused on just a handful of articulate characters instead of the masses of simple people. And as in almost every conversation here about the The Square, it did not take long before the fighting began.

title: Layering It On, With Film and Paper
description: AGE 30.

title: New Emails in Pradaxa Case Show Concern Over Profit
description: Employees of Boehringer Ingelheim, the German drug maker, continued to express concern over whether sales of their blood thinner, Pradaxa, could be harmed if the public learned that some patients might need regular testing for safety reasons, according to new documents unsealed by a federal judge in Illinois on Thursday.

title: A Fantasy Found in the Morgue
description: A number of years ago, I had a major crush on a guy whose profession was identifying bodies that had been mutilated or decomposed so badly that they were beyond visual recognition (yes, its another sappy Valentines Day story).

title: Off the Runway
description: Scene from the second day of New York Fashion Week.

title: 22 Things The New York Times Has Called a Guilty Pleasure
description: In Sundays magazine, Adam Sternbergh riffs on so-called guilty pleasures. How did these two concepts ever come to be married anyway? he asks. Aside from the obvious (sex), there are only three other arenas in life in which guilt and pleasure are habitually linked: gastronomy, religion and the arts. And while there are semi-plausible rationalizations for the first two (that cake was delicious, but I ate too much; I indulged in an act Ive been taught to feel is wrong), for the life of me Ive never been able to unravel how cultural guilt and cultural pleasure became so entwined.

title: Times Minute | Olympics Open in Sochi
description: In the Video

title: Olympics Pictures of the Day: Feb. 7
description: The Winter Olympics opening ceremony at Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, with the parade of nations, performances and fireworks.

title: Times Minute | Olympics Open in Sochi
description: Also on the Minute, the 50th anniversary of the Beatles' "British invasion" and a trip to South Korea's elaborate bathhouses.

title: When Hands Talk, Be Careful Where You Point
description: At several regional productions of the 2012 Off Broadway hit Tribes, the marketing teams who proofread show posters arent just looking at syntax and spelling. Theyre also scrutinizing hands and fingers.

title: Week in Pictures for Feb. 7
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include Super Bowl Boulevard, Chinese New Year and another snowstorm.

title: Tauba Auerbach on Book Fairs, Knitwear and the Grateful Dead
description: The San Francisco-born, New York-based artist Tauba Auerbach is about to have a London moment. Opening this weekend is Tetractys  Art of the Fugue, a ballet at the Royal Opera House for which she created the backdrops and costume designs. Soon to follow will be The New Ambidextrous Universe, a major exhibition in the spring at the citys Institute of Contemporary Arts. (Auerbachs work can also currently be seen at the University of Chicago and the Contemporary Art Museum in Houston.)

title: Going Uphill: The Luge Event at Sochi
description: Luge is often the fastest event in the Olympics -- so fast that track designers for Sochi tried to slow it down.

title: A Big Reveal Touches a Nerve
description: It is the moment The Biggest Loser viewers anticipate all season. That episode when the finalists emerge, one by one, to bare all  or rather less  to a waiting audience of millions. But on Tuesday night, when Rachel Frederickson, 24, walked onto the studio stage 155 pounds lighter than at the start of Season 15, the reaction was not one of awe, but shock, apparent even on the trainers frozen faces.

title: Nonoo: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Taliban and Government Imperil Gains for Afghan Women, Advocates Say
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Advocates say that womens rights and security in Afghanistan are under mounting assault from all sides  the Taliban insurgency and the government alike  putting at risk 12 years of hard-won gains for women here.

title: Judge Stops Removal of Picasso Canvas at Four Seasons Until Further Review
description: Not so fast.

title: Friday Night Music: My Body is a Cage
description: I wasnt going to post more Arcade Fire. But I finally saw Her, with its (excellent) Arcade Fire score, and AF also had a second awesome performance at that Australian radio station. So here we are.

title: Bill Cunningham | Whiteout
description: Mondays snowfall was perhaps the most beautiful in 25 years, bringing an early lacy Valentine to city parks. The next day, men in dress shoes leaping over slush-filled curbs added a humorous if precarious postscript.

title: The Darkness Behind Sochis Sparkle
description: SOCHI, Russia  The party that is the Winter Olympics officially began on Friday night inside a new stadium on the shores of the Black Sea.

title: An Inmate and a Scholar
description: When the newest issue of Columbia Journal of European Law came out last month featuring a 31-page scholarly article on Turkish nationals in the European Union, the authors note at the bottom of the first page was the only indication that the writer was not your typical Ivy Leaguer.

title: Conflicting Expectations for Brattons Second Tour
description: In the 1990s, a time of vexing homicide rates in cities across the country, William J. Bratton left the New York Police Department and began marketing the crime-fighting techniques he had deployed so successfully here to other municipalities struggling with rampant disorder. At the time, business and civic leaders in Birmingham, Ala., brought him on to advise them.

title: Evening Hours | Gilded Age, Then and Now
description: The Frick, the National Academy and elsewhere.

title: Hello, Non-Manhattan Neighbors
description: There is a certain type of New Yorker who lives in Manhattan, might deign to have a drink in Brooklyn and sees no more of the Bronx and Queens than their stadiums and airports. Staten Island? Never. The new public art project, New York (Outer Borough) Stories, now on display at two locations (24 Gouverneur Lane and141 Water Street) near the South Street Seaport, was made for these provincials.

title: Massachusetts Appoints Official and Hires Firm to Fix Exchange Problems
description: BOSTON  Gov. Deval Patrick of Massachusetts has appointed an insurance executive to oversee repairs to the states bungled effort to bring its health exchange in line with the requirements of President Obamas health care law. Mr. Patrick also announced the state will pay a technology firm, Optum, nearly $10 million to help fix the exchange.

title: Rag & Bones Red-Leather Day
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Highlights From Our Social Feeds at NYFW, Day 2
Journalist Badly Wounded by Flare During Rio Protest
description: Santiago Andrade, a Brazilian cameraman, was badly wounded in Rio de Janeiro on Thursday evening when he was struck in the head by an explosive device while covering clashes between protesters and the police. He remained in critical condition on Friday after four hours of neurosurgery, according to the local Globo news site.

title: In Left-Leaning Norway, Its Wealthy Fox Gleefully Swings to the Right
description: OSLO  OLAV THON, at 90, is nearly as old as modern Norway, which became independent from Sweden in 1905. But today, having worked his way from being a poor farm boy in the mountains to Norways wealthiest resident, he is not so sure independence was such a good idea.

title: Four Seasons on Shaky Ground at Park Avenue Home
description: The Four Seasons, the restaurant on Park Avenue that is a lunchtime haunt for movie stars, wealthy financiers and titans of real estate and media, may have to vacate its space over something faced every day by far less renowned establishments: a steep rent increase.

title: Carrie Underwood at Peter Som
description: Despite a biting wind blowing from the Hudson, show guests continued to brave icy sidewalks in pointy stilettos. Count the country singer Carrie Underwood among the fashion-first pack. She attended Peter Soms 10 a.m. runway show at Milk Studios in a sleeveless blush chiffon frock and peep-toe pumps.

title: New York Fashion Week Street Style: Day 2
description: Craig Arend of Altamira NYC takes over our Instagram account for New York Fashion Week. Check out NYTimesFashion on Instagram for more.

title: Rag & Bone: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Elisabeth Erm Transforms Backstage at Peter Som
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Elisabeth Erm before (left) and after (right) makeup by Tom Pecheux and hair by Eugene Souleiman.

title: Protests Over Government and Economy Roil Bosnia
description: PARIS  Thousands of angry Bosnians took to the streets on Friday for a fourth day of protests against the political paralysis and economic stagnation that have engulfed one of Europes poorest and most divided countries.

title: Bill Would Ease Way for Unions at Some Retail Stores in New York City
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio swept into office promising to help low-wage workers and demand more from corporations that get support from the city  and now his allies intend to hold him to it.

title: Despite Signs of Progress, Security Issues Rise in Tunisia
description: TUNIS  At the end of a 20-hour gun battle with the police in a northern borough here, a bearded man emerged from the besieged house, his rifle above his head. Residents watching from a street corner saw him kneel, lay down the weapon and reach for his vest. Then a government sniper shot him dead.

title: Woody Allen Speaks Out
Going Uphill: The Luge Event at Sochi
description: Luge is often the fastest event in the Olympics -- so fast that track designers for Sochi tried to slow it down.

title: Republicans Criticize Rules to Aid Syrians Seeking Asylum
description: Republican lawmakers are assailing new exemptions from antiterrorism laws the Obama administration issued this week for war zone refugees seeking to come to the United States, saying the rules are examples of unilateral action by President Obama that weaken immigration security.

title: China: Tibetan Dies in Act of Protest
description: A Tibetan man, Phakmo Samdup, died Wednesday after setting himself on fire in an act of protest against the Chinese government, which has ruled Tibet since invading it in the 1950s, according to information released Friday by Free Tibet, an advocacy group based in London. Radio Free Asia, which is financed by the American government, said the protest took place in the prefecture of Malho in Qinghai Province, in western China. The death raises to 126 the number of self-immolations in Tibetan areas ruled by China, Radio Free Asia reported.

title: Canada: Government Deletes Drawings, Posted Online, of a Secret Spying Site
description: The government of Canada on Friday removed detailed architectural drawings of a secret electronic eavesdropping station that had been posted online. About a dozen drawings, which detail the interior as well as mechanical and electrical specifications of the command center at Canadian Forces Station Leitrim in Ottawa were posted on Wednesday as part of a construction tender by Public Works and Government Services Canada. The military station conducts foreign communications interceptions and other work for the Communications Security Establishment Canada, Canadas electronic spy agency. The public works department was unable to comment about the episode. The removal of the drawings followed the publication of an article in the newspaper The Ottawa Citizen.

title: Try Your Luck, at the I.R.S. Wheel
description: Taxes are Fun! Thats the bright, bold and unconvincing message in an ad campaign from Jackson Hewitt, the tax preparers.

title: A Taste Test for Three Flavors of Tax Software
description: My choice of tax preparation software brands me an old coot, or at least out of sync with the modern moment. My wife, Mary Ellen, says my taste in music does, too  my apologies, Mr. Jagger.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Liner Notes at Rag & Bone
description: You can always count on the Rag & Bone girl to make the call on whats cool, beauty-wise. For fall, the answer is: loads of graphic eyeliner. I was inspired by y-y girls from the 60s, like Franoise Hardy, the makeup artist Gucci Westman saidof the tomboy-ish look she created backstage this afternoon. Her muse is accessible and cool, Westman continued, but has a contemporary edge and toughness. In the makeup chair, that translated into a modern cat-eye with a strong, geometric shape. The eyeliner goes straight out, and doesnt follow the lash line, which makes it slightly different, Westman explainedof her technique, which involved topping Revlon ColorStay Crme Gel Liner with Revlon ColorStay Liquid Eye Pen. To clean up the edges, Westman relied on an angled Q-Tip when necessary; she left the rest of the face relatively bare. The eyeliner is meant to be your one trick, she said. This is not a high-maintenance girl. Indeed, the British model Georgia May Jagger paid Westman the ultimate compliment by describing the finished look as quite normal  its actually something I would wear out.

title: Ex-Mayor Confronts List of Transactions at His Corruption Trial in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS  On Friday, it was C. Ray Nagin versus his paper trail.

title: For Small Businesses, a Road Without a Map
description: Last year, owners of small businesses had to cope with higher tax rates. This year, they will wrestle with greater uncertainty about the fate of some deductions they have come to rely on.

title: Minimizing the Tax Drag on Your Investments
description: Unless you happen to be a certified public accountant, or related to one, the topic of taxes you pay on your investments probably has as much appeal as a root canal. Understood. Nonetheless, its a topic well worth focusing on.

title: At the I.R.S., Trying to Collect More With Less
description: The United States tax code is fast approaching 75,000 pages, and it is growing every year in complexity and bulk. Yet as the tax code has become more byzantine, the budget for enforcing it has been shrinking.

title: Week After Being Hit by Bus, Rare Owl Is Bright and Alert at Washington Clinic
description: WASHINGTON  One week after being hit by a bus and an S.U.V. not far from the White House, the snowy owl that made bird-watchers out of smartphone-gazers is recuperating at a Washington wildlife clinic.

title: Victory, and Tax Changes, for Same-Sex Couples
description: Erin E. Miller and her wife may have to pay more income tax this year, but they arent about to protest. Quite the opposite.

title: So Many Bribes, a Greek Official Cant Recall Them All
description: ATHENS  When Antonis Kantas, a deputy in the Defense Ministry here, spoke up against the purchase of expensive German-made tanks in 2001, a representative of the tanks manufacturer stopped by his office to leave a satchel on his sofa. It contained 600,000 euros, about $814,000. Other arms manufacturers eager to make deals came by, too, some guiding him through the ins and outs of international banking and then paying him off with deposits to his overseas accounts.

title: Father and Son, Together on a Halfpipe Quest
description: MAMMOTH LAKES, Calif.  The maintenance building smells like a garage, all rubber and grease and metal parts, the scents of construction and repairs. The Coke machine has a sticker that reads Bretz 2014.

title: Time Travel and the Ballad Tradition
description: Since I was a kid, Ive loved story songs, history ballads and concept albums. Songs with well-drawn characters, a strong sense of time and place, a narrative arc and a cinematic quality are endlessly fascinating. I remember hearing The Battle of New Orleans by Jimmy Driftwood (a hit for the country artist Johnny Horton) for the first time, as a very young, prekindergarten child, and being mesmerized by the march of the bloody British, at whom we fired our guns all the way down the Mississippi to the Gulf of Mexico. At the time I didnt know who the British were, or why we wanted to kill them, or where the city of New Orleans might be, but the battle and the chase and the big river right in the center made an indelible imprint.

title: Breaks in the Action
description: Union and Confederate soldiers viewed one another as the enemy  except sometimes when they needed to bum a smoke. Then, in unofficial soldiers truces, warring opponents set down their weapons and became the American brothers they were before the war. In a conflict that exemplified the military axiom that soldiering is 99 percent boredom and 1 percent sheer terror, the blue and the gray called timeouts from opposition to trade tobacco for coffee, share food, relate war stories and converse about home, or play cards during downtime on the battlefield.

title: Proposals
description: Readers share images of their wedding proposals or proposals they witnessed.

title: Steps Toward Financial Fitness, for This Year and Beyond
description: For a vast majority of Americans, the current tax-filing season will be business as usual, with few changes to the ground rules of recent years. For the very affluent, it may bring sticker shock.

title: Historic Hysterics: Witnesses to a Really Big Show
description: Debbie Gendler, a teenager from Oakland, N.J., had gone to television shows before, taking a seat in the studio audience and clapping dutifully when the applause light flashed. But this one was different. There were crowds outside the studio that chilly afternoon in February 1964, hysterical crowds, and a phalanx of police officers blocking the way.

title: Currency Wars, Revisited

Now officials in some nations, like Argentina and Turkey, are blaming foreign vultures and the interest rate lobby for the sharp depreciation of their currencies.

title: The Bloody Ivory Business
description: The slaughter of the African elephant continues. Nearly 100 of these majestic animals are sacrificed every day for ivory trinkets  bracelets, statuettes and other baubles sold illegally around the world. Wildlife experts estimate the remaining African elephant population at 350,000 to 500,000, with poachers targeting 30,000 to 35,000 a year. Elizabeth Bennett of the Wildlife Conservation Society estimates that one subspecies, the African forest elephant, could become extinct in the next decade.

title: De Blasio Tests Political Might in Pre-K Push
description: He has phoned titans of finance and real estate to ask for donations. He has called on labor leaders to tap their war chests and lend their muscles. He has lined up endorsements from actors, musicians and movie producers.

title: Whats On Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) 42 (2013) Chadwick Boseman, above, portrays Jackie Robinson, a shortstop for the Kansas City Monarchs of the Negro leagues, a four-sport athlete at U.C.L.A. and an Army officer during World War II. Harrison Ford plays Branch Rickey, the president and general manager of the Brooklyn Dodgers who selected Robinson to become the first black major leaguer of the modern era. But when Rickey calls his new player superhuman, what he means is that Robinson will have to rise above ordinary temptations in the face of prejudice and hostility to become a flawless exemplar of his race. While 42, Brian Helgelands new film about Robinson, gestures toward the complicated and painful history in which its subject was embroiled, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York York Times, it is blunt, simple and sentimental, using time-tested methods to teach a clear and rousing lesson. He continued, In other hands  Spike Lees, lets say, or even Clint Eastwoods  42 might have taken a tougher, more contentious look at the breaking of Major League Baseballs color barrier. But Mr. Helgeland has honorably sacrificed the chance to make a great movie in the interest of making one that is accessible and inspiring. Though not accurate in every particular, the movie mostly succeeds in respecting the facts of history and the personality of its hero, and in reminding audiences why he mattered.

The show is being held in one of the wings of the Grand Palais, which from now until Monday next will resound with the noise and gaiety peculiar to the barnyard.

title: A Seaside Surfing Town on Sydneys North Shore
description: Sydneys scenic enclave Manly has long been overshadowed by glitzy Bondi on the other side of the harbor, but that suits its laid-back nature just fine. Localsregularly hit the wavesbefore heading to work in Sydneys financial district, a five-mile ferry ride across Sydney Harbor; itsnot uncommon, while slurping fresh oysters, to spot a humpback whale leap out of the water just a shells throw away. Lately, artists, musicians and creative types drawn to Manlys natural beauty and mellow pace have transformed the area into anew hub of culture and dining, and starting today, thenine-dayAustralian Open of Surfingtakes place along its shores.Here, a field guide to enjoying the area.

While they have all been affected by global economic tides, these nations are facing crises because of problems in their national governance. And if we look elsewhere around the world, we find that governance has been re-emerging as a major factor behind success or failure in many emerging nations.

title: Where Is My Family on TV?
description: ONE of my earliest memories is of sitting in an idling car with my mom and sister outside a convenience store in Virginia. Dads inside, buying cigarettes and scratch-off lottery tickets. Suddenly, a wild-eyed man appears at the driver-side window, yelling about white women and black men and how they dont belong together. My mother goes feral, blocking his access to us.My father runs out, furious and swearing, before driving us away. I dont remember what happened next, just a confusing and searing shame about the ugliness that the sight of my family could provoke.

title: The Games Begin in Russia, and an Actors Life Ends in New York
description: From their inception in the 1890s, the modern Olympic Games have differed from other sporting tournaments (the Super Bowl, for example, on which more later) in the overlay of idealism that Baron Pierre de Coubertin, the father of the modern Games, concocted from the mythology of the ancient Greek Games and his own 19th-century aristocratic sporting traditions. Never mind that his idealized Olympic Games have long given way to commercialism, professionalism, corruption, politics and boycotts; the notion that the Games somehow elevate the world above its usual sordid nastiness has remained an integral part of their image.

title: Whose Garbage Is This Anyway?
description: HEBRON, West Bank  It was not your usual Holy Land tour, but surely one of the most revealing Ive ever had. A team from Friends of the Earth Middle East took me around to see how waste, sewage and untreated water flow, or dont, between Israel and the West Bank. I never realized how political garbage and dirty water could be, or how tracking it could reveal just why making peace here is so urgent.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Medicine as a Business
description: Readers discuss whether pressure to increase profits has compromised doctors ethics and their treatment of patients.

title: Leaving Work Behind
description: IN 1930, in the darkening valley of the Great Depression, John Maynard Keynes wrote an essay on Economic Possibilities for Our Grandchildren, which foresaw a much happier future  one of growth, abundance and the steady decline of full-time work. Eventually, he suggested, civilization might settle on a 15-hour workweek, with three hours of daily labor being sufficient to satisfy the old Adam in most of us.

title: Lost in Clinical Translation
description: A classic Far Side cartoon shows a man talking forcefully to his dog. The man says: Okay, Ginger! Ive had it! You stay out of the garbage! But the dog hears only: Blah blah Ginger blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah Ginger

title: After War, a Failure of the Imagination
description: I COULD never imagine what youve been through, she said.

title: Why Nutrition Is So Confusing
description: NEARLY six weeks into the 2014 diet season, its a good bet that many of us who made New Years resolutions to lose weight have already peaked. If clinical trials are any indication, weve lost much of the weight we can expect to lose. In a year or two well be back within half a dozen pounds of where we are today.

title: Inside a Mental Hospital Called Jail
description: CHICAGO  THE largest mental health center in America is a huge compound here in Chicago, with thousands of people suffering from manias, psychoses and other disorders, all surrounded by high fences and barbed wire.

title: How Single Motherhood Hurts Kids
description: The last few weeks have brought an unusual convergence of voices from both the center and the left about a topic that is typically part of conservative rhetorical territory: poverty and single-parent families. Just as some conservatives have started talking seriously about rising inequality and stagnant incomes, some liberals have finally begun to admit that our stubbornly high rates of poverty and social and economic immobility are closely entwined with the rise of single motherhood.

title: French Breakup Makes a Dinner Harder to Do
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama invited President Franois Hollande of France for a state dinner, the White House drew up a list of 300 guests to honor the visiting leader and his partner, Valrie Trierweiler. Engraved invitations, with the presidential seal in gold at the top, were printed and set to be mailed.

title: A Streaker Disrupts the Prabal Gurung Show
description: What was that line, apparently impromptu, that David Niven came up with at the 1974 Oscar ceremonies, just before he was to introduce Elizabeth Taylor and the Best Picture Oscar, when a streaker raced across the stage in front of the live TV audience?

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Feb. 9
description: As the Winter Olympics take off this weekend in Sochi, following an extravagant opening ceremonies Friday, the international community is still keeping tabs on Russias readiness and safety. In the shadow of two terrorists attacks last December in Russia, security remains a top concern in Sochi.

description: New York

description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Juliana Schurig before (left) and after (right) makeup by Diane Kendal and hair by Paul Hanlon.

title: Devoted Coach and Gifted Son Lead Slovenia to Hockey Heights
description: SOCHI, Russia  In 1984, an 18-year-old forward was one of the final cuts from the Yugoslavian mens ice hockey team that competed in its homeland Olympics in Sarajevo. The national team coach, to assuage the players disappointment, assured him there would be other Olympics.

title: Shaun White on the Halfpipe
description: When Shaun White drops into the halfpipe, he does it at full speed  an aggressiveness that distinguishes him. We spoke with him before the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi.

title: Far-Right Party Strains to Hang On in Britain
description: WYTHENSHAWE, England  At the time, it was hailed by its leader as a huge breakthrough in British politics. One of the most extreme of Englands far-right parties, the British National Party, won two seats in the European Parliament in 2009, just as populist anger, fueled by the recession and anti-immigrant sentiment, prompted voters to look beyond the mainstream.

title: Rebecca Taylor: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Seeking U.S. Art All Over Map. Just Check GPS.
description: PHOENIX  Two men stepped out of a rental car here recently and walked up to a modest ranch-style house with a cat and a grapefruit tree in the yard, worried that the homeowner might mistake them for missionaries or salesmen.

title: A Battle of Ideology in a City Unaccustomed to That Sort of Election
description: SAN DIEGO  When Bob Filner resigned as mayor last summer amid a sexual harassment scandal, Democrats openly fretted over losing the first liberal in decades elected to run this city, long a Republican bastion on the southern edge of the state.

description: New York

description: After 45 years of coaching basketball at Campus Magnet High School (formerly Andrew Jackson High School), Charles Granby, 79, is retiring.

title: Affordability Will Be Focus for New Housing Leaders
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio filled four leadership positions throughout his housing agencies on Saturday, putting in place the team he said would help fulfill his goal of significantly expanding New York Citys affordable housing stock.

description: In the final game of his coaching career, Charles Granby of Campus Magnet High School watched as his Bulldogs were thumped by Cardozo, 76-33.

title: Report of a Corrupt Figure Skating Deal Includes an Odd Alliance
description: SOCHI, Russia  Who says the United States and Russia cannot get along?

title: When We House Mentally Ill People in Prisons
description: My sunday column is about the way the dearth of mental health services ends up propelling people with psychiatric disorders into prisons and jails, so that today many more mentally ill people are behind bars than in psychiatric hospitals. This column arose out of my earlier invitation to readers to suggest topics that we in journalism should cover more aggressively in 2014. I suggested that one of these is mental health issues, which I wrote about generally last month, and this is a follow-up. Id welcome your thoughts on this.

title: Can You Live on the Minimum Wage?
description: More than 4.8 million workers now earn the lowest legal pay. This calculator shows the hard choices that have to be made living on the smallest paychecks.

title: The Case for a Higher Minimum Wage
description: The political posturing over raising the minimum wage sometimes obscures the huge and growing number of low-wage workers it would affect. An estimated 27.8 million people would earn more money under the Democratic proposal to lift the hourly minimum from $7.25 today to $10.10 by 2016. And most of them do not fit the low-wage stereotype of a teenager with a summer job. Their average age is 35; most work full time; more than one-fourth are parents; and, on average, they earn half of their families total income.

title: The Winning Formula of Luges Old Man
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  To discover how the 40-year-old Italian luger Armin Zggeler has remained at the top of his sport for more than 20 years, I persuaded him to tell me his secrets. Apples, he told me. And I have lots of noodles for lunch, and steak for dinner every night.

title: With Team Skating, Its Now Kiss, Cry, Squeeze In
description: SOCHI, Russia  The figure skating arena for the Sochi Olympics, known as the Iceberg, can seat 12,000 people. When the new team competition is being held, it seems as if they are all piled into the famously awkward kiss-and-cry area.

title: Will Saving on Health Care Hurt the Economy?
description: WASHINGTON  LOST in all the debate last week about whether or not the Affordable Care Act will hurt the economy is the fact that health care is already imposing a drag on growth.

He skipped the London Chess Classic in December, where he had competed every year since the tournament began in 2009, and did not play in the Tata Steel tournament in the Netherlands last month, the first time he had missed it since his breakthrough performance there in 2004, when he was 13.

Her old insurance, as a sole proprietor, had been canceled. Anxious to get the best option she could, she signed up for the platinum plan, which had the highest premium.

The tenant is not a person or a business, but Le Tricorne, a large curtain painted by Pablo Picasso that has decorated the Four Seasons Restaurant since its opening in 1959.

description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  What are they feeding the Dufour-Lapointe sisters of Canada? Is it some combination of fiber and protein? Can it be packaged and sold at Whole Foods? description: Stella, an 8-year-old Brussels Griffon, might have been a little more excited than usual as she whistled her way through the course at Saturdays inaugural Masters Agility Championship staged by the Westminster Kennel Club.

title: Broad Museum in Los Angeles Delays Opening Until 2015
description: LOS ANGELES  Officials at the Broad, the $140 million museum of contemporary art designed by Diller Scofidio & Renfro to showcase Eli and Edythe Broads vast collection, have for months been touting an opening here by the end of 2014. Mr. Broad has even been leading some of the hard-hat tours.

description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Dominant in the training runs, Bode Miller charged out of the start to the mens downhill Sunday and was soon leading by roughly a third of a second.

description: When a Beckham beckons, the fashion set answers. This will be no day of rest. Sunday morning of New York Fashion Week starts bright and early with the Victoria Beckham collection at 10 a.m.

title: Quora and the Search for Truth
description: The Internet has a nagging problem: There is lots of information, but often confusion about whats true. Many big websites try to solve this problem with their services. At least one, Quora, suggests that maybe we dont care that much about the truth.

title: In Our Pages: February 10
description: 1914: Turkish Women Warned Against Western Dress

title: Document | Made for More Than Walking
description: A single photograph of a womans legs may be titillating. But a cluster of 30 glamorous gams cut from the pages of glossy magazines is more than that. Legs, by the German artist Hans-Peter Feldmann, questions, with an erotomaniacs attention to detail, advertisings ravenous commodification of beauty. The 73-year-olds work, an obsessive appropriation of everyday objects  from photographs of unmade beds to the front pages of 250 newspapers dated Sept. 12, 2001  is in line with that of American conceptualists like Richard Prince and Dash Snow. And yet, he has trouble explaining his ideas: When they asked the Austrian composer Bruckner what inspired his masterwork Te Deum, he said it came to him while . . . eating a cheese sandwich. Feldmann frankly loves sitting in a cafe and admiring the pretty passers-by, but says that the best legs he knows belong to Ursula, his wife of more than 40 years. Is it sexist of me to focus so much on a womans legs? he wonders. I dont know. Ask the great inventor in the sky.

title: Jamie Anderson, Slopestyles Star, Is on Top Again
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Jamie Anderson stood at the top of the slopestyle course Sunday, her boots strapped to her snowboard and opportunity at her feet. She had won more of slopestyles big competitions than any other woman, but now the event was in the Olympics, and she had one run to capture the gold medal she was expected to win.

title: Rejecting the U.S. to Skate for Russia
description: SOCHI, Russia  In 2011, the South Korean short-track speedskating star Ahn Hyun-soo became a Russian citizen, changed his name to Viktor Ahn and pledged to compete for his adopted homeland at the Sochi Games. President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was said to be especially pleased.

title: Months After Deadly Fire, Owners of Bangladesh Factory Surrender to Court
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  A husband and wife whose factory in Bangladesh was consumed by fire in 2012, a disaster that killed 112 employees, surrendered to a court on Sunday in Dhaka, the capital.

title: Stirring Looks, Brooklyn to Nepal
description: Manhattan was reduced to a skyline of high rises shimmering across the water. A tangle of transport gear covered the Brooklyn Navy Yard, while inside one of the vast industrial spaces was a set with silvered pillars.

description: Matthias Mayer, the Austrian who claimed the Olympic downhill gold medal, spoke on Sunday about Bode Miller's run.

description: LONDON  The British immigration minister has resigned after revealing that his house cleaner of six years was living in the country illegally.

title: For Austrians, Downhill Is the Extreme Sport to Own
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Competitors do all manner of spectacular things above the snow at this postmodern stage of winter sports development: backside rodeos, double corks, tail grabs, switch mistys. The gravity-taunting soars on, and as the quadrenniums roll by, the Winter Olympics keep adding fresh diversions in an attempt to catch up with the curve.

title: Disruptions: For a Restful Night, Make Your Smartphone Sleep on the Couch
description: Weve all been there. You wake up in the middle of the night and grab your smartphone to check the time  its 3 a.m.  and see an alert. Before you know it, you fall down a rabbit hole of email and Twitter. Sleep? Forget it.

(CBS) THE BEATLES: THE NIGHT THAT CHANGED AMERICA  A GRAMMY SALUTE Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr perform together and are interviewed by David Letterman (above right, with Mr. McCartney, left, and Mr. Starr) in this 50th-anniversary tribute to the Beatles appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show on Feb. 9, 1964. Annie Lennox and Dave Stewart, temporarily reunited as Eurythmics; Alicia Keys, John Legend, Maroon 5, John Mayer, Keith Urban, Brad Paisley, Pharrell Williams, Katy Perry, Stevie Wonder, Ed Sheeran, Dave Grohl and Imagine Dragons also take the stage for this concert, taped on Jan. 27, to perform some of the bands greatest hits.

title: The Mens Downhill, Side by Side
description: Matthias Mayer of Austria won the mens downhill by remaining consistent, especially in the courses challenging middle section.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Parting Ways at Alexander Wang
description: I wanted to do hair that was very drawn on, like an illustration, the hairstylist Guido Palau said of the superslick and tight-to-the-head looks he created backstage at Alexander Wang last night. Fittingly, the inspiration turned out to be a fashion sketch the designer penned himself in advance of the show. To bring it all to life, Palau etched a deep side part with his comb and saturated strands in Redken Control Addict 28 High-Control Hairspray before wrapping them firmly around the head. Its like a very low sweep-over, like a mans hair, he remarked (otherwise known as the comb-over; who knew it could look so cool?). Palau then patted on a Redken Shine Flash 02 Glistening Mist for some sheen, and pulled strands into a slim ponytail, which was later tucked out of sight into the models clothing. To reinforce this idea of hair-as-fashion-illustration, he also painted away the part lines with makeup to prevent any skin from showing, and gave the models who closed the show  including Karlie Kloss, Jacquetta Wheeler and Joan Smalls  a blast of colored hair powder for an ultra-matte effect, like ink set to dry on paper.

title: Israel Orders Airstrike Against Gaza Militant
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military said that it carried out an airstrike early Sunday against a Palestinian militant in Gaza responsible for firing rockets into Israel. Medical officials in Gaza reported that the target of the strike, who was riding a motorcycle, was critically wounded and a bystander was hurt.

title: State-Sanctioned Snooping to Keep Progress at Bay
description: Peer into the history of the South, and its not hard to find things that once might have seemed acceptable to many people but today register as appalling. Spies of Mississippi is such an exploration, one with an especially clear parallel to today.

title: With a Cloud Over Woodson, Durant Adds to the Knicks Troubles
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  It was another day under the spotlight for Mike Woodson, another day spent trying to sidestep it.

title: But You Cant Deny Destiny
description: Just days before his wedding, Nikhil finds himself in a bit of a bind: Not only does he need to prove his business savvy, and therefore worth, to his fiance, but he also must keep her recently returned, long-estranged sister, Meeta, out of sight. Its a recipe for failure. But in Vinil Mathews Hasee Toh Phasee, the setup is also the perfect foil to what is an imperfect union.

title: Swiss Voters Narrowly Approve Curbs on Immigration
description: BERLIN  A narrow majority of voters in Switzerland approved proposals on Sunday that would reintroduce restrictions on the number of foreigners who are allowed to live and work in the country, a move that could have far-reaching implications for Switzerlands relations with the European Union.

title: Bloody Trouble at School
description: The family line for the teenage flick Vampire Academy may trace back to Dracula, but the recycling policy is strictly from Frankenstein. Directed by Mark Waters and written by Daniel Waters, his brother, this genre rehash takes a helping of Harry Potter, a measure of Mean Girls and elements from various teenage adventures, monster movies and queen-bee stories and recombines the borrowed parts into an unsurprisingly familiar tale. What is surprising is that while the patchwork whole creaks terribly in places, the parts also show signs of life.

title: Europes Painful Past Colors a Film Festival
description: BERLIN  From Wes Andersons The Grand Budapest Hotel, a tender, urbane caper set in a lost world of interwar Europe, to George Clooneys The Monuments Men, in which the Allies try to save priceless art from the Nazis, Europes past  real, imagined, unresolved  is very present at this years Berlin International Film Festival.

title: Fox Cancels The X Factor After Three Seasons
description: Fox has canceled its version of the singing competition series The X Factor after three seasons. The announcement followed a statement by the programs creator, Simon Cowell, who said that he would resume his hosting duties this year on the original British incarnation. Last year, for a number of reasons, I had to make a decision to return to the U.K. version of The X Factor in 2014, Mr. Cowell said. So for now, Im back to the U.K., and I want to thank Fox for being an incredible partner, and I also want to thank everybody who has supported my shows. The X Factor completed its third season in December, drawing 6.2 million total viewers for its finale. Before the series premiere in September 2011, Mr. Cowell said that if the show did not pull in 20 million viewers, it would have to be considered a failure. It fell well short of that, attracting 12.5 million at the start, and it never matched the ratings heights of American Idol (once the judging home of Mr. Cowell) on Fox or The Voice on NBC.

title: A Raisin in the Sun Loses Diahann Carroll
description: Diahann Carroll has dropped out of the Broadway revival of Lorraine Hansberrys 1959 drama A Raisin in the Sun. Ms. Carroll, 78, below, was cast for the role of Lena Younger opposite Denzel Washington as Walter Lee Younger, but she has decided to withdraw due to the demands of the vigorous rehearsal schedule and the subsequent eight-performances-a-week playing schedule, according to Philip Rinaldi, a spokesman for the production. LaTanya Richardson Jackson (Joe Turners Come and Gone) is to assume the role in her place. This was to be Ms. Carrolls first role on Broadway in over 30 years. She last appeared in a production of John Pielmeiers play Agnes of God in 1983. In 2004, Ms. Carroll, a breast cancer survivor, also had to drop out of a Kennedy Center production of Ernest Thompsons On Golden Pond because of a herniated disk and severe muscle strain. A Raisin in the Sun is scheduled to begin previews on March 8 at theEthel BarrymoreTheater, with opening night set for April 3 for a 14-week run.

title: Hailee Steinfeld at Prabal Gurung
description: A streaker notwithstanding, Prabal Gurungs show went off without a hitch Saturday morning. Hailee Steinfeld, the 17-year-old actress, arrived near 11:15 a.m., punctual by fashion standards, shepherded by her Teen Vogue pal Andrew Bevan. Despite what may be an early weekend hour for the teenage actress, she was preternaturally polished in a monochromatic knit ensemble and black felt fedora.

title: A Writers Pantheon, Focused on the Details

title: Rectitude and Desire, Both at Sea
description: Brittens opera Billy Budd is the wrenching story of its title character, a young, nave and guileless sailor pressed into service aboard a British war ship in 1797. Rather than resent the loss of his liberty, Billy, a foundling, is grateful to be part of something important, a contributing member of a community.

title: Bounding Toward Balletic Maturity
description: Growing up involves successive acts of bravery. You must learn how to cross a street, pass examinations, take public transportation  things that so soon become standard fare that we forget their initial challenge. And so it is with dance. Child dancers regularly learn aspects of technique that are beyond the capacity of us nondancers. But in big theaters, its easy to take much for granted  whereas studio conditions bring us closer to the practical physics of ballet. On Saturday night, when the young dancers of American Ballet Theaters Studio Company performed at the 92nd Street Y Buttenwieser Hall, their courage was evident  and admirable  in the opening ensemble adagio of the first item.

title: Get Lucky, Sochi Style
description: The Olympics usually mint new and unlikely stars. Nearly always, they are athletes. But on Friday night, a group of mostly stern-looking police officers became sudden celebrities by covering Get Lucky, Daft Punks Grammy Award-winning record of the year shortly before the opening ceremony of the Winter Games from Sochi, Russia. The performance by the Ministry of Internal Affairs choir of Get Lucky went viral: It has been seen about 750,000 times since NBC posted it online. The choirs reward: an appearance on Monday morning on NBCs Today. The incongruity of the choir, dressed in evergreen uniforms accented by yellow braided cords, performing the slightly racy song (Shes up all night for good fun/Im up all night to get lucky), doubtlessly accounts for its appeal. The two lead singers were the stars (a baritone joined them later); some others bobbed their heads but did not get funky, while others looked uncomfortable at their surreal dip into dance music. Rolling Stone labeled the police choirs rendition incredible and noted the officers hilarious old, goofy man dancing at a wedding reception dance moves. A spokeswoman for Daft Punk had no comment on the choirs cover. The performance followed a studio version of the same number that was posted on YouTube in November. That performance, even more animated than Fridays, has been viewed nearly 4.4 million times.

It was, as you might guess, a call for tough-minded but compassionate economic policy. Unfortunately, what we actually got  especially, although not only, from Republicans  was the opposite. And its difficult to find a better example of the hardhearted, softheaded nature of todays G.O.P. than what happened last week, as Senate Republicans once again used the filibuster to block aid to the long-term unemployed.

title: Mercy in the Justice System
description: The constitutional provision that gives the president virtually unlimited authority to grant clemency was not an afterthought. The founders understood very well that there could be miscarriages of justice even under the rule of law. By allowing the president to commute unjust sentences or pardon deserving petitioners who had served their time, they sought to ensure that the workings of the courts could be tempered with mercy.

title: Closing In on Basic Mideast Principles

By the end of March, the world is likely to know whether they have been successful. If the two sides agree on basic principles  a framework for further talks  it will be an important step. But then comes the even tougher task of translating principles into a final deal that would recognize a Palestinian state alongside Israel.

title: Celebrating Bert Berns, Sometimes Overlooked, but Not Forgotten
description: The songwriters who pounded out pop hits in the Brill Building and other New York hit factories in the 1950s and early 1960s, though eclipsed in the wake of the British Invasion, have mostly found a comfortable niche in pop music history by now. Carole King went on to have a rich career, and now her early days as part of the Goffin-King songwriting team are being revisited on Broadway in Beautiful  which also shines a light on the collaboration of their friendly competitors, Cynthia Weil and Barry Mann. Others, like Neil Sedaka, Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller, and Jeff Barry and Ellie Greenwich have all maintained their hold on the spotlight.

title: After Prize, Novel Gets 2nd Chance in the U.S.
description: Last November, St. Martins Press published a debut novel, Where the Moon Isnt, that few people seemed to notice. Reviewers mostly ignored it. Sales were tepid. Somewhat confusingly, the book was released in Britain in May under a different title, The Shock of the Fall, which its publisher there preferred.

title: Chamber Music Society Announces Season
description: The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center plans to open its 45th anniversary season on Oct. 15 with the pianist Alessio Bax playing a pair of Mozart concertos for piano and string quintet, and will present more than 120 concerts, with about half in New York and half on tour. The season, which is being announced Monday, shows how large the society has grown since its first season in 1969, when it presented only 21 concerts; the society said that its ticket revenue has grown by 50 percent over the last five years. This season will include the German baritone Christian Gerhaher performing Schuberts Winterreise, three performances of Bachs Brandenburg Concertos, and a continuation of its new music series in the Kaplan Penthouse.

title: Report Says Not Enough Children Get HPV Vaccine
description: Not enough children in the United States are being vaccinated against the cancer-causing human papillomavirus, or HPV, according to a report issued on Monday by the Presidents Cancer Panel. The viruses, transmitted by intimate contact, cause cancers of the cervix, vagina, vulva, anus and penis and areas near the throat. Vaccines can protect against two strains that cause most of the cancers, and a series of three injections is recommended for boys and girls starting at age 11 to 12. But in 2012, only about a third of girls ages 13 to 15 and less than 7 percent of boys in the United States had received the shots. Vaccination rates are much higher in Australia (71.2 percent) and Britain (60.4 percent). Doctors and parents need better education, the report says, and it also urges that pharmacists be allowed to give the injections.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 8 P.M. (CNBC) THE 138TH WESTMINSTER KENNEL CLUB DOG SHOW The rat terrier, the Portuguese Podengo Pequeno and the Chinook are the latest additions to the American Kennel Clubs list of more than 170 recognized purebreds at this event held each year at Madison Square Garden. Judging begins on this opening night with the hound, toy, nonsporting and herding groups. Sporting, working and terrier groups, followed by best in show, are to be judged from 8 to 11 p.m. Tuesday on USA. David Frei and Erica Hill are the hosts. Banana Joe, an affenpinscher, is the reigning top dog.

title: 50 Years Later, Beatles Steal Another Show
description: If theres one thing pop has learned in the last 50 years, its that Beatles songs never wear out their welcome. The Beatles original recordings have retained not only their musical brilliance but also the nearly universal good will that the band generated in its time, as well as the accumulated nostalgia that makes baby boomers conflate its music with all the pleasures of their youth. On purely musical grounds  the foundation of melodies, harmonies and lyrics  Beatles songs have thrived through half a century of remakes.
