description: New York

title: Comcast Deal Seeks to Unite 2 Cable Giants
description: Comcast announced on Thursday an agreement to acquire Time Warner Cable for more than $45 billion in stock, a deal that would combine the biggest and second-biggest cable television operators in the country.

title: What to Watch at the Olympics: Thursday
description: HOCKEY The N.H.L. part of the Olympics continues with the first games for the United States and Canada. U.S.-Slovakia, NBCSN, 7:30 a.m.; Canada-Norway, USA, noon.

title: Lawlessness Is Undoing Effort to Save Honduran Forests
description: COPN, Honduras  Nine men were harvesting mahogany deep in the woods here when Alonso Pineda and his son appeared, carrying shotguns. An arrest warrant hangs over the two for clearing the forest illegally, but on that day they posed as its protectors.

title: High-Level Talks Between Koreas End Without an Agreement
description: An unusual high-level dialogue between North and South Korea ended without an agreement on Wednesday, casting doubt on prospects for reunions of families separated in the Korean War that the two Koreas have planned to hold later this month. The meeting of senior officials, the highest-level government talks between the countries in seven years, was held at Panmunjom on their mutual border at the suggestion of the North, which has recently called for improved relations. The meeting stalled because of sharp differences over the terms of improving relations. North Korean delegates left Panmunjom without even exchanging handshakes with their southern counterparts, officials in Seoul said.

title: Highlights From Our Social Feeds at NYFW, Day 7
Venezuela: At Least Two People Are Killed in Protests
description: At least two people were killed in unrest in Caracas on Wednesday, officials said, as thousands of people took to the streets of the capital in the largest antigovernment protest in months. The violence erupted after government opponents attended a peaceful march and rally called to protest the arrest of student demonstrators elsewhere in the country. Following the march, several hundred young protesters threw rocks at riot police officers and broke windows in a government building. One demonstrator was shot in the head and killed, and protesters blamed armed pro-government supporters. Later, President Nicols Maduro said a community activist he had known for years had also been killed. Diosdado Cabello, the president of the National Assembly, said the man was killed by fascists, a term the government uses for its opponents. Mr. Maduro later said on television, I alert the world: we are facing a planned coup dtat. The protests in various cities in recent weeks have sprung from widespread discontent amid increasing economic problems, including high inflation.

title: Review Finds Police Failure to Report Driver Friskings
description: When police officers pulled over David Modeste for the third time in three weeks in 2012, he was driving his Lexus around noon near his home in eastern Queens. Three officers, in plainclothes and an unmarked car, believed the sedan had illegally tinted windows.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 12, 2014
Lenovo Reports Income Increase as It Expands
description: TOKYO  Lenovo, the worlds biggest maker of personal computers, reported Thursday it had made progress in its plan to expand beyond PCs, even before a planned acquisition of Motorola Mobility.

title: Nets Reserves Take the Lead Once Again
description: The Nets bench did the heavy lifting again in the first half, but the reserves got help from the starters in the second, rolling to an easy 105-89 victory over the Charlotte Bobcats on Wednesday at Barclays Center.

description: New York

description: In theory, the Knicks could have eased into the N.B.A.s All-Star weekend, playing one last game against the Western Conferences worst team before the break. But the idea that anything might come easily for them this season has long been proved a fallacy.

description: Despite Brazils sharp slowdown in economic growth, the country has no intention of emulating Chinas low-wage model of competitiveness as a way to promote prosperity, former President Luiz Incio Lula da Silva said Wednesday.

title: Mets Add Valverde to the Bullpen

He will join Vic Black and Kyle Farnsworth as candidates to set up the incumbent closer, Bobby Parnell, who had surgery in September for a herniated disk.

He owns shares in broadly diversified mutual funds whose holdings include JPMorgan Chase stock.

description: The recent moon launch by China was to be a testament to the countrys technological prowess, as it joined Russia and the United States in the exclusive club of countries sending successful soft landing missions that allow them to explore the lunar surface.

title: Xi Touts Communist Party as Defender of Confuciuss Virtues
description: Xi Jinping wants you to memorize The Analects of Confucius. Chinas Communist Party chief says that the homegrown thoughts of the ancient sage offer an antidote not just for his own countrys ills, but also for Western societies whose faith in capitalism has been battered by the economic slump.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 2 P.M. (Starz Cinema) THE DIVING BELL AND THE BUTTERFLY (2007) Jean-Dominique Bauby, a 43-year-old French magazine editor and something of a playboy, had a stroke in 1995 that left him with a condition in which he retained vision, hearing and a functioning mind but was almost completely paralyzed. He told his story in a book that he dictated to an assistant by blinking. In this film from the artist Julian Schnabel, Bauby is played by Mathieu Amalric; Emmanuelle Seigner is Cline, the longtime partner he has recently left and the mother of his three children; and Marie-Jose Croze is the speech therapist who teaches him to use his left eyelid to communicate. The phrase triumph of the human spirit hovers over The Diving Bell and the Butterfly, along with a swarm of other empty, uplifting clichs, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. But Mr. Schnabel and the screenwriter, Ronald Harwood, have other themes in mind  among them, limitation, constraint and incarceration  Mr. Scott said. (Both men were nominated for Oscars.) Their common subject, however, is freedom, the self-willed liberation of a difficult, defiant individual, Mr. Scott wrote, adding that Mr. Schnabel demonstrated this with imaginative freedom in every frame and sequence, dispensing with narrative and expository conventions in favor of a wild, intuitive honesty.

title: In Prison Release, Signs of Karzais Rift With U.S.
description: BAGRAM, Afghanistan  On Thursday at 9:10 a.m., the gates of the Bagram Prison swung open, and 65 men with long beards and new clothes walked out to freedom. The moment showed clearly just how thoroughly President Hamid Karzai had broken with the American military, here now 12 years.

title: Elizabeth and James: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: As U.S. Aims for Energy Independence, China Heads the Opposite Way
description: President Barack Obama told Americans in his State of the Union address last month that thanks to increased natural gas production and conservation, the country was closer to energy independence than it had been in decades. Thats not something youll be hearing from Xi Jinping, his Chinese counterpart, anytime soon: Chinas reliance on imported oil is rising fast, according to a new study by a government research institute.

title: Apple Says War Zones Dont Ship Its Supplies
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple released on Thursday its supplier responsibility report, and the company said its hardware factories did not use any tantalum, a metal commonly used in electronics, from areas engaged in warfare.

description: Shanghais skyscrapers have been the setting of some stunning images, like these photos taken by Wei Gensheng, a crane operator.

title: How to Build a Perfect Refugee Camp
description: From the outside, the temporary shelter for Syrian civilians in Kilis, Turkey, doesnt look like an inviting place to live. It looks like a prison. All around are olive groves, but here, Turkey suddenly runs out. A metal archway announces the customs gate to Syria. To its right stands what is more formally known as the Republic of Turkey Prime Ministry Disaster and Emergency Management Presidencys Kilis Oncupinar Accommodation Facility. High gates bar entry, and barbed wire tops the walls. Police officers and private security mill about.

title: In Restive Remote China, Uighurs Piety and Peace
description: Its rare to see mainstream news media reports on Xinjiang, Chinas western borderland region, that do not invoke turbulent, restive, unstable or some variation. The area has long been the site of ethnic tensions between the majority Han Chinese and the Uighurs, Chinas Turkic-speaking Muslim minority. But tight government controls on information and access make reporting on such clashes and protests, as well as everyday life, exceedingly difficult.

title: Sass & Bide's Global Expansion
description: After 15 years, Sarah Jane-Clark and Heidi Middleton, the designers for Sass & Bide, are expanding their company across the globe with a new store in New York City and fashion partnerships in Africa.

description: What can you learn from Olympic athletes about how to manage your own doubts and fears and succeed at what you want to do?

description: SINGAPORE  While the Indonesian government is snubbing the Singapore Airshow this week, the countrys main military manufacturer is using it as an opportunity for a coming-out party, with staff members in orange flight suits courting potential buyers.

title: Andhra Pradesh Lawmakers Turn Violent After Telangana Bill Is Introduced

title: Clone Wars Moves to Netflix
description: Not that long ago, Frank Underwood from House of Cards could boast that he was the most diabolical villain to appear on Netflix. But now hes facing some stiff competition from the Sith Lords of Star Wars. On Thursday, Netflix said that it had struck a deal with Lucasfilm and the Disney/ABC Television Group (as well as the Galactic Republic) to show the sixth and final season of the animated series Star Wars: The Clone Wars on its streaming video service.

title: Hong Kongs Indentured Servants
description: Erwiana Sulistyaningsih, a 23-year-old Indonesian maid, returned to her home province of Java from Hong Kong last month hardly able to walk. Cuts and burns covered most of her body. Her employer in Hong Kong allegedly beat her and locked her up for weeks.

description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  The United States swept the podium in the first-ever Olympic mens ski slopestyle competition on Thursday afternoon, only the third time in history the Americans have swept an event at the Winter Games.

title: In Matter of Weeks, Meeting of Minds on Cable Giants Deal
description: Updated, 9:14 p.m. | For months, a scrappy cable upstart thought it had Time Warner Cable on the run.

title: China to Reward Cities and Regions Making Progress on Air Pollution
description: BEIJING  Chinese officials announced Thursday that they were offering a total of 10 billion renminbi, or $1.65 billion, this year to cities and regions that make significant progress in air pollution control, according to a report by Xinhua, the state-run news agency.

title: Norwegian Air Swings to a Loss
description: PARIS  Norwegian Air Shuttle, the Scandinavian budget carrier, on Thursday reported a loss in the fourth quarter and sharply lower profits for 2013. The declines were the result of heavy investments in new long-haul aircraft and other expenses linked to its rapid and controversial expansion into Southeast Asia and the United States.

title: Comcast Scoops Up Time Warner Cable
description: COMCAST SWOOPS IN TO ACQUIRE TIME WARNER CABLE | Time Warner Cable has been dodging a takeover for months, but it finally accepted another suitor with a sweeter offer. Comcast on Thursday announced an agreement to acquire Time Warner Cable in an all-stock deal valued at about $45.2 billion. The merger will unite the biggest and second-biggest cable television operators in the country, David Gelles writes in DealBook. Under the terms of the deal, Time Warner Cable shareholders will receive $158.82 a share based on Comcasts closing price on Wednesday.

title: How Absolute Power Can Delight Absolutely
description: House of Cards may well be the most joyless show on television.

title: In Performance: Jonathan Groff
description: On Saturday the actor Jonathan Groff, one of the stars of the new HBO series Looking, will perform two shows as part of the American Songbook series at Lincoln Center. With a nod to Valentines Day, Mr. Groff recently taped this In Performance video featuring an excerpt from the number I Got Lost in His Arms, from the 1946 musical Annie Get Your Gun, with music and lyrics by Irving Berlin.

title: In Our Pages: February 14
description: 1939: Belgian Abandons Efforts

title: Olympic Officials Scramble to Counter Warm Weather
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  With the Winter Olympics melting under a heat wave, the effects could be seen Thursday from the coast of Sochi, where spectators were spotted sunbathing, to the mountains high above the city, where cross-country skiers raced in sleeveless jerseys. The balmy weather has forced changes in competition schedules, sent workers scrambling to harden the slushy snow and made Olympians reconsider what to wear for their warm-weather winter sports.

title: Because Curlers Can Pull Muscles, Too
description: SOCHI, Russia  Among the things that a curling team would not seem to need, an official athletic trainer might rank with a beach umbrella and a maid to sweep up after the athletes. But here is Brian McWilliams, a certified athletic trainer, on hand to treat any injury that might befall an American curler.

title: Happy Wife, Happy Life
description: Dear Diary:

title: Worker Struck by Sled at Sliding Track
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  A track maintenance employee working on the Olympic bobsled track was struck by a sled Thursday just before a training heat began. The man was treated by medics on the track and taken by helicopter to a hospital. A spokesman for the International Olympic Committee said the man was conscious and had two broken legs.

title: Phantom Melodies Yield Real Clues to Brains Workings
description: In 2011, a 66-year-old retired math teacher walked into a London neurological clinic hoping to get some answers. A few years earlier, she explained to the doctors, she had heard someone playing a piano outside her house. But then she realized there was no piano.

title: Video: Blanchett and Her Shakespearean King, Jasmine
description: The title character Cate Blanchett plays in Blue Jasmine has reminded some commentators of Blanche DuBois and others of Ruth Madoff. But the role of Jasmine French, the self-deceiving society type reeling from her husbands fraud, reminds the actress of none other than Shakespeares Richard II.

title: The Comcast-Time Warner Deal, by the Numbers
description: The all-stock, $45.2 billion deal by Comcast to buy Time Warner Cable is set to create a major player in the cable business. Here is a look at some of the important numbers.

title: Sid Caesar, Television Comedian, Dies
description: Mr. Caesar headlined Your Show of Shows, which pioneered the way for later comic television.

title: Greek Yogurt Meant for Olympians Will Be Donated, Chobani Says
description: In the cold war over yogurt, America blinked.

title: Comcasts Deal for Time Warner Cable Is Big Win for Advisers
description: Comcasts $45 billion takeover of Time Warner Cable isnt just a victory for the cable giant. Its also an unexpected win for the companys advisers.

title: Big Cable Mergers in Europe Are Still Hard to Make
description: LONDON  For many European analysts, the Continents telecommunications industry is ripe for consolidation.

title: Students Who Lose Recess Are the Ones Who Need It Most
description: Despite overwhelming evidence that periods of unstructured play and social interaction are a crucial part of childrens cognitive, academic, physical and mental wellness, schools continue to take away recess privileges as a penalty for academic or behavioral transgressions. Ive done it, many times. When students fail to hand in assignments or when a child acts up in class, Ive taken their recess privileges hostage. I did it both as a way of punishing for bad behavior or as a way to carve out a few extra minutes of learning time in an otherwise packed day.

title: U.N. Security Council Urged to Act on Humanitarian Aid to Syria
description: UNITED NATIONS  The hard-won humanitarian cease-fire in the Syrian city of Homs  the sole success that occurred during the peace talks in Geneva  cannot be considered progress, the United Nations top official for emergency operations said Thursday evening as she urged the Security Council to ensure that aid reach those who need it and aid workers can do their work without getting shot.

title: Winter Offensive Takes Toll on East Coast
description: A powerful storm system swept up the East Coast on Thursday, leaving in its wake downed power lines, stranded travelers, abandoned vehicles and yet another mess of snow, slush and ice.

title: In Haiti, Beauty That Plays Hard to Get (To)
description: Its hard to know exactly how many waterfalls there are on the side of the mountain in a remote corner of southeast Haiti. From my vantage point on a nearby slope, I counted at least a dozen, and that was at the end of the dry season last year. The rainy season in the spring, Id been told, puts the cascade in Cascade Pichon.

title: Austins Moon Towers, Beyond Dazed and Confused
description: There are two kinds of people who think it would be cool to move to Austin.

title: Alcoholism Through a Doctors Eyes
description: When I teach medical students about alcoholism, it is never easy. Students arrive with preconceived notions and stereotypes obtained from books, television and films  and their personal upbringings  about the subject.

title: Take a Punch, Hope for a Hit
description: Massive sides of fake beef were being suspended from hooks onstage as workers zigzagged purposefully through the controlled chaos that was the Winter Garden Theater the other day. Somewhere in the middle of it all, taking a minute before a group stretch-and-limber session, was the man whose characters name was already on the marquee outside and whose left eye was still black and blue from a poorly timed encounter with another actors glove a week or two earlier.

title: Thai Court Orders Protest Leader Released From Detention
description: A Thai court on Thursday ordered the release from detention of a prominent leader of the protest movement seeking to overthrow the government, a case that highlights the movements influential backing amid Thailands debilitating power struggle.

title: Excerpt: 'Dinner With Friends'
description: A scene from the Roundabout Theater's revival of the Donald Margulies play.

title: Laura Lippman: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of After Im Gone likes books steeped in the quotidian. You can learn how to run a chicken-and-waffle restaurant by reading Mildred Pierce.

title: General Motors Recalls 778,000 Small Cars for Ignition Switch Problem
description: UPDATED: Feb. 14, 2014, 10:47 a.m.

title: Obama Raises Minimum Wage for Contract Workers
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama signed an executive order on Wednesday to raise the minimum wage to $10.10 an hour from $7.25 an hour for federal contract workers starting in 2015, a promise he made in his State of the Union address last month.

title: Shafqat Islam, Chief of NewsCred, on Irrational Optimism
description: This interview with Shafqat Islam, chief executive of NewsCred, a content marketing platform, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Womens Halfpipe
description: The womens snowboarding halfpipe produced a lot of big jumps and a surprise winner in Kaitlyn Farrington of the United States.

title: Among the Believers
description: I expected to be pained by Adam Gopniks New Yorker essay on atheism and belief, but I didnt expect to be quite so  puzzled by his depiction of contemporary belief. Gopnik clearly has sympathy for the religious side of the argument hes describing  or at the very least hes strainingto be sympathetic. But given the premises hes working from, that sympathy manifests itself in a peculiar and telling misreadingof what theists actually believe.

title: Comcast-Time Warner Deal: How Its Playing on Twitter
description: It is a huge merger between two household names. So, naturally, Comcasts deal to buy Time Warner Cable is lighting up social media with quips and analyses.

title: How to Be a Better Valentine, Through Economics
description: Paul Oyer is a professor of economics as Stanford Universitys Graduate School of Business and the author of Everything I Ever Needed to Know About Economics I Learned From Online Dating. He answered questions about the book in a recent post on Economix.

title: Poetry Pairing | I have to tell you
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing features I have to tell you by Dorothea Grossman and The Memory Ladys Daughter Tries to Fill the Gaps by Beth Thompson.

title: Comcast Has History of Big Deals
description: Brian Roberts, the chairman and chief executive of Comcast, has an appetite for big deals.

title: As Evgeni Plushenko Bows Out, Yuzuru Hanyu Soars to a Figure Skating Record
description: SOCHI, Russia  As Evgeni Plushenko warmed up Thursday night, he stumbled where a few days ago he had been so sturdy and charismatic. After he withdrew from the mens short program before a stunned home crowd, and later retired, calamity seemed to spread as if it were contagious, like the flu.

title: Today in Small Business: Entrepreneurial Nightmares
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today?

title: Clothes and Character: Invisible Woman
description: Costume design isnt just telling actors what to wear, says Michael OConnor, the man behind The Invisible Womans blossoming cravats and crinoline cages. Its a conversation.

title: A Clubhouse for Women of Worry
description: Its not quite the next Club Macanudo, but a number of millennial men are discovering regular group shvitzes, bonding at the banyas on East 10th Street or Fulton.

title: Image of the Day: February 13
On Giant Slalom: Ted Ligety
description: No skier in the world carves turns the way Ted Ligety does. The American has practically invented a new way of skiing.

title: Plenty to Watch in Giant Cable Deal
description: Comcast just gave merger junkies plenty to watch on cable.

title: Donald Trumps Magical Powers
description: In addition to his other reality-based issues  thinking any serious person wants him to be president, for example  Donald Trump has a cause-and-effect problem. He believes that when he mentions something in public, any related action that follows was his doing. Like when a small child closes his eyes and thinks he made the world disappear.

title: U.S. Backs New Global Initiative Against Infectious Diseases
description: The United States government said on Thursday it would spend $40 million to help low and middle-income countries develop and improve sophisticated systems to detect and respond to threats of infectious diseases, epidemics and bioterrorism. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said it was already working with Uganda and Vietnam, and that it would expand to include India, Kenya, Ethopia and Tanzania. The projects goals include creating high-tech laboratories and trained teams that would respond rapidly to threats from diseases such as Avian flu, SARS, tuberculosis, and antibiotic-resistant illnesses. The C.D.C. aims to extend the program to 30 countries over five years to cover 4 billion people.

title: Clintons Introduce New Womens Global Initiative
description: Its been almost 20 years since Hillary Rodham Clinton solidified her feminist credentials and declared, wearing a pale pink suit in Beijing, Womens rights are human rights and human rights are womens rights.

title: After Inquiry, Puerto Rican Day Parade Replaces Board
description: The nonprofit group that organizes the National Puerto Rican Day Parade will be significantly overhauled after a state investigation that found years of financial mismanagement in running the annual extravaganza on Fifth Avenue favored by celebrities, politicians, corporate sponsors and tens of thousands of marchers.

title: Vox Anti-Populi
description: Right now the online current-policy economics journal VoxEU  edited by my old student Richard Baldwin  has two fantastic pieces on inequality.

title: Times Minute | Comcast's Mega Deal
description: Also on the Minute, Cate Blanchett's source of inspiration for her role in the film "Blue Jasmine," and scientists plan to sequence King Richard III's genetic code.

title: Comcast and Time Warner Cable Forgo a Breakup Fee
description: Comcasts $45 billion takeover of Time Warner Cable has a lot of numbers that stand out. Among them is the breakup fee if either side walks away.

title: The 2,000 Year Apartment
description: Bloomberg reports on the soaring prices of trophy apartments in Manhattan. The biggest sale so far was former Citigroup head Sandy Weills apartment, which he sold for $88 milion to the daughter of a Russian oligarch. But $100 million listings are out there.

title: Fortress Buys Back Stake From Nomura
description: The Fortress Investment Group, the first publicly listed hedge fund in the United States, has bought back a stake from Nomura, one of its principal investors.

title: Israeli Forces Kill Palestinian at Gaza Border
description: GAZA  Israeli forces stationed along the border with Gaza fatally shot one Palestinian man and wounded another on Thursday, according to a Palestinian official.

description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Julieta Cervantes.

title: Verizon Wireless Expands Mobile Data Plans
description: AT&T has made several big moves recently, including price cuts for its family plans, to fight off T-Mobile US and hold onto its customers. Now Verizon Wireless is sweetening its phone plans, too.

title: Apprehensive, Many Doctors Shift to Jobs With Salaries
description: American physicians, worried about changes in the health care market, are streaming into salaried jobs with hospitals. Though the shift from private practice has been most pronounced in primary care, specialists are following.

title: 19th Is as Good as Gold for Oft-Injured Downhill Skier
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  It is never easy being a ski racer from a snow-challenged country like England, something Chemmy Alcott has known all her life. The path grew more arduous when she broke her neck skiing at 12 and had two vertebrae surgically fused.

title: Italys Prime Minister Announces Resignation Amid Party Revolt
description: ROME  Prime Minister Enrico Letta, whose weak coalition government has come under increasing criticism, announced on Thursday that he would resign, after his own Democratic Party staged a dramatic insurrection and set the stage to replace him with the partys new leader, Matteo Renzi.

title: A Timelapse of Snow Covering Washington
description: The biggest snowstorm of the year hit Washington Wednesday night, closing federal offices on Thursday.

title: Charles Mingus-Inspired Jazz at Manhattan School of Music
description: The Miser once showed up for a shift at his college radio station as the previous D.J. was winding down his set in rollicking style with Charles Minguss Better Git It in Your Soul. Emerging from his reverie, the Misers colleague turned and exclaimed, If I had heard this when I was 12, I never would have bothered with punk rock.

title: Hopes, and Homes, Crumbling on Indian Tea Plantations
description: NAHORANI TEA ESTATE, India  For a century and a half, Madhu Mundas forebears toiled on the same tea plantation that she lives and works on now. Belonging to central Indian tribes brought to what is now the northeastern state of Assam by the British in the mid-19th century, they and millions of other plantation workers survived as little more than indentured servants, even as the British Raj gave way to Indian democracy.

title: Fashion Week Parties: Night 7
description: Lil Kim performed for The Blonds; Jeremy Scott partied at Up & Down.

title: Prospect of Spanish Citizenship Appeals to Descendants of Jews Expelled in 1492
description: JERUSALEM  A Spanish initiative that would offer citizenship to Sephardic Jews as a gesture of conciliation for Spains expulsion of Jews during the Inquisition has set off a flurry of interest in Israel.

description: You wont like it, we are warned.

title: Matt Lauers Olympian Assignment for NBC Begins Early and Ends Late
description: Matt Lauer will pinch-host again Thursday night for Bob Costas, NBCs prime-time anchor at the Winter Games in Sochi, as Mr. Costas continues to treat his infected eyes.

title: Putin Encourages Egyptians Presidential Ambitions
description: CAIRO  Field Marshal Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi, a universally acknowledged but unannounced presidential candidate, received an early endorsement on Thursday from President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Scholastic Gives Kids a Video-Game Power-Up
description: A friends son just brought home his Scholastic News, excited to share a particular article. Scholastic News isnt available online, and its short, so Ill share the item here:

title: Obama to Nominate Jane Chu to Head Arts Endowment
description: President Obama announced his intention to nominate Jane Chu, a pianist and arts administrator from Kansas City, Mo., to lead the National Endowment for the Arts, which has been without a permanent chief for more than a year.

description: Like his co-stars Cate Blanchett and Sally Hawkins, Bobby Cannavale was party to Woody Allens idiosyncratic filmmaking process when he won a part in Blue Jasmine. For starters, he was only allowed to read his characters part of the script, and even then, not for long.

description: The latest womens collection from Calvin Klein at New York Fashion Week.
