description: It has been a little more than a year since William A. Ackman announced a $1 billion bet against Herbalife, the nutritional supplements company, and that wager is still in the red.

title: Slovakian Players Absence Affects Teammates and Foes
description: SOCHI, Russia  His familys background could have made the game more complicated for United States forward Paul Stastny, so on the eve of his Sochi Games debut, his father, Peter, kept his advice simple. Have fun, he told his son, and savor every shift.

title: When New Yorkers Use Umbrellas During Snowstorms
description: The snow continues to fall, were in the middle of a winter boot shortage and New Yorkers on Twitter and elsewhere are talking about a sensitive topic:

title: Anchorman
description: Paddy Chayefskys Oscar-winning screenplay for the 1976 film Network was, and remains, the kind of literate, darkly funny and breathtakingly prescient material that prompts many to claim it as the greatest screenplay of the 20th century. In Mad as Hell: The Making of Network and the Fateful Vision of the Angriest Man in Movies, Dave Itzkoff, a culture reporter for The New York Times, takes us behind the curtain and shows us why.

title: Car Bomb Kills 5 Outside Airport in Somalia
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  At least five people were killed and a dozen wounded on Thursday when a car loaded with explosives blew up outside a restaurant next to the entrance to the international airport in Mogadishu, officials said.

title: Assessing Who Benefits From the Latest Rulings on the Employer Mandate
description: Seth Perretta is a benefits lawyer in Washington who has represented several trade groups while the Internal Revenue Service has been writing the rules governing the Affordable Care Acts employer mandate.

title: ScienceTake: War of the Ants
description: Tawny crazy ants are replacing the notorious fire ant with the help of a never-before-seen chemical defense.

title: Shakespeare in the Park Lineup: Much Ado About Nothing and King Lear
description: The witty banter of Beatrice and Benedick and the avaricious scheming of Goneril and Regan will animate this summers Shakespeare in the Park, the Public Theaters annual series of free performances at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park. The series, which the Public announced on Thursday, begins with Much Ado About Nothing, which opens on June 3 for a five-week run. King Lear, the second of the two productions, opens on July 22 and runs through Aug. 17.

title: Polo Lets Women Play, Too
description: I am launching Polo Ralph Lauren for women and opening a store, but I wanted to show that the two worlds are the same, said Mr. Lauren, who gave a second dimension to his elegant Ralph Lauren presentation on Thursday, which was played out in pastel colors, easy fur pieces and draped, almost Grecian dresses.

title: Odd Future Barred From New Zealand
description: Odd Futures past seems to have caught up with it. The hip-hop group, which is known for its violent and sometimes misogynistic lyrics, and for incidents like a 2011 Boston performance in which some witnesses said that the groups frontman, Tyler, the Creator, incited fans to attacka policeman, has been barred from entering New Zealand, The Associated Press reported.

title: A Crazy Ant Invader Uses Acid to Its Advantage
description: The crazy ant, the latest ant to invade North America, is having remarkable success at replacing its predecessor, the red fire ant, former king of the invaders. Part of the reason, according to research at the University of Texas, is that the newcomer can detoxify fire ant venom in a way not seen before in other insects or animals.

title: Investors Eye Comcasts Bid for Time Warner Cable With Caution
description: That long proxy fight to take control of Time Warner Cable that I predicted earlier this week? It lasted days, ending with the announcement on Thursday that Comcast would acquire Time Warner Cable. The questions now are whether Time Warner Cable can complete the deal, and what lesson weve learned for future hostile takeovers.

title: House of Cards Returns
description: Alessandra Stanley, the chief television critic for The Times, discusses the new season of the Netflix political drama.

title: Tracing Ancestry, Researchers Produce a Genetic Atlas of Human Mixing Events
description: The rise and fall of empires, the march of armies, the flow of trade routes, the practice of slavery  all these events have led to a mixing of populations around the world. Such episodes have left a record in the human genome, but one that has so far been too complex to decipher on a global scale.

title: The Making of a Rap Tribute to the Galleon Group
description: What rhymes with Raj Rajaratnam?

title: Hastings Joins Roster of Retiring House Members
description: Representative Doc Hastings, a Republican who has represented Washington State for 20 years and who is chairman of the House Natural Resources Committee, announced Thursday that he would retire at the end of the year, joining a growing number of veterans heading for the congressional exits.

title: Ralph Lauren: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Learning to Silence My Inner Editor
description: I am trained to be a critic. After several years of graduate school, I started to enjoy pointing out flaws in peoples writing, a ruthless activity with all the destructive pleasure of picking at a scab. The voice of my inner editor had become so powerful that it almost kept me from finding the love of my life.

title: Olympics Pictures of the Day: Feb. 13
description: Warm weather, mens slopestyle skiing, individual skating and skeleton headline the eighth day of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia.

title: New York Fashion Week: Proenza Schouler Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Anna Moller.

title: The School Snow Run
description: New York parents dragged their children to school through snow and ice Thursday, on a day when the governor declared a state of emergency. Some were creative about transport; not all were happy.

title: Schumer Offers Long-Shot Option to Skirt House G.O.P. on Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Charles E. Schumer, Democrat of New York, offered a long-shot option on Thursday to revive the moribund effort to overhaul the nations immigration laws that would require the support of more than a dozen House Republicans  and, if nothing else, pressure others to act on an election-year issue that Tea Party-aligned members strongly oppose.

title: Study Sees Path to Cutting Substantial American Natural Gas Leaks
description: A policy analysis published in Science today examines 20 years of research on leakage from natural gas production and distribution systems in North America, including hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, and finds big opportunities to cut the worst leaks and a substantial climate benefit from a coal-to-gas switch, even accounting for higher leak rates.

title: From Flat on Their Backs, Sliders Rise to Play Tag for the Team
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  It is the Winter Games equivalent of a dropped baton, the sort of Olympic nightmare that haunts lugers as they lie on their sleds and that wakes them as they lie in their beds.

title: Scots Told They Risk Losing the Pound if They Gain Independence
description: LONDON  Britains three main political parties set aside routine disagreements on Thursday to issue an unusual collective warning to Scots that if they vote for independence, Scotland will lose the pound sterling as its currency.

title: Modern Love | Under His Misspell
description: When a writer falls in love with someone whose spelling and grammar are poor, it challenges her assumptions about the type of man she'd want to marry.

title: A Post-Soviet, Punk-Feminist Story
description: Sleep with one eye open, Annies mother warns, as she packs her daughter off to visit the old country. Its good advice  Annies adventures in Russia will pit her against insatiable witches, angry bears, pugilistic potatoes and, last but not least, terrifyingly tight minis and grotesquely high heels.

title: Snowfall Totals Around the Region
description: Inches of snow and time of measurement as reported by the National Weather Service.

title: In Surprise Move, Terra Firma Shakes Up Renewable Energy Team
description: Updated, 3:48 p.m. | LONDON Terra Firma, the European private equity fund founded by the British financier Guy Hands, is shaking up its management ranks.

title: Bailout Gave Small Bank a Chance to Survive
description: The image of bank bailouts in the United States was set by the megabanks, and with it widespread public hostility to the bailouts.

title: One-Fifth of New Enrollees Under Health Care Law Fail to Pay First Premium
description: WASHINGTON  One in five people who signed up for health insurance under the new health care law failed to pay their premiums on time and therefore did not receive coverage in January, insurance companies and industry experts say.

title: J. Mendel: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Teaching the Sochi Olympics | English Language Arts, Journalism and Fine Arts
description: All week weve been posting lesson ideas related to the 2014 Winter Games. Below, our list for literature, journalism, media studies and fine arts classes, as well as suggestions for E.L.L. students. You can find ideas for social studies, science, math and more by scrolling through our full collection.

title: Too Secret for Congress
description: The Los Angeles Times had a great story today that helps explain why few Americans  including the ones who make the countrys laws  know much about the drone program that is the vanguard of the endless war against terror. The basic reason, of course, is that the Obama administration wants to keep everyone in the dark, but the lengths to which officials will go can sometimes be surprising.

title: The Gun Report: February 13, 2014
description: In response to federal gun restrictions proposed after the Sandy Hook massacre, some states have adopted new laws under the banner of gun nullification. In Missouri on Tuesday, senators endorsed legislation that seeks to invalidate federal gun restrictions, and even send federal agents to jail for enforcing such laws. The measure will likely face a court challenge if it gets approved. The Democratic governor vetoed a similar measure that passed last year.

title: Global Citizens, Bound by Soul and Sinew
description: After passing through galleries filled with small, craftsy, poetic objects in last years Venice Biennale, you suddenly had a Dante moment in an installation of life-size figures by the Polish artist Pawel Althamer.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: happiness and age, chick flicks and brushing childrens teeth. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: New Antiques Websites Join Crowded Field
description: The latest marketing craze in the antiques world, now that the recent wave of TV shows starring auctioneers and dealers has faded, is for websites that help collectors click and buy.

title: Pro-Clinton Super PAC Sets Event for Donors
description: The leading Democratic super PAC will hold a briefing for potential donors this month, its first such event since reorganizing in January as a vehicle to help elect Hillary Rodham Clinton as president.

title: For New Age, the Next Generation
description: A sign on the door of the Body Actualized Center in Bushwick, Brooklyn, promised Cosmic Yoga, but on a recent snowy Monday night, a crowd had gathered for a concert of electronic music. Slushy boots were politely confiscated in the lobby, and about 75 shoeless patrons in their 20s and 30s sat cross-legged on pillows or reclined on blankets on the floor. The space was lit, just barely, by botanica candles, placed amid potted trees and colorful crystals. The aroma of incense permeated the room.

title: Study Finds Methane Leaks Negate Benefits of Natural Gas as a Fuel for Vehicles
description: WASHINGTON  The sign is ubiquitous on city buses around the country: This bus runs on clean burning natural gas.

title: Everyday Existence, With Eyes Wide Open
description: Art at the Core: The Intersection of Visual Art, Performance and Technology at the Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art in Peekskill feels more like an arbitrary collection of artworks than a specially curated show. Nonetheless, there is some attempt at binding the exhibition together with a common theme. According to a gallery release, the few dozen works by 23 artists lend themselves to narrative interpretation and look toward art to address the very core of our everyday lives, our Weltanschauung, or worldview.

title: A Whodunit Asks, Why Isnt He Dead?
description: Edmund Wilson wasnt an admirer of genre fiction, mystery novels especially. He asked, testily, Who cares who killed Roger Ackroyd?

title: Rediscovering New Age
description: Mike Rubin and Ben Ratliff discuss the current state of new-age music.

title: Putting Music First
description: The Stone is considered, among its fans, a pinnacle of what a music space should be.

title: For Dry Tastes, an Aromatic Altar to Bitters
description: EVEN if love were not part of the name, I would fall for Amor y Amargo in the East Village.

title: Kerry Rejects Delaying South Korea Exercise
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Secretary of State John Kerry rebuffed North Koreas demand that the United States and South Korea briefly delay a joint military exercise this month so that it does not coincide with the scheduled reunion of families separated by the Korean War.

title: Caught Beneath the Wheels of the Comcast Juggernaut
description: Comcasts deal machine has spit out a value destroyer. Digesting Time Warner Cable is ambitious even for a serial acquirer like Comcasts chief executive, Brian Roberts. As with some of his many previous purchases, it looks set to generate a return on investment below Comcasts cost of capital. Thats crummy but not criminal. Its also not surprising given the medieval governance the Roberts family uses to oversee its fiefdom.

title: N.S.A. Forces Out Civilian Employee With Snowden Tie
description: WASHINGTON  The National Security Agency has told Congress that it has forced out a civilian employee after a lengthy investigation to assign accountability for the disclosure of intelligence secrets by Edward J. Snowden, one of its former contractors.

title: Soap Opera Star, His Girlfriend and His Admirer
description: One of Your Biggest Fans is a fairly good play with some fairly big problems, in a production that is equal parts funny and frustrating.

title: Calvin Klein: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Choose the Artists, Ignore the Critics
description: PHILADELPHIA  Anthony Elms says that the first artwork he fell in love with, as a boy growing up in southern Michigan, was John Singleton Copleys painting of a swimmer pulled from the clutches of sharks, at the Detroit Institute of Arts. Mr. Elms may soon be casting his mind back to that picture as he starts to feel like chum.

title: Videos of Besieged Areas in Syria Highlight Need for Aid Access
description: As my colleagues reported  from Geneva, the halls of United Nations headquarters were quiet on Thursday morning, with no meetings between the two sides in the Syrian peace talks.

title: A Loan Extends Museums Global Reach
description: Life at the Frick Collection may be a bit quieter since its blockbuster exhibition Masterpieces of Dutch Painting From the Mauritshuis closed there last month, leaving its galleries devoid of two star paintings, Vermeers Girl With a Pearl Earring (1665), one of the most recognizable faces in art history, and Fabritiuss The Goldfinch, a tiny 1654 canvas that is the protagonist of the best-selling novel of the same title.

title: State by State in the Aftermath of Deadly Winter Storm
description: Updated, 6:42 p.m. Feb. 14 At least 50 vehicles, including tractor-trailers, were involved in two pileups along an ice-covered stretch of the Pennsylvania Turnpike on Friday morning, sending more than 30 people to area hospitals. Officials said that at least five people suffered serious injuries.

title: Aesthetics Are Not the Point
description: Beauty is routinely dismissed by todays progressive thinkers. Its not politically or ethically meaningful, theyll say. But this is wrong. Beauty is political. Groups of people convene around vehement feelings for particular forms of it. What some find beautiful, others find repulsive and morally disgusting, and sometimes even worth going to war over. The taste for certain styles of beauty is as likely to be aligned with revolutionary as with reactionary convictions.

title: Retiring on the House
description: As baby boomers age, reverse mortgages are expected to gain popularity as a means of covering living expenses. Hence, in the future, more homes passed on to children will come with a bill attached  the balance due on these equity loans.

title: Relais & Chteaux Puts on a Show
description: Relais & Chteaux, the collection of upscale hotels and restaurants, is holding its first wine and food festival from March 27 to March 30 in Carmel-by-the Sea, Calif.

title: Clip: 'Jimmy P'
description: A scene from the Arnaud Desplechin film "Jimmy P: Psychotherapy of a Plains Indian," featuring Benicio del Toro and Mathieu Amalric.

title: De Blasio Defends Opening Schools
description: The mayor defended the decision to keep schools open during the snowstorm, despite criticism from some parents.

title: Belgium Close to Allowing Euthanasia for Ill Minors
description: PARIS  Belgian lawmakers gave final approval on Thursday to a measure that would allow euthanasia for incurably ill children enduring insufferable pain. King Philippe is expected to sign the measure into law and make Belgium the first country to lift all age restrictions on legal, medically induced deaths.

title: Vintage French, Permitted to Breathe
description: As one typically more drawn to Germanic repertory than to French, I expected to enjoy the Boston Symphony Orchestras first concert conducted by Bernard Haitink at Carnegie Hall this week, on Tuesday evening, at least as much as its second, on Wednesday.

title: A Journey to Bollywood for the Food
description: Any serious-minded restaurant named after a trilogy of Bollywood buddy-cop thrillers (imagine Lethal Weapon set in Mumbai) deserves some style points sight unseen. But it turns out theres plenty more style on display once you enter Dhoom, an unusual three-month-old Indian spot in Secaucus.

title: Bookshelf: Just Hatched
description: New picture books about young creatures include Jorey Hurleys Nest.

title: De Blasio Defends Call to Police About Supporters Arrest
description: Characterizing his actions as appropriate, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday sharply defended his decision to call a top police official this week to inquire about the arrest of a Brooklyn bishop, a key political supporter.

title: Serving the Standards for 35 Years
description: Sadlers Ordinary, occupying a barnlike structure in out-of-the-way Marlborough, recently celebrated its 35th anniversary. Few marriages last that long, and the restaurant business is even more fickle than matrimony. Perhaps the secret lies in knowing who you are  and who you arent. We dont try to be pretentious, says the chef and owner, Kevin Haggerty, who has run Sadlers since 1994. People like the standards. And so his back-to-the-future menu features surf and turf and quiche Lorraine. Welcome to 1978!

title: Italian Food the Old-Fashioned Way
description: Alexs Bar and Grille in White Plains has been open only about a year and a half, but dining there makes me feel nostalgic.

title: Show Your Affection (or Test Your Love)
description: WITH same-sex marriage working its way into the mainstream of American life, straight people arent the only ones figuring out just how boring wedded bliss can be. So whats a couple to do when the flames of romance sputter? Several events in New York City this Valentines Day weekend offer unconventional, dramatic and tasty ways for couples  married or not, gay or otherwise  to kindle or rekindle a love story.

title: An Artists Paintings, and His Complexities, on Display
description: PURCHASE, N.Y.  The small but potent paintings of Forrest Bess respond to the art worlds either-ors with a resounding and. Without resorting to big stretches of canvas or brash gestures, they merge inner and outer worlds, abstraction and representation, and ideas of masculinity and femininity. To a market still intent on labeling insiders and outsiders, they offer the conundrum of an artist who showed at the Betty Parsons Gallery in New York in the 1950s, alongside Rothko and Pollock, but made his living as a bait fisherman in Bay City, Tex.

title: Effects of Raising the Minimum Wage
Celery Adds an Extra Dimension to Stewed Pork
description: Celery is the underlying backbone of many dishes. But sometimes it deserves to be played up front. Its vegetal freshness and somewhat bitter finish add a bright dimension to this earthy dish of pork and lentils, elements that go a long way toward welcoming a bottle of Rosso di Montalcino.

title: Beyond the Bread, Glimpses of Italy
description: Some believe they can foretell the success of a restaurant meal by the bread served at the outset. If the bread is good, the meal will be great; if it is bad, abandon all hope. Those people would be proved wrong at Spezia, a new Italian restaurant in St. James.

title: Which Is Your Favorite Modern Love Column?
description: Modern Loves editor, Dan Jones, and his new book, Love, Illuminated, have been all over The Times the past few weeks, with a review in a love-themed edition of the Book Review, an article in the Sunday Review and an excerpt in his home, the Style section (Good Enough? Thats Great). You might think its because Dan is one of our own, but Id beg to differ.

title: Connected: Love in the Time of the Internet
Nothing to See, Yet So Much Not to Miss
description: Moviegoers may be experiencing a moment of mathematical confusion. Are there too many movies or not enough? Could it be both? At this time of year, interesting new commercial releases slow to a trickle, as the Oscar pachyderms dominate the landscape, making room for a few smaller films and the usual genre offerings  action, rom-com, animation, whatever. Slim pickings for the discerning cinephile. At the same time, bulletins from Sundance and Berlin, and reports from the not-fully-charted wilderness of digital distribution, suggest a state of unmanageable abundance, a cornucopia of docs, foreign-language art and genre films, and post-mumblecore youthquakes. There is nothing to see, but so much that were missing.

title: Pieces That Invite a Closer Look
description: Grace Beza of Islip had strapped a small light onto her forehead and entered a dark, cavelike room. Inside, dozens of images painted on the walls showed men wearing headlamps on helmets. When she emerged, she was intrigued but mystified. The figures looked like miners in a womb, Ms. Beza said.

title: Making His Case for the Second Montalcino
description: It could be because its the second wine of the region, made with grapes that for one reason or another didnt make the cut for the first. Or maybe its because the status of Brunello di Montalcino, and therefore the wines of Montalcino, were under a cloud of scandal for several years, making them difficult to embrace.

title: For DiCaprio, Wolf Is Reflection of the Truth
description: Lets hug it out, Leonardo DiCaprio said, reaching in for an embrace.

title: Images of Turkish Reporter Felled by Police Water Cannon Stir Anger Online
description: Turkish bloggers and journalists expressed outrage on social networks Thursday at images of a female television reporter who was knocked down by a direct blast of red liquid fired from a police water cannon during a protest in the capital, Anakara.

title: Trimmings NYFW, Day 7
description: Standout fall 2014 accessories from Proenza Schouler, Reed Krakoff, Michael Kors and more.

title: When Age Belies Buying Power
description: In the universe of ultraluxury real estate, much attention has been lavished on foreign investors who pay record prices for glassy Midtown condominiums, and the wave of previously staunch uptown residents suddenly spending big to embrace unlikely neighborhoods in Lower Manhattan.

title: Volkswagen to Stop Using Primates in Ads, Withdrawing Teaser for Super Bowl Commercial
description: The animal welfare organization People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals has scored again in its long-running fight against the use of primates in advertising, as Volkswagen of America agreed to abide by a no-primates policy and withdrew a video clip from online platforms that had served as a teaser for the companys commercial during Super Bowl XLVIII on Feb. 2.

title: Thats an Order!
description: Making good on a promise from his recent State of the Union address, President Obama signed an executive order on Wednesday to ensure that employees of federal contractors are paid at least $10.10 an hour starting in 2015.

title: Network Told the Future
description: To the Editor:

title: PepsiCo Declines to Spin Off Beverage Unit
description: PepsiCo Inc. said on Thursday that it had decided not to spin off its North American beverage business, effectively rejecting a push by the activist investor Nelson Peltz.

title: Investing in City Parks
description: To the Editor:

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Turkey, South Sudan, New York and Sochi, Russia. More images from the Winter Olympics here.

title: New York Fashion Week: Ralph Lauren Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Stan Douglas: Luanda-Kinshasa
description: David Zwirner

title: Abortion and Contraception Cases Before the Justices
description: To the Editor:

title: Londons West End, a Stage for Good Eating
description: It takes time to eat in a great restaurant, and time is precious pre- or post-theater. Youre either eating early and in a hurry to make the curtain, or youre up late and half-ready for bed. In either case, a two-hour blowout is unlikely.

title: New York Fashion Week Street Style: Day 8
description: Craig Arend of Altamira NYC took over our Instagram account for New York Fashion Week. Check out NYTimesFashion on Instagram for more.

title: Under Cover: Capturing Wendy Davis
In Chiang Mai, Thailand, a Hub for Creative Types
description: Alongside its reputation for gilded, Buddha-filled temples and treks to hill tribe villages, Chiang Mai in northern Thailand has in recent years attracted creative types seeking a chilled-out alternative to Bangkok, 350 miles away. Nowhere is this more evident than Nimmanhaemin Road, a thoroughfare west of the old city center anchored by Chiang Mai University and known as Nimman. The areas tranquil side streets, called sois, are home to quirky coffee shops, design boutiques and galleries. These, combined with boutique hotels like Artel Nimman, where guests access the ground floor by a slide, make Nimman an appealing base from which to explore the city.

title: Learning the Language of Restaurant Week
description: A new video campaign launched by NYC & Company, New Yorks marketing and tourism organization, offers a comedic look at the orthoepic challenges of NYC Restaurant Week.

title: Josephine Halvorson and Burt Barr
description: Sikkema Jenkins & Company

title: Beverly Semmes: FRP
description: Susan Inglett

title: Looking Back: The Eighth White Columns Annual
description: White Columns

title: Bill OReillys Gift for the Ages
description: Its been nearly two weeks now since Bill OReillys interview with President Obama on Super Bowl Sunday, and in the No Spin Zone of the hosts pretend world hes still spinning the chat as the greatest conversation since Winston Churchill dined alone.

title: In a Rare Visit, Three Chances to Impress
description: When the Royal New Zealand Ballet opened at the Joyce Theater on Wednesday night, it was a homecoming  not for the 61-year-old company, which hasnt been in New York since 1993, but for its artistic director since 2011, a recently retired star of American Ballet Theater, Ethan Stiefel. Before an audience packed with ballet notables, Mr. Stiefel showed what hes been up to, introducing his dancers through three recent works chosen for variety.

title: Alex Katz / Dara Friedman
description: Gavin Browns Enterprise

title: Fragmented Frames of the Love That Was, Taunting Yet Poignant
description: Most stories begin once upon a time and, after the usual chronological tramp toward the inevitable and an occasional detour into the past or future, end happily ever after (or not). In Je TAime, Je TAime, a magnificent film from out of the past, the French director Alain Resnais takes dozens of interludes from one mans life  images of everyday banality and commonplace delights, scenes of him at work and at play  and arranges them nonchronologically. One minute, Claude (Claude Rich) is emerging from a swim, the next hes violently quarreling with a lover, and then hes emerging from that exact same swim all over again, as if stuck in a loop.

title: Times Minute | Snow Day Controversy
description: In the Video

title: Events on Long Island for Feb. 16-22
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Times Minute | Snow Day Controversy
description: Under deep snow, New York public schools remained open today. Also on the Minute, the Olympic Games are beginning to melt under a heat wave in Sochi and a war between two ant species.

title: Treadmills, Without the Tedium
description: AT a fitness expo in Germany four years ago, the trainer Joe DiAngelo was struck by how boring everything seemed. He eventually came to a realization: Perhaps that old gym standby  the treadmill  could use a makeover.

title: Theater Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: A Valentine for Restaurant Workers
description: There is long-overdue support for raising the minimum wage. But among generally mistreated minimum wage workers theres a subgroup of those whose wage experience is even more miserable and unfair.

title: Comedy Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: For news about comedy and humor, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Acidic Bonbons for V-Day Contrarians
description: If you were in danger of becoming all dewy eyed about someone this Valentines Day, two windy women stand ready to suck all the joy out of love for you. A science-y show may have already done so earlier in the week. But have patience. Next week, a wedding provides a dose of optimism, despite the skull on the cake.

title: Events in New Jersey for Feb. 16-22
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Combat Chic at Calvin Klein
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: Movie Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: A Couplet Fantasy Denied
description: I really feel a lot! declares Amy (Emma Roberts), a pushy 22-year-old aspiring poet in Scott Coffeys smart but wince-inducing satirical comedy Adult World. I want to speak for all the people that suffer, that feel the pain that I feel.

title: Sex and Candy
description: NOTHING is more symbolic of the romance ofValentines Day than a box of chocolates, traditionally a gift from Him to Her. Chocolate, with its luxurious texture and pleasurable taste, has become the edible correlate to love and desire. And although scientists havent discovered any definitive difference in the way men and women respond to chocolate, conventional wisdom is that women naturally crave the stuff.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Prices may not reflect ticketing service charges. For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: With a Dentists Chair and a Chicken Mask, a Girl Cant Say No
description: It is now 40 years since the first performances of David Mamets Sexual Perversity in Chicago and almost 30 since the play was made into a movie, starring Rob Lowe and Demi Moore and directed by Edward Zwick, called About Last Night ... . Some things have changed (Mr. Mamet has evolved into a dyspeptic right-winger) and some have not (Mr. Lowe and Ms. Moore are still very good looking), but all in all, the thing holds up pretty well. Mr. Mamets title was always a bit of a misnomer  his jagged play is more interested in romantic confusion and emotional complication than in freaky bedroom matters  but his map of the crooked paths to heterosexual bliss remains useful and adaptable, even when softened and tidied up by Hollywood. The proof is in the new About Last Night, a sweet, silly, semi-raunchy Valentines Day confection directed by Steve Pink (Hot Tub Time Machine).

title: Smartphone Sales Beat Feature Phones in 2013
description: Watching the sales of smartphones and feature phones in recent years has felt similar to watching a Ferrari race a horse. You know the Ferrari is going to win, its just a matter of when.

title: Once a Lowlife, Always a Lowlife
description: Having just achieved Hollywood leading man status in the remake of RoboCop, Joel Kinnaman reappears as JW, a.k.a. Johan, in the Swedish gangster thriller Easy Money: Hard to Kill. It is the second movie of three in a popular Swedish franchise that follows the criminal career of this wily, serpentine social climber from the provinces.

title: Events in Connecticut for Feb. 16-22
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Faking It
description: Three somehow related stories of the day:

title: Hellbent on Fusing His Soul With Hers
description: Theres a promising edge to the opening of Endless Love, which begins with a young man, David (Alex Pettyfer), speaking in voice-over about a young woman, Jade (Gabriella Wilde). Its a high school graduation somewhere in Atlanta, and as the camera picks Jade out of the celebrating crowd, David reminisces about how hes been watching her for years. From the way he talks, he seems to have been watching her closely. Closely enough to suggest that hes been long nurturing a passion, perhaps an obsession  something deep, troubling and real.

title: Jazz Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Events in Westchester for Feb. 16-22
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Opera & Classical Music Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dance Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Therapist and Patient, Odd and Charming
description: As played by Benicio Del Toro  flattening vowels, biting at consonants, pushing his tall, square frame though postures of graceful anguish  Jimmy Picard, a World War II veteran and a member of the Blackfoot Indian tribe, is the picture of a noble soul in torment. He is both charismatic and pathetic, and he inspires in his therapist, a French anthropologist and psychoanalyst named Georges Devereux (Mathieu Amalric), a complex mixture of responses, including sympathy, rivalry and unabashed ethnographic curiosity.

title: Democrats Need Only Look to Past Voters
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: A Culinary Dal, Delving Into Palettes
description: The only meal I ever ate at El Bulli, the Michelin-starred epicenter of Ferran Adris innovative cuisine (now closed), began with hors doeuvres that included a deep-fried, mostly intact rabbits ear. It seemed like a gauntlet thrown down, daring me to keep up. After a pause, I plunged ahead. It was surprisingly tasty, and I liked the economy of using overlooked parts of an animal, even bunnies.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for Feb. 14-20
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Dates Blind and Less So in a Starry Metropolis
description: The urban tales in Beijing Love Story are shameless about conveying modern-age mores and old-fashioned sweetness. When two male friends speed down a road in a car, the cityscape is a riot of multicolored lights, and the techno music thumps as they fist-pumpingly exclaim, This is life! When two teenagers shyly get to know each other in another story, their hand-holding on a bus is played for its innocent romantic bliss.

title: Challengers Say a Tea Party Favorite Shortchanged Constituents
description: As a freshman state senator in the last legislative session, Donna Campbell, Republican of New Braunfels, became known for her strong stance against abortion and for her impassioned speeches at committee hearings. But community leaders in her district have criticized Ms. Campbell, a darling of the Tea Party, for the establishment of a new taxing district in Wimberley and an increase in vehicle registration fees to build toll lanes in San Antonio. The criticism has fueled challenges from two fellow Republicans  Elisa Chan, a former San Antonio city councilwoman, and Mike Novak, a former Bexar County commissioner  hoping to unseat Ms. Campbell in the March 4 primary.

title: Fantasy Girl at Your Service
description: Set in the world of online pornography  and with production values to match  Robert Nathans Lucky Bastard is a sorry-looking found-footage thriller as unconvincing as its characters thrashing orgasms.

title: A Closer Look at Valentines Flowers
description: EL PASO  The flowers that decorate offices, homes and restaurants along the Mexico border have been inspected as closely at border crossings as many door panels and car trunks, well-known hiding places used by drug mules to export heroin, cocaine and marijuana from Mexico.

title: Bridgestone Admits Guilt in U.S. Price-Fixing Case
description: The Bridgestone Corporation became the latest automotive supplier to plead guilty to charges of conspiring to fix the prices of parts sold to automakers here and abroad, the Justice Department said on Thursday.

title: Heightened Security, Visible and Invisible, Blankets the Olympics
description: SOCHI, Russia  Before boarding the new trains serving Sochi and the Olympic sites here, passengers must pass through metal detectors and place their bags on X-ray machines  just as in airports. What many do not realize is that they are also being scanned by a far more sophisticated system that gauges emotional state in an effort to identify potential terrorists.

title: Demons at Work in Snowy Magic of New York
description: Winters Tale, Mark Helprins 1983 best seller, was the Goldfinch of its time: fat and ambitious, with a romantic view of New York City and an unabashed commitment to the kind of old-fashioned narrative abundance that seemed, then as now, to be missing from too much literary fiction. It is a bit surprising that the movie adaptation (written and directed by Akiva Goldsman) has taken so long to arrive, though perhaps less surprising that it should be so clumsy and inert, a lumbering white elephant rather than the flying white horse that is the novels magical mascot.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for

title: New York Fashion Week: Calvin Klein Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Erin Baiano.

title: Spare Times for Feb. 14-20
description: Talks on Hip-Hop (Thursday) Hip-hop may be one of the newer kids on the musical block, but its cultural impact runs as deep as any genre that has preceded it. Its the focus of a slide show that will accompany a discussion with the photographer Jamel Shabazz and Wes Jackson, founder of Brooklyn Bodega, a branding and promotional company, at the Brooklyn Historical Society, 128 Pierrepont Street, Brooklyn Heights.

title: Spare Times for Children for Feb. 14-20
description: Mysteries of the Unseen World

title: Shedding the Clich of High School Sex
description: Like a fresh ripple in the near-stagnant high school movie pool, Chris Nelsons Date and Switch balances formula with winning performers, genuine humor and a generosity of spirit that this genre too often lacks.

title: Francis Bacon Work Sells for $70 Million at Christies Auction
description: LONDON  Trophy hunters fought over trophy paintings by Gerhard Richter and Francis Bacon, as well as a pink stainless-steel Cracked Egg by Jeff Koons, at Christies sale of postwar and contemporary art here on Thursday night. But of the three artists, it was Bacon who once again stole the spotlight when an unnamed American collector paid $70 million for Portrait of George Dyer Talking, a 1966 canvas depicting the artists lover perched on a stool, his twisted body positioned under a naked light bulb as though he were being interrogated.

title: Giant Jumps
description: All but two of the top six skaters after the womens figure skating short program have performed a difficult triple-triple combination in their long program this season. The highest-scoring combination, a triple lutz-triple toe, was the gold medalist Kim Yu-nas signature move in 2010 but this year, others have also mastered it.

title: Romance and Tourism
description: If youre willing to believe the old moviemaking canard that beautiful, intelligent women are attracted to underachieving men with no ambition or prospects, then youll find Girl on a Bicycle to be a sweet, often witty romantic comedy.

title: Pandora Suit May Upend Century-Old Royalty Plan
description: As the music industry races toward a future of digital streams and smartphone apps, its latest crisis centers on a regulatory plan that has been in place since Chattanooga Choo Choo was a hit.

title: Belles of the Wrecking Ball
description: The Museum of Modern Arts decision to tear down the quirky little American Folk Art Museum, barely a decade old, has generated outrage; only the loss of Penn Station in 1963 and the fight that savedGrand Central in the1970s have been more bitter.

title: Trimmings NYFW, Day 7
description: From snakeskin clutches to stiletto sneakers, these are the standout fall 2014 accessories from Proenza Schouler, Reed Krakoff, Michael Kors and more.

title: Inequality, Dignity and Freedom
description: Now that the Congressional Budget Office has explicitly denied saying that Obamacare destroys jobs, some (though by no means all) Republicans have stopped lying about that issue and turned to a different argument. O.K., they concede, any reduction in working hours because of health reform will be a voluntary choice by the workers themselves  but its still a bad thing because, as Representative Paul Ryan puts it, theyll lose the dignity of work.

title: Banks in London Devise Way Around Europes Bonus Rules
description: LONDON  A battle over banker bonuses is building in this financial capital.

title: Opening Shouts and Whispers
description: There are two ways to announce your arrival on New York Fashion Weeks gridlocked calendar: gingerly or brashly, a gentle tap or a sharp elbow. The handful of debuts this week  including, not exhaustively, the first womens collection from the mens provocateurs of Duckie Brown, the first presentation by the surf-slacker line Baja East, and the first in New York by Manolo Blahnik  offered examples of both.

title: The Refiners Fire
description: In 2005, Michael Ignatieff left a teaching job at Harvard to enter politics in his native Canada with hopes of becoming prime minister.

title: Dropbox Hires a Google Executive, as It Starts Its Next Phase for Growth
description: Dennis Woodside, the chief executive of Motorola, owned by Google, is leaving to join Dropbox, which competes with Google in cloud storage.

title: Massachusetts Is Given Extension
description: BOSTON  Massachusetts officials said Thursday that they have an additional three months to bring the states health care system in line with the national Affordable Care Act.

title: Snow Day? Thats Great. Now Log In. Get to Class.
description: WOODCLIFF LAKE, N.J.  At 9 a.m. on Thursday the snow was piling high outside and officials had long since made the call to shutter the local schools.

title: Should All Immigrants Get ID Cards?
Germans Propose Law to Ease Return of Art Looted by Nazis
description: MUNICH  German authorities proposed a law on Friday that would lift the countrys 30-year statute of limitations for certain cases involving stolen property, a move that would make it easier for Jewish families to seek the return of art, furniture or other valuables taken from them by the Nazis.

title: Live Stream | Marc Jacobss Fall 2014 Collection at New York Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Marc Jacobs at New York Fashion Week.

title: William Zeckendorf Jr., 84, Dies; Developer Put Stamp on Skyline
description: William Zeckendorf Jr., the son of a celebrated developer who himself transformed New York City by making big bets on big projects that helped refashion neighborhoods from the Upper West Side to Union Square, died on Wednesday in Santa Fe, N.M. He was 84.

title: This Weeks Movies: Feb. 14, 2014
description: The New York Times movie critics on "RoboCop," "Winter's Tale" and "About Last Night."

title: U.S. Dominance in Science Faces Asian Challenge
description: WASHINGTON  The United States predominance in science and technology is fading, a report released this month by the National Science Board warns.

title: Bulldozer Clearing Snow Kills a Pregnant Woman
description: The snow was falling heavily as Min Lin, pregnant and nearing her due date, and her husband loaded groceries into their car on Thursday in a parking lot in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. Nearby, a small bulldozer ran back and forth, furiously working to keep the lot behind Fei Long Market clear of snow.

title: Another Big Month for Sony Game Console
description: March cant come soon enough for Microsoft. Thats when the game Titanfall will come out exclusively for the companys Xbox game consoles and PCs running Windows.

title: States Struggle to Add Latinos to Health Rolls
description: LOS ANGELES  With an estimated 15 percent of the countrys uninsured population, California is crucial to the success of President Obamas health care overhaul. Here, that success cannot come without enrolling Latinos, who make up more than half of the states uninsured.

title: Putting the Romance in Cold Medicine and Fabric Softener
description: FLORISTS, chocolatiers, jewelers and greeting card publishers typically promote aggressively for Valentines Day, but brands that few would associate with romance also are courting consumers this year.

title: For Daredevils on Snow, the Edge Has Always Been Near
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  The X Games generation is sometimes referred to as a new breed of Winter Olympian, daredevils unafraid  even excited  to push the limit of gravity in sports that inherently push the limit of safety. And the Winter Olympics new slopestyle events are their test track.

title: California Seeing Brown Where Green Used to Be
description: SELMA, Calif.  Fields that in any other year would be filled with broccoli, melons and onions are instead dusty patches of dirt. Farmers are calculating losses that add up with each arid day. Thousands of farm workers who rely on paychecks for tending the fields are expected to go unemployed this year.

title: As Hate Crimes Rise, British Muslims Say Theyre Becoming More Insular
description: BIRMINGHAM, England  Alum Rock, a neighborhood of Birmingham, looks the way Pakistan might, if Pakistan were under gray northern skies and British rule.

title: A Huge Solar Plant Opens, Facing Doubts About Its Future
description: NIPTON, Calif.  The Ivanpah solar power plant stretches over more than five square miles of the Mojave Desert. Almost 350,000 mirrors the size of garage doors tilt toward the sun with an ability to energize 140,000 homes. The plant, which took almost four years and thousands of workers assembling millions of parts to complete, officially opened on Thursday, the first electric generator of its kind.

title: Free Online University Receives Accreditation, in Time for Graduating Class of 7
description: Just in time for its first graduates, the University of the People, a tuition-free four-year-old online institution built to reach underserved students around the world, announced Thursday that it had received accreditation.

title: For Mayor, Keeping Schools Open Brings Another Headache
description: His education chief declared Thursday a beautiful day as sleet poured down on parents wondering why schools had not been closed.

title: Iris van Berne Transforms Backstage at J. Mendel
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Iris van Berne before (left) and after (right) makeup by Dick Page and hair by Anthony Turner.

title: Industry Shifts May Aid Comcast in Takeover Bid
description: On the face of it, the merger of the countrys two largest cable companies would seem like a nonstarter, given its steep regulatory hurdles and skepticism from consumer watchdogs.

title: If a Cable Giant Becomes Bigger
description: Regulators might be tempted to agree with Comcast that its proposed acquisition of Time Warner Cable for $45.2 billion in stock poses no threat to competition and would actually benefit consumers by giving the company more resources to invest in new services. But government officials should not accept that argument without conducting a thorough investigation into what effect a merger between the countrys two largest cable companies would have on the media and the Internet.

title: A First Stab at a Prudent City Budget
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Wednesday released a preliminary budget, his first, that surprised some fiscal watchdogs with its moderation and caution. It doesnt break the bank on progressive agenda items. It restores $1 billion to a depleted trust fund for retiree health benefits and doubles, to $600 million, reserves set aside each year for unexpected shortfalls. The nonpartisan Citizens Budget Commission called it a double dose of good news that projected revenues are higher than expected, and that Mr. de Blasio is proposing to sock some money away.

title: For New Air Force Secretary, a Baptism by Fire
description: WASHINGTON  Deborah Lee James had been Air Force secretary for less than three weeks when the email crash-landed in her inbox.

title: For Comcast, Daring Deals to Expand Its Reach Across Industries
description: Three weeks ago, Comcast unveiled plans to build an addition to its headquarters, a gleaming steel-and-glass tower designed by the renowned architect Norman Foster that will cast a shadow over downtown Philadelphia.

title: A Russian Protest Zone Where Almost No One Registers a Complaint
description: KHOSTA, Russia  In the small park here that has been designated by the Russian authorities as the official protest zone of the Sochi Winter Olympics, the only mobilization in sight on a sunny afternoon this week was a small armada of strollers, being pushed by a cadre of young mothers.

title: More Engagement With India
description: The decision by the United States to have its ambassador to India, Nancy Powell, meet Narendra Modi, a star of the countrys Bharatiya Janata opposition party, reversed a long estrangement. It was a pragmatic step in engaging with India and the controversial and troubling politician who could well become the next prime minister after elections in May.

title: Crowds Gather for Tanaka and Jeter, Who Is in a Joking Mood
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Derek Jeter pulled up to a line of autograph seekers, rolled down the window of his cobalt blue Mercedes sedan and, after being asked a question, said the two words that thousands of young women would love to hear him say to them.

title: In Debate Over Paying for Pre-K, Little Agreement Aside From the Goal
description: Paul A. Dyster, the eldest of 10 children, spent many of his weekends as a teenager in western New York State moving tiny furniture around classrooms because his mother was an advocate and organizer of prekindergarten programs. I had it pounded into me from an early age that this was important, Mr. Dyster, 59, said. Now Bill de Blasio, the mayor of New York City, has proposed that the city be permitted to tax the income of rich people to pay for full-day prekindergarten classes.

title: Kim Basinger at Ralph Lauren
description: A whirling blizzard and calf-deep snowdrifts did little to deter guests on the final morning of New York Fashion Week. Shrugging off puffers and stamping their snow boots, the full house at Ralph Laurens 10 a.m. show settled in under flattering chandelier light. Kim Basinger, seemingly ageless in an ivory and black blouse and black trousers, was aptly impressed.

title: Let the Marketing of Derek Jeters Farewell Begin
description: The Derek Jeter farewell tour is coming, with the inevitable merchandising: caps and T-shirts with a Jeter-centric logo; dirt from his shortstop area packaged in vials; autographs; signed bases, balls, home plates and, well, almost anything else imaginable.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 13, 2014
Prominent Opposition Leader in Venezuela Is Blamed for Unrest
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Top government officials on Thursday blamed a prominent opposition leader for unrest that resulted in three deaths, amid growing tension over antigovernment protests.

title: Brownback Leads Kansas in Sharp Right Turn
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  Sam Brownback took office as Kansas chief executive more than three years ago, promising a conservative revolution. By all accounts he has kept his promise.

title: Heading Into Break, Talk of Anthonys Next Act
description: NEW ORLEANS  Three years ago, Carmelo Anthony was the dominant figure during the N.B.A.s All-Star weekend. The Denver Nuggets were in the process of completing a deal that would send Anthony to the Knicks (for no small price), and members of the news media formed concentric circles around Anthony, several cameras deep. A superstar was on the move, sending seismic tremors across the league.

title: Wendy Davis, Texas Candidate, Offers Nuance on Abortion View
description: HOUSTON  Wendy Davis, the Texas state senator who became a national figure by filibustering abortion restrictions last year, told a Dallas newspaper that she would have supported one of those restrictions  a ban on abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy  had the bill been written differently and deferred to a woman and her doctor in making the decision.

title: In Terrorism Case, New Path to Testimony From 9/11 Suspect
description: Lawyers for a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden moved closer on Thursday to being able to use Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the self-described architect of the Sept. 11 terror attacks, as a defense witness to rebut the governments terrorism case against their client, Sulaiman Abu Ghaith.

title: Whats Next, Synchronized Slopestyle?
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Having covered the last six Winter Olympics, and now one Summer Olympics in Sochi, I felt quite safe in saying that these Games, be they frozen or thawed, did not need a team luge event.

title: Federal Agency and New York State Are in Accord Over $8 Billion Medicaid Waiver
description: The Obama administration has agreed in principle to grant an $8 billion Medicaid adjustment for New York State that could help stabilize some hospitals in Brooklyn and would reconfigure the delivery of health care there and throughout the state, state officials said on Thursday.

title: With Urgency, David Wright Is Waiting to Win
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Growing up, David Wright said, he idolized Derek Jeter. Jeter was polished. He was a winner. He played the game the right way. He played shortstop for the best team in baseball. He was who every high school player wanted to be.

title: Off the Runway: Last Day
description: Scenes from the final day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Rude Awakenings of Middle Age
description: Does time erode everything it touches? This painful question lies at the heart of Dinner With Friends, Donald Marguliess delicate-hued, Pulitzer Prize-winning drama about two married couples who come to a crossroads in their long friendship when one pair breaks up.

title: Phrase From Virgil
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  My, what a surprise! I really wasnt expecting this, and Ill bet you werent, either. Bruce Haight is back, and he has something special to ask us. If we all give him an enthusiastic Yes, this may be the first mass wedding the Internet has ever seen.

title: Off the Runway | Before the Show
description: Behind the scenes of New York Fashion Week fall 2014.

title: Highlights From Our Social Feeds at NYFW, Day 8
Kendall Jenner Transforms Backstage at Marc Jacobs
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in New York. Here, the model Kendall Jenner before (left) and after (right) makeup by Francois Nars and hair by Guido Palau.

title: Indian Publisher Withdraws Book, Stoking Fears of Nationalist Pressure
description: NEW DELHI  In a fight with a major company, a frail 84-year-old retired headmaster would seem to be the David to Indias publishing Goliath, Penguin Books India.

title: Long-Lived Greatness
description: Derek Jeter not only has one of the highest batting averages among his peers, but also has shown extraordinary longevity.

title: Marc Jacobs: Fall 2014 RTW
description: New York

title: Thai Police Clear Areas of Protesters as Their Numbers Ebb
description: Hundreds of Thai police officers on Friday began reclaiming intersections in Bangkok that a dwindling protest movement seized several weeks ago.

title: What to Watch at the Olympics: Friday
description: ALPINE SKIING Ted Ligety, a giant slalom specialist, is among the favorites in the super combined. NBC, 8 p.m.

title: Driver of Stolen Truck Arraigned in Bus Drivers Death
description: A man who stole a truck after a night of drinking, and hit a city bus, killing the bus driver, was arraigned in Manhattan criminal court on Thursday night on six charges, including vehicular homicide, the Manhattan district attorneys office said.

title: Sales of Iranian Crude Oil Rose in January
description: Sales of Iranian crude oil rose by 100,000 barrels a day in January, to 1.32 million, the International Energy Agency reported on Thursday in its monthly survey, offering what appeared to be a glimpse at the initial impact of the temporary nuclear agreement that eased some of the Western sanctions against Iran.

title: Short Track
description: On a track crowded with skaters, these racers have to accelerate in the turns and pass when the moment is just right.

title: In Living Color
description: The relationship between fashion and art is constantly evolving. Right now, many designers are collectively referencing a Pop aesthetic, from vivid cubism to the giddy kitsch of the Memphis group.

title: The Writer's Room
description: Upstairs, downstairs, in a corner, at a desk, on the bed, with a view of trees, water, the street, the sky. Five writers, who all publish new books this year, explain how the right space can unlock the mind and let the words flow.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New by Chloe Sevigny vs. Elaine Stritch
description: (PHOTOGRAPHS FROM TOP: COURTESY OF MAD DECENT; COURTESY PHAIDON PRESS; COURTESY OF CHRISTIAN DIOR PARFUMS; COURTESY ALEXANDER MCQUEEN; JUAN C. LOPEZ ESPANTALEON/ZABARS AND COMPANY INC)

title: Phoebe Philos Prophetic Fashion
description: At Cline, boundary-breaking fashion is secondary to the meaning behind the clothes.

title: Portrait of a Lady
description: Ginevra Elkanns classic beauty and old-world charm might be an inheritance from her grandmother Marella Agnelli, but her Roman apartment reflects her life as a busy, modern woman  producing films, running a museum and taking care of a young family.

title: North American Leaders Urged to Restore Monarch Butterflys Habitat
description: MEXICO CITY  Hoping to focus attention on the plight of the monarch butterfly at a North American summit meeting next week, a group of prominent scientists and writers urged the leaders of Mexico, the United States and Canada to commit to restoring the habitat that supports the insects extraordinary migration across the continent.

title: Tax Subsidies and the Incentive to Work
description: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton. He has some financial interests in the health care field.

title: Ask Well: The Problem With Dogs and Chocolate
description: Question:

title: Word of the Day | domineer
description: domineer \d-m-nir\ verb

title: Facing Bulls, Nets Stumble in Final Game Before All-Star Break
description: CHICAGO  At the close of 2013, less than two months ago, the Nets seemed to be on the brink of implosion. They had dealt with issues of futility (losing 12 of 15 games during one stretch), absurdity (their first-year coach, Jason Kidd, was fined for spilling a soda on the court on purpose) and personality (Kidd banished his top assistant, Lawrence Frank, from the bench).

title: Corrections: February 14, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: U.S. to Play Mexico Before World Cup
description: The United States will face Mexico in Glendale, Ariz., on April 2 as both teams prepare for the World Cup.

title: Whats On Friday
description: 9 P.M. (13) NATIONAL THEATER: 50 YEARS ON STAGE In 1963, the National Theater in London raised its curtain with Laurence Olivier as its first artistic director. Eight hundred productions later, the organization celebrated its 50th anniversary in November with an evening of live performances and archival footage, overseen by its current artistic director, Nicholas Hytner, and presented here by Great Performances. Highlights include excerpts from Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead, with Benedict Cumberbatch; The History Boys, with its playwright, Alan Bennett, and two of its original stars, James Corden and Dominic Cooper; Mourning Becomes Electra, with Helen Mirren and Tim Pigott-Smith; Bedroom Farce, with Penelope Wilton; Judi Dench, above, singing Send In the Clowns from A Little Night Music; and archival scenes from Hay Fever, with Maggie Smith, and Richard III, with Ian McKellen. Joan Plowright, married for nearly 30 years to Olivier, recreates her Saint Joan on the stage of the Old Vic, home of the original National Theater.

title: Ralph Waite, Depression-Era Patriarch in The Waltons, Dies at 85
description: Ralph Waite, a multifaceted actor who became etched in television history as the craggy-faced, big-hearted patriarch of a rustic Depression-era clan on the popular 1970s dramatic series The Waltons, died on Thursday at his home in Palm Desert, Calif. He was 85.

title: Mets Name Radio Team
description: Howie Rose and Josh Lewin will return as the Mets radio team as the games shift to WOR-AM from WFAN-AM and FM. The announcement that they will still call the Mets took a while; the team revealed its move to WOR in November. The Yankees moved to WFAN from WCBS-AM.

title: Federal Judge Overturns Virginias Same-Sex Marriage Ban
description: A federal judge on Thursday evening declared that Virginias ban on same-sex marriage was unconstitutional, in the strongest legal reversal yet of restrictive marriage amendments that exist throughout the South.

title: When Senator Kefauver Inspired the Scripts
description: A sonorous introduction by a United States senator, location shots of a major American city taken over by the syndicate, didactic demonstrations of criminal power and an action-packed denouement in which the vaguely Latin vice lord is dispatched by a representative of the law: The Miami Story (1954), briskly directed by Fred F. Sears, a prolific specialist in juvenile delinquency scare films and sci-fi cheapsters  and a new manufactured-on-demand release from Sony Pictures  is a classic example of the Kefauver policier.

title: A Constant Battle Against the Sale of Bodies in Bihar
description: The womens rights activists Ruchira Gupta and Gloria Steinem are keeping a diary of their travels throughout India as they meet the countrys young feminists, writers and thought leaders (previous posts are here and here). In this installation for India Ink, Ms. Gupta and Ms. Steinem visit Patna, Bihar states capital, and Forbesgunge, a small town on the border of India and Nepal, in Bihar.

title: China Celebrates First Gold Medals of Sochi
description: China is celebrating its first gold medals of the Sochi Olympics after two dramatic victories on Thursday in the womens 500-meter short-track speedskating and the womens 1,000-meter long-track speedskating events.

title: A Surprise Swiss Skiing Victory as U.S. Stars Are Shut Out
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  The medal podium after Fridays mens super combined was a smorgasbord of countries, upbringings and ski racing pedigrees, with one constant: Each racer was surprised by where he finished, and yet, wholly content with the result.

title: Test Yourself | Editing, Feb. 14, 2014
description: Use the following question for practice using transition words.

title: France and Germany Lead Euro Zone to Higher Growth
description: PARIS  The euro zone economy grew slightly faster than expected in the last three months of 2013, an official report showed on Friday, bringing welcome news for the global economy amid signs of slowing in the United States and China.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Winter Offensive Takes Toll on East Coast
description: In Winter Offensive Takes Toll on East Coast, Marc Santora writes about the latest winter storm to pound the eastern U.S.

title: The All-or-Nothing Marriage
description: ARE marriages today better or worse than they used to be?

title: Do Kids Need Recess?
description: Recess is one period in the day that many students dont want to miss. Yet with all the pressures on increasing test scores, schools have cut back on the amount of time that kids get to be kids. Plus, teachers sometimes use recess as a privilege that can be taken away if students dont behave. Of course, children hate to lose recess  but should the rest of us worry?

title: A Pandas Death Raises Questions About Its Treatment
description: The death of a panda in a zoo in central China has raised questions about whether its living conditions and treatment there may have contributed to its sudden illness.

title: 2 Koreas to Proceed With Reunions of Families Separated by War
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said Friday that it would honor its agreement to allow hundreds of older Koreans separated by the war on the peninsula six decades ago to reunite with their long-lost relatives, officials here said.

title: King Will Attend Closing Ceremony
description: WASHINGTON  Billie Jean King, who withdrew from the presidential delegation at the opening of the Winter Olympics for family reasons, will represent the United States at the closing ceremony on Feb. 23, the White House announced Friday.

title: The Self-Reflecting Pool
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Late last year, a designer and a geographer who met at M.I.T. revealed that theyd spent much of 2013 mapping every single swimming pool in Los Angeles  43,123 of them, to be exact. Their satellite photos documented all the little aquamarine ovals and rectangles in a huge 74-book project called The Big Atlas of L.A. Pools. Though the cultural conversation mostly revolved around how unsettlingly easy it was for them to locate and discover personal details relating to each pools owner  address, property value, even sex-offender status  I found myself fantasizing instead about disappearing, and using those pools to do it.

title: Times Minute | California's Drought
description: President Obama visits California to review the damage from the drought. Also on the Minute, anti-government protests in Venezuela escalate and Season 2 of "House of Cards" premieres on Netflix.

title: Times Minute | Californias Drought
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: Digging Out
description: Updated, 2:34 p.m.

title: Britains Welfare Queen
description: LONDON  The British queen is down to her last pennies. Well, actually, her last millions of pennies.

title: Gay Rights Activists in Beijing Protest for Their Russian Comrades
description: A small group of gay rights activists gathered outside the Russian Embassy in Beijing on Valentines Day to protest Russias antigay laws.

title: Flooded Britain
description: But Brits remain stoic in the face of adversity.

title: Jos. A. Bank, Trying to Fend Off Takeover Bid, Plans to Buy Parent of Eddie Bauer
description: Updated, 9:06 p.m. |After months of trying to fend off a takeover bid from Mens Wearhouse, Jos. A. Bank Clothiers has found another merger partner. But the mens wear retailer left the door wide open for its unwanted suitor.

title: Footage of Margot Fonteyn Rediscovered
description: London  The prince walks hesitantly around the princesss bed, then leans down and kisses her on the lips. The princess slowly sits up, her large dark eyes opening in wonder as the camera lingers upon her face.

title: For Snowbound Elderly in Suburbs, a Season of Isolation
description: YONKERS  On Thursday morning, Tambudzai Marino, a nurse who makes house calls for the Visiting Nurse Service of Westchester, was weaving and skidding her car around icy, slushy mounds on clogged highways and unplowed side streets, even braving the hills of this Hudson River city, then getting stuck and reversing gears and finding flatter routes, finally slogging by foot along the last quarter-mile. All so she could change bandages on Selwyn Westons ulcerated right foot.

title: Customer Service, Chinese Style
description: I have never written a bad online review of a business. If something about a companys product or service seems out of character to me, I try to speak directly to management, because thats how I like customers to deal with my business.

title: The Pitfalls of Publishing Books in India
description: MUMBAI  In withdrawing The Hindus: An Alternative History, by the American scholar Wendy Doniger, Penguin Books India joined a long line of publishers that have pulled contentious books from the Indian market a decision that they say has more to do with systemic problems in the country than a lack of commitment to freedom of expression.

title: The Milk Carton Kids Tune Out an Auto-Tuned World
description: There is something almost unnatural about the mellifluous harmonies of the Milk Carton Kids, something freakish. Its hard to believe that two people can sync to each other like that. They did not, after all, spring from the same womb like the Everly Brothers or even from the same corner of Queens like Simon and Garfunkel. In fact, Joey Ryan and Kenneth Pattengale did not find each other until fairly recently, after they were already performing as independent artists, a yin and a yang seeking each other out through the chaos.

title: Morning Agenda: Jos. A. Bank Makes a Move for Eddie Bauer Parent
description: JOS. A. BANK TO BUY PARENT OF EDDIE BAUER | Jos. A. Bank Clothiers said Friday morning that it had agreed to buy the parent company of Eddie Bauer in a deal valued at $825 million, including cash and debt. The purchase of Eddie Bauer, which comes amid the monthslong merger battle between Jos. A. Bank and Mens Wearhouse, will be done with a combination of $564 million in cash and approximately 4.7 million new shares of common stock of Jos. A. Bank.

title: Stupidity in Economic Discourse
description: Jonathan Gruber is mad as hell, and hes not going to take it anymore. The eminent health care economist and health reform architect is annoyed at Casey Mulligans latest, which misrepresents Grubers views; mine too.

title: Daily Report: In Takeover Bid, Comcast Seeks to Stay Ahead of Changing Technology Landscape
description: Three weeks ago, Comcast revealed plans to build an addition to its headquarters, a gleaming steel-and-glass tower designed by the renowned architect Norman Foster that will cast a shadow over downtown Philadelphia, Michael J. de la Merced and Bill Carter report.

title: ThyssenKrupp Shows Signs of a Turnaround
description: LONDON  ThyssenKrupp, the venerable but troubled German industrial conglomerate, produced some evidence on Friday that its managements turnaround plan was working.

title: Airbus Buys German Bank for In-House Finance Unit
description: PARIS  The Airbus Group, the parent company of the European plane maker, said Friday that it would acquire Salzburg Mnchen Bank, a small German private lender, to develop into an in-house bank providing loans to suppliers and other small-business partners.

title: 1914: A Song For Valentines Day
description: A hundred years ago, The New York Herald published a song for Valentines Day by Clinton Scollard:

title: Occidental to Spin Off California Division
description: Occidental Petroleum said on Friday that it planned to spin off its California business, breaking itself in two as it looks to narrow its operational focus.

title: Deadlock Remains and Aid Crisis Mounts as 2nd Round of Syria Talks Nears End
description: GENEVA  Frustrations mounted here on Friday as the second round of Syrian peace talks drew near a close without breaking a weeklong deadlock. The meetings sponsors, Russia and the United States, traded barbs, and American officials said they were developing new policy options to respond to the violence and humanitarian crisis in Syria that have only escalated during the talks.

title: A Valentines Day Diversion: Blame it on Biology
description: Heres a brief Valentines Day diversion. Blame it on Biology, one of the songs on my first CD, explores the deep, even biological, roots of the cycles of miscommunication, argument and reconciliation that are part of most romantic relationships. I built a video version in the early stages of yesterdays snowstorm, focusing on bird courtship behavior:

title: Auction of Telecom Spectrum Raises Nearly $10 Billion for Government
description: NEW DELHI  Two years after the Supreme Court canceled the licenses of 22 telecom operators who received them at below-market prices, the Indian government raised nearly $10 billion in an auction of telecommunications spectrum for voice and data services, well above its initial goal of $1.8 billion.

title: As War for Web Messaging Users Grows, Rakuten Buys Viber for $900 Million
description: Updated, 7:25 p.m. He recently lost the pitcher Masahiro Tanaka to the New York Yankees, but Hiroshi Mikitani, the billionaire owner of the Japanese e-commerce giant Rakuten, may now have found some solace.

title: Hanyu Wins Mens Figure Skating Gold
description: When Yuzuru Hanyu of Japan crashed to the ice on a quadruple jump, it seemed that the gold medal had slipped from his grasp. He fell again on another jump, and his hopes dimmed further.

title: Marc Jacobs: Happy Days?
description: Clouds that looked like fluffy little lambs hung over the Marc Jacobs show, the audience seated beneath on mushroom-shaped stools. The soundtrack on this final day of New York Fashion Week endlessly repeated the same words: Happy days are here again.

description: A glimpse at what guys and gals are wearing this season.

title: Italys Premier Leaves Post Amid Dispute
description: ROME  Prime Minister Enrico Letta of Italy resigned on Friday, the day after his own Democratic Party voted to replace him with the partys new leader, Matteo Renzi, the 39-year-old mayor of Florence.

title: New York Fashion Week: Marc Jacobs Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the New York Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Popcast: Rediscovering New Age
description: Q: Does the return of new age music mean that punk is really dead, or is it the new punk?

title: The Tom Perkins Theory of Taxation and Representation
description: This time, Tom Perkins knew he was courting controversy.

title: Emma Wolfe, Mayor de Blasios Secret Weapon
description: You helped run Bill de Blasios campaign, which made a lot of promises. How does he carry those forward now?  Bill has a laser focus on addressing the citys inequality crisis. Period. Thats whats going to animate him and animate the team. That was our campaign message, and we did not swerve from it. And we were elected on it. Now we just have to fulfill the mandate.

title: The Existential Anguish of the Tattoo
description: Somewhere between the release of Reality Bites and the closing of MTVs sports bureau, my generation got tattoos. We were not the first Americans to do so, but we were the first to do it en masse. Now, two decades later, we are becoming the first to carry them into middle age. It turns out tattoos are permanent, even when little else is.

title: Malfoy Is Still Scaring Kids
description: Also, Johnny Cashs fallback career and Judge Hodgmans stamp of disapproval.

title: Tony Rice, Guitar Hero
description: One morning last September, the red carpet was laid in Raleigh, N.C., for the 2013 International Bluegrass Music Awards, which had moved there from Nashville to escape country musics shadow. The citys bronze statue of Sir Walter Raleigh was newly adorned with a banjo. A few miles from the convention center, I was on my phone, trying to find out if Tony Rice, the legendary flatpick guitarist, would show up for his induction into the Bluegrass Hall of Fame. Tony has canceled a lot of dates over the last decade,

title: Fearing a Shootout at the E.R. Corral
description: My emergency unit handled a man who had been shot in the leg in the early hours of the morning. The trauma surgeons refused to have him transferred to the ward for wound management because they believed the victim would be pursued by his assailants, thereby posing a safety risk to staff members and patients. The police in the E.R. declined to pat down the injured man for weapons, as they were not legally empowered to do so. The man was retained in emergency for 12 hours.
