title: A Timelessness for Seven Blocks
description: Anybody whos had a hard time remembering what store used to be on a certain corner, despite having walked past it every day for years, may understand how ephemeral New York can be, even when it comes to landmarks etched in stone.

title: ECO 348, The Great Recession: Class 6
description: Slides here (pdf).

title: A Nordic Quest in New York
description: For months, I dodged the question.

title: Liberal Donors Pollute Politics, Too
description: Those who are worried about man-made climate change might be tempted to welcome the news that Tom Steyer, a Democratic billionaire, will spend $100 million this year to fight it. Mr. Steyer plans to put up half the money himself for attack ads against governors and lawmakers who ignore climate change, and will raise the rest from like-minded rich people.

title: Readers Respond to School Snow Days
description: The snow has finally tapered off in most places around the city, but the truth is the mere forecast of snow makes me anxious these days. In my column this week, I describe the way many suburban parents, including my husband and myself, have been struggling to cope with the slew of snow-related school closings. We have been trying to juggle work  conference calls, column writing  and caring for our antsy little ones. It is no easy task. We have had seven snow days so far this winter in Montclair, N.J., which is why I commended New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio for keeping city schools open during most of these storms, despite some complaints from parents.

title: Smuggling Case Against Antiquities Collector Is Dismissed
description: Joseph A. Lewis II, a Virginia businessman and avid collector who was indicted in 2011 on charges that he conspired to smuggle Egyptian antiquities and to launder money, has been cleared of wrongdoing. A federal judge in New York dismissed all the charges against him last month.

title: European Finance Ministers Revisit Plans for Failing Banks
description: BRUSSELS  With their plans to create a banking union facing deadlock, European finance ministers promised Tuesday to explore new ways to assuage critics who contend that their proposed system to deal with failing banks would be too feeble, too cumbersome and take too long to introduce.

title: Antigovernment Protests in Venezuela
description: The opposition leader Leopoldo Lpez appeared at a student-led protest in Caracas.

title: Riding a Chefs Twists and Turns
description: IF YOU HAVE a wide-ranging appetite and more time than money, theres never been a better time to eat in New York. Every corner of the city is churning out affordable hits of deliciousness, and a long wait is often the only obstacle between wanting some and getting some. Even acclaimed chefs are in this game now, making creative cooking more accessible than ever. And if the meal turns out to be less exciting than you had hoped, youve lost only a few hours and a few dollars. The next day will bring some new taste, a Filipino tapas bar or an artisanal spaetzle truck.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Thailand, South Africa and Sochi, Russia. More images from the Winter Olympics here.

title: Coaching Americans and Canadians, but Russian Through and Through
description: SOCHI, Russia  The career of Marina Zoueva, the celebrated ice dancing coach whose students won the gold and silver medals on Tuesday night, seems defined by conflicting loyalties.

title: Capital One to Revisit Credit Card Contract Terms After Outcry
description: Banks are known for sticking terms into the fine print that dont always sit well with consumers. But on Tuesday, Capital One said it would rethink the wording of its credit card contracts after a little-known provision began attracting a lot of unwanted attention.

title: At a California Resort, a Tequila Tutorial
description: A resort in Southern California is capitalizing on the recent proliferation of mezcal and other agave-derived liquor distilleries to draw new devotees to a members-only club. The Rancho Valencia Resort and Spa near San Diego recently started its All Agave Project, a series of seminars and tastings for the cocktail crowd.

title: Funny, You Dont Look Like My Wife
description: Technology hurtles forward, spinning off new surprises by the year, but Ive not yet heard that emails can be sent from beyond the grave. This startling concept is among the many oddities of The Correspondent, a psychological drama by Ken Urban that shovels on the preposterous twists in depicting the desperation of a widower trying to make contact with his dead wife.

title: App Smart: Walking
description: The same smartphones that often keep us sitting down can also encourage us to get up and walk more by tracking our steps.

title: These Apps Are Made for Walking
description: We spend too much time sitting around. Its true. Luckily the same smartphones that often keep us sitting down can also encourage us to get up and walk more by tracking our steps.

title: A Crusader on What Ails Artists
description: PITTSBURGH  Beer bottles clinked and indie-rock classics played overhead at a gallery opening here on a Friday night recently, as one artist after another chatted with Julie Sokolow, a filmmaker and health care advocate who has documented the Pittsburgh scene in detail.

title: A Frustrated Woman on the Verge of More of the Same
description: All kinds of monstrous mothers rage and rail in the movies, including those who love too little or too much. In Douglas Sirks 1959 melodrama, Imitation of Life, Lana Turner plays one type, a selfish white woman whos blissfully indifferent to her childs needs. Yet the more disturbing mother is played by Juanita Moore as a black domestic who smothers her own daughter in so much goodness that its no surprise that the girl flees. At the end, the saints daughter throws herself on her mothers coffin; its a wonder she doesnt leap in front of a train. In Childs Pose, a drama with a story as cold, merciless and inevitable as a tomb, escape proves every bit as futile.

title: London Fashion Week: Fashion East Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Alexandra Waespi.

title: Romance Stirs on the Way Down Memory Lane
description: In Nilo Cruzs best-known play, the Pulitzer Prize-winning Anna in the Tropics, a Tolstoy novel read aloud has the power to alter lives.

title: American David Wise Wins Mens Ski Halfpipe
description: In the debut of ski halfpipe as an Olympic sport, David Wise won a gold medal with a clean, elegant run through snowy, low-visibility conditions that tripped up other medal contenders.

title: Today Claws Ahead of Good Morning America With Help of Olympics
description: It took all the power of the Winter Olympics, but NBCs Today show clawed its way back to the top of the ratings last week, besting by an average of 211,000 viewers a day the now-consistent morning leader, Good Morning America on ABC.

title: The Impact of a Minimum-Wage Increase
description: Jared Bernstein is a senior fellow at the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities in Washington and a former chief economist to Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Off to a Bigger Journey, After Years in the World of 30s-Style Swing Music
description: The young jazz singer Brianna Thomas has been playing clubs and festivals off and on since 2006. She has also led her own band for several years, but if you havent come across her it could be because shes done a fair amount of work in the specialized world of 30s-style swing music. That world generates work, but it also obscures.

title: Hitlers Germany, Seen Through Young Eyes
description: In 1936, Joachim Fest, 10 at the time, was summoned by his father, Johannes, to come with his older brother for a heart-to-heart talk in the study of their house in Berlin.

title: President Obama Writes Apology to Art Historian
description: President Obama raised hackles last month when, during a speech at a factory in Wisconsin, he said that people could make more money with skills in manufacturing or the trades than they might with an art history degree.

title: Amid Blunders on Ice, a Few Signs of Grace
description: Its a consolation to know you arent alone. A few days before the Sochi Olympics started, several figure skating luminaries gathered for a screening as part of the Dance on Camera festival at Lincoln Center. After viewing a clip of the transcendent British skater John Curry, Dorothy Hamill made an astute observation: This was the first time I watched skating in a long time without swearing at the television set. Theres nothing like the Olympics to incite foul language. Its not just the flawed judging system, in which skaters who hope to win a medal must focus more energy on racking up points than on refining their artistic point of view, or even Scott Hamiltons effusive screech.

title: Hedge Fund Suit Seeks Identity of Anonymous Blogger
description: David Einhorn has filed a lawsuit seeking to unmask the identity of an anonymous financial blogger who, he says, disclosed that Mr. Einhorns hedge fund was buying shares in a technology company. The legal maneuver illustrates the tension between a money managers ability to safeguard his trading strategies and the rights of others to report on them.

title: Behind the Smashing of a Vase
description: MIAMI  Any new museum can expect teething problems.

title: Octodad: Dadliest Catch, Bravely Default, OlliOlli and Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc
description: OCTODAD

title: Times Minute | Protests Around the Globe
description: Today we take a look at protests in Ukraine, Thailand and Venezuela.

title: Times Minute |  Protests Around the Globe
description: In the Video

title: Two Classics Collide at Simone Rocha
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: DC Home Buzz
description: Kenyan-born Ati Williams attended university in Canada, eventually coming to the U.S. for a post-college internship. She runs a boutique real-estate firm that charges an all-inclusive flat fee.

title: White House Responds to Net Neutrality Petition
description: WASHINGTON  Obama administration officials said Tuesday that the president continues to support a free and open Internet but that he cannot order the Federal Communications Commission to reclassify broadband service as a utility that is subject to the same rules and rate regulation as local telephone service.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Burberrys Bloomsbury Chic
description: Our girl is in touch with her artistic side this season, the makeup artist Wendy Rowe said backstage at Burberry Prorsum. To complement Christopher Baileys collection, which was inspired by the romance of the early 20th-century circle of British writers and artists known as the Bloomsbury Group, Rowe mixed Burberry Fresh Glow Fluid in two colors  Nude Radiance and Golden Radiance  to achieve the relaxed, slightly sun-kissed aesthetic of a woman with greater things on her mind than makeup. Brows were groomed and lashes were left bare, while the aubergine-hued eye shadow  Rowes tribute to the groups painters, such as Vanessa Bell and Roger Fry tied in with the one-off painted pieces in the collection.

title: Schumer Recuses Himself From Review of Comcast Deal
description: Senator Charles Schumer, Democrat of New York, has recused himself from reviewing Comcasts agreement to buy Time Warner Cable after the revelation that his brother, the lawyer Robert Schumer, worked on the deal.

title: Lending Where Banks Cant, Blackstone Thrives in Ireland
description: Bankers have been blanketing Ireland in search of cheap assets and lucrative deals, and few firms have been as aggressive as the Blackstone Group.

title: F.B.I. Joins Ole Miss Inquiry After Noose Is Left on Statue
description: OXFORD, Miss.  The Federal Bureau of Investigation said Tuesday that it had joined the inquiry into an act of vandalism at the University of Mississippi, where a statue of the universitys first black student was found with a noose and a flag with the Confederate battle emblem.

title: Former Aides to Christie Again Reject a Subpoena
description: Setting up a likely court battle, two former aides to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey refused again on Tuesday to provide materials subpoenaed by the legislative panel investigating the politically charged lane closings leading to the George Washington Bridge last September.

title: After Delays, Musharraf Appears Before Pakistani Court
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pervez Musharraf, the former military ruler of Pakistan, finally made an appearance on Tuesday before a special court that is deciding whether to try him for treason, after he failed to appear at a series of earlier proceedings.

title: The Decline of the Public Intellectual?
description: To the Editor:

title: Delay of the Health Laws Employer Mandate
description: To the Editor:

title: To Draw Millennials, a Stronger Beer Made to Suggest Spirits
description: FORTUNE, they say, favors the bold. Will Fortune also favor a brewer?

title: Biathlon Reveals Slim Margin Between Silver and Gold
description: Emil Hegle Svendsen of Norway edged Martin Fourcade of France in a photo finish in the mass start 15,000 kilometer biathlon.

title: Working With Frank Gehry
description: To the Editor:

title: Allowing Felons to Vote
Godot Arrives in Sarajevo
description: SARAJEVO, Bosnia and Herzegovina  A BOY, his voice heavy with embarrassment and regret, was performing Samuel Beckett in Serbo-Croatian. Mr. Godot, he said, told me to tell you that he wont come this evening, but surely tomorrow.

title: Alison Jolly, Who Found Female Dominance in Lemurs, Dies at 76
description: Alison Jolly, an American-born primatologist whose research in the forests of Madagascar shed new light on the evolution of social intelligence and helped disprove a longstanding scientific tenet that males were dominant in every primate species, died on Feb. 6 in Lewes, East Sussex, England. She was 76.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: John A. Catsimatidis
description: Mr. Catsimatidis, 65, is the owner and chief executive of the Red Apple Group, a New York company with holdings in real estate, oil refining, retail petroleum products, convenience stores and the Red Apple and Gristedes supermarkets.

title: Mormon Church to Expand Development in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  Plans for expansion of a Mormon complex along two blocks of north-central Philadelphia are providing city officials with a hope of reconnecting those sections to the citys core business district of Center City.

title: Ex-U.S. Lawmaker Charged With Pornography Possession in Zimbabwe
description: A former United States congressman from Illinois has been arrested in Zimbabwe and charged with possession of pornographic material, a local law enforcement spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

title: South Sudans Forces Clash With Rebels Near U.N. Base
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A fierce battle erupted between government and rebel forces in an oil-rich part of South Sudan on Tuesday, in the most significant violation of the cease-fire that was supposed to help bring peace to the fractured young nation.

title: Profit Slides 8.5% for Coke, as Weak Sales Abroad Hit Hard
description: Changing consumer tastes and concerns about the role of soda in the nations obesity crisis were among the problems cited by analysts as responsible for lower earnings and sales for Coca-Cola in the fourth quarter.

title: Olympics Can Be a Coaching Wilderness
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Coaches for Norways mens biathlon team fanned out around the track for the 15-kilometer mass start race Tuesday afternoon with much of the equipment you would need for a really good bank heist. They had a truck, walkie-talkies, spotting scopes and 14 people, staked out along the course.

title: In N.Y.U. Merger, One University and, for Now, Two Teams
description: On a recent night in Brooklyn, the N.Y.U.-Poly volleyball team won an exciting point in the first game of a match against visiting Purchase College.

title: Loan Program for Reactors Is Fizzling
description: WASHINGTON  Energy Secretary Ernest Moniz is set to announce on Wednesday that he will finish a $6.5 billion loan guarantee this week and another soon for $1.8 billion to help three Georgia electric companies build the first new nuclear reactors in the United States in three decades.

title: Breakfast Before the MOOC
description: Beginning March 2, Prof. Hossam Haick, will teach the first ever massive open online course, or MOOC, on nanotechnology in Arabic. Whats more interesting, though, he explained to me the other day over breakfast is some of the curious email hes received from students registering for his MOOC from all over the Arab world. Their questions include: Are you a real person? Are you really an Arab, or are you an Israeli Jew speaking Arabic, pretending to be an Arab? Thats because Haick is an Israeli Arab from Nazareth and will be teaching this course from his home university, the Technion, Israels premier science and technology institute, and the place we were having breakfast was Tel Aviv.

title: An Ambiguous Omen, U.S. Household Debt Begins to Rise Again
description: American households took on $241 billion in additional debt in the fourth quarter of last year, signaling the end of an extended period of hunkering down. Total household debt increased 2.1 percent, the largest quarterly increase since before the recession, according to a new report from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: Candidate for Texas Governor Stands By Outspoken Musician
description: HOUSTON  Attorney General Greg Abbott of Texas, the leading candidate for the Republican nomination for governor, on Tuesday defended his decision to campaign with the pro-gun musician and conservative commentator Ted Nugent a month after Mr. Nugent called President Obama a communist-nurtured subhuman mongrel.

title: Germanys Coal Addiction
description: Germany is in the midst of an unprecedented shift to renewable energy, but is still dependent on brown coal. The village of Atterwasch may become a victim of Germanys hunger for brown coal.

title: 54 Drawers
description: This is the fourth part of an eight-part series.

title: Violent Crimes Declined Across Country in First Six Months of 2013, F.B.I. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Bureau of Investigation said Tuesday that violent crimes, including murders, fell by 5.4 percent in the first six months of 2013 compared with the same period in 2012, continuing a long reduction in violent crime across the country.

title: German Village Resists Plans to Strip It Away for the Coal Underneath
description: ATTERWASCH, Germany  A grove of apple saplings grows on the lee side of Ulrich Schulzs barn. He did not plant them for the fruit, he said, but as an act of rebellion against a nearby mining company that wants to raze his farm, which his family has owned since 1560, to get at the coal beneath his land.

title: Puerto Rico Wants to Incur More Debt to Regain Financial Footing
description: Puerto Rico still has the capacity to issue more than $3 billion in new debt, senior officials said Tuesday, adding that they hoped to tap the credit markets in March despite concern about whether the commonwealth can sustain its current large debt load.

title: Outrage Over Wall St. Pay, but Shrugs for Silicon Valley?
description: Big paydays on Wall Street often come under laserlike scrutiny, while Silicon Valley gets a pass on its own compensation excesses. Why the double standard?

title: Difficult Turns in Footwork Sequence
description: Gold gets additional points by skimming across the ice while doing a series of turns, called a twizzle, which helps increase the difficulty level of her footwork sequence.

title: A Challenging Spin Position
description: Gold enters a high-scoring combination spin with a challenging entry, known as a back entrance, then holds her camel position for two revolutions.

title: A Quick Turn Before a Jump
description: Height and distance matter in jumps. But a quick turn, called a bracket, before the takeoff of Gold's double axel, can add almost 10 percent to the jump's value.

title: In Figure Skating, the Second Team Shines
description: Even as the Winter Olympics have added ultra-acrobatic sports familiar mainly to X Games fans, figure skating has remained a bedrock event for the network that carries the Winter Olympics.

title: Loan Complaints by Homeowners Rise Once More
description: A growing number of homeowners trying to avert foreclosure are confronting problems on a new front as the mortgage industry undergoes a seismic shift.

title: Venezuelan Protest Leader Jabs at Government on the Streets and Online
description: Updated, Wednesday, 9:12 a.m. | As my colleague William Neuman reports, the Venezuelan opposition leader Leopoldo Lpez came out of hiding on Tuesday, as promised, and surrendered to the authorities to face charges of terrorism. Mr. Lpez, a Harvard-educated former mayor of a wealthy section of Caracas, is the political face of ongoing demonstrations against President Nicols Maduros government.

title: Rhapsody in Blue or Rap? Skating Will Add Vocals
description: SOCHI, Russia  The music you hear during the figure skating competition this week is the sound of an era ending.

title: Obamas Vote-Getting Tactics Struggle to Find the Uninsured
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla.  The hunt for the uninsured in Broward County got underway one recent afternoon when 41 canvassers, armed with electronic maps on Samsung tablets, set off through working-class neighborhoods to peddle the Affordable Care Act door to door. Four hours later, they had made contact with 2,623 residents and signed up exactly 25 people.

title: Gov. Cuomos Bold Step on Prison Education
description: One of the biggest obstacles to reducing Americas enormous prison population is the stubbornly high rates of recidivism. Nationwide, as many as half of those released end up back in prison within three years.

title: Venezuelan Opposition Chief Surrenders, but Not Without a Rally
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  A prominent Venezuelan opposition leader surrendered to the authorities on Tuesday in the midst of a large crowd of supporters who tried to block his arrest on accusations that he was responsible for violence that erupted during recent antigovernment protests.

title: What Next for Syria?
description: With the apparent collapse of the United Nations-mediated peace talks on Syria, the United States and its allies find themselves in a difficult spot. Absent a diplomatic and political option, what can the world do about a civil war that has killed an estimated 136,000 people, produced nine million refugees, displaced 4.25 million civilians internally and now threatens to destabilize several other countries in the region?

title: Too Perfect Job Offer Lures a Parks Expert Back to Work
description: New Yorkers for Parks, the citys leading parks advocacy group, has named Tupper Thomas, former leader of the Prospect Park Alliance and a nationally known parks expert, to be its new executive director.

title: Gracie Gold's Extras
description: Extras -- small maneuvers before, during or after a major move -- could give U.S. champion Gracie Gold a needed boost for the Olympic podium.

title: Change the Rules on Secret Money
description: In November, when the Internal Revenue Service finally stirred itself to propose a modest crackdown on the abuse of the tax code by political groups, it was immediately attacked by tax-exempt nonprofit groups on the right. That wasnt too surprising; secret donations from conservatives to these groups are the principal reason American politics is now dominated by those with huge bank accounts.

title: History: Get Me Rewrite!
description: I found myself sitting on a bar stool last winter next to Robert Caro at an Irish wake in Times Square for my irreplaceable Times colleague Frank Prial.

title: Mariners and Cano Focus on Winning Now
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  The Seattle Mariners rebuilt their spring training complex this year, and now, they hope, they have reshaped their identity. The man with three lockers  one with his name above it, between two empty stalls in the far left corner of the clubhouse  is the cornerstone, charged with reviving a sagging brand.

title: Chief of New Jersey Transit to Quit After a Rocky Tenure
description: The executive director of New Jersey Transit is resigning, bringing an end to a four-year run pocked by the agencys often-maligned performance during Hurricane Sandy and the recent Super Bowl in East Rutherford, N.J.

title: Satellite Images of the Protests in Kiev
description: A satellite image showing the site of the protests in Independence Square in Kiev, Ukraine.

title: Doctors Train to Spot Signs of A.D.H.D. in Children
description: Jerry, 9 years old, dissolved into his Game Boy while his father described his attentional difficulties to the family pediatrician. The child began flitting around the room distractedly, ignoring the doctors questions and squirming in his chair  but then he leapt up and yelled: Freeze! What do you think is the problem here?

title: Politics to Shadow Obamas Trade Talks in Mexico
description: TOLUCA, Mexico  President Obama traveled to Mexico on Wednesday for a brief but politically fraught visit aimed at forging closer trade ties with Americas two closest neighbors even as his partys leaders back home have vowed to undercut his efforts.

title: Sentencing and the 'Affluenza' Factor
Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, February 19, 2014
description: We will come out of Maidan either free or slaves. But we dont want to be slaves.

title: Northwestern Quarterback Makes His Case for Players Union
description: CHICAGO  Kain Colter, a football recruit, arrived at Northwestern University with dreams of becoming an orthopedic surgeon. But the summer before his freshman year, he said, he was steered away from a chemistry class toward less strenuous options like sociology and African history. He is now pursuing a psychology degree instead of the premed track.

title: Motivational Words
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Atten-shun! Eyes right here, soldiers, weve got us a puzzle to discuss.

title: Educating Doctors About A.D.H.D. Without Resorting to Ritalin Wars
description: Not long ago, amid what felt like a rising tide of criticism of parents of children who were being medicated for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (A.D.H.D.), readers in this space complained, and I joined them. Its offensive, we said, to accuse parents (and teachers, and doctors) of using drug treatment to get off the hook for more complex problems, or teaching children to reach for a pill instead of finding another way to cope with a problem. Its also useless. If A.D.H.D. is being over-diagnosed or overmedicated, pointing fingers wont help either children who do need treatment or those who need something else.

title: Citys Safety Net on Trial Over a Baby Killed in 07
description: By all accounts, Hailey Gonzalezs life was short, impoverished and brutal. She was born in November 2005 to unwed parents living in a homeless shelter. Her mother, Marlene Medina, a foster child herself, had already lost custody of another daughter, Elizabeth, because a judge had determined that she was not fit to care for her.

title: Former Marine in Tehran Jail Retains a Top Iranian Lawyer
description: Amir Hekmati, a former Marine incarcerated in Iran on spying charges, has retained a prominent Iranian lawyer to represent him in a new effort to gain his release after nearly two and a half years in Tehrans Evin Prison, Mr. Hekmatis family reported on Tuesday.

title: Militant Group Says It Attacked Tourist Bus in Sinai
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian militant group that has carried out months of deadly assaults on the police and the military has claimed responsibility for the bombing of a tourist bus that killed four people in the Sinai Peninsula on Sunday.

title: In Ryan, Yankees Have Understudy Who Knows His Role
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Just before he left Los Angeles for Tampa a few days ago, Brendan Ryan, the Yankees backup shortstop, made sure to go to Staples Center to watch his favorite team, the Los Angeles Clippers. He felt the need to go, he said, because the three previous times he had seen the Clippers this season, their star point guard, Chris Paul, did not play because of injury.

title: From Plains to CUNY, New Chief Is Coming Home
description: The University of Nebraska is a moderately sized institution with a Big Ten athletic program, 50,000 students spread over four campuses, and winds sweeping over the plains lately dwindling into the low double digits  below zero.

title: Joba Chamberlains Motto: No More Weirdness
description: LAKELAND, Fla.  There are no Joba Rules here at the Detroit Tigers spring training base, other than those he has set for himself.

title: Snowboarders and Skiers Fly in Face of Logo Rules
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  The Olympic Games work extremely hard to disguise their vast corporate ties. Fans at the venues and viewers at home will not see any business logos in the background, except the ubiquitous Olympic rings and Sochi 2014 emblem. Compared with Nascar cars, international soccer uniforms or outfield fences, the illusion of the Olympics is one of noncommercial purity.

title: Bob Casale, Guitarist in Devo, Dies at 61
description: Bob Casale, a guitarist who was an original member of the influential rock band Devo, died on Monday. He was 61.

title: Afghan Ethnic Tensions Rise in Media and Politics
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  It started with a heat-of-the-moment comment on a partisan television talk show, drawing an ethnic line that was bold even by Afghan standards.

title: Citing Inequality Crisis, Mayor Names Top Legal Adviser and Fills 2 Other Jobs
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio named Maya Wiley, a longtime advocate for racial and social justice, as his chief legal adviser Tuesday, giving her a forceful role in addressing what he called an inequality crisis.

title: Mens Halfpipe
description: In New Event, the American David Wise Wins Gold

title: Rob Reiner to Receive Film Society Honor
description: The director and actor Rob Reiner will receive the Film Society of Lincoln Centers annual Chaplin Award at a gala in April, the organization announced Tuesday.

title: Artists Named for Hammer Museums Los Angeles Biennial
description: The Hammer Museum in Los Angeles has finalized its choice of 35 artists for the second edition of Made in L.A., the West Coast answer to the Whitney Biennial. While the Whitney features artists from across the country, the Hammer focuses on new or under-recognized artists working in Los Angeles.

title: PCell Demo
description: Steve Perlman, founder and chief executive, explains how his company's pCell technology works.

title: As Knicks Lose Ground, Its Back to the Grind for Anthony
description: MEMPHIS  As the ball left Mike Millers fingertips, Carmelo Anthony could only hope for something unscripted. Perhaps Miller would forget to follow through, Anthony said. Of course, he knew it was unlikely. After everything that had happened against the Grizzlies on Tuesday night  the early deficit, the late comeback  Anthony and the Knicks could only watch.

title: Nets, as Rested as Can Be, Steel Themselves for Second Half
description: SALT LAKE CITY  After the four-day All-Star break, the Nets reconvened for a nighttime practice at Jon M. Huntsman Center at the University of Utah. They joked that their time off was too brief. They were serious about the task at hand.

title: Inquiry Into Queens School Calls for Firing of Principal
description: Officials took steps toward firing a Queens elementary school principal after a report on Tuesday found that she regularly arrived late to work and called a custodian to help her enter the building through a side door.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 18, 2014
James Cahill, Influential Authority on Chinese Art, Dies at 87
description: James Cahill, one of the foremost authorities on Chinese art, whose interpretations of Chinese painting for the West influenced generations of scholars, died on Friday at his home in Berkeley, Calif. He was 87.

title: What to Watch: Wednesday, Feb. 19
description: ALPINE SKIING Ted Ligety of the United States, still without a medal in these Games, competes in his best event, the giant slalom. NBC, 8 p.m.

title: Warner in Deal to Sign Acts Found on Shazam
description: In the good old days of digital music  say, five or six years ago  high-tech talent scouting by record labels meant trawling MySpace for hot new bands. Labels still hunt for acts online, but the pools of data they consult have become much more vast, and access to them highly competitive.

title: The Employer Mandate: Dukakis All Over Again
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: The Genetics of Being a Daredevil
description: Watching participants in slopestyle and half-pipe skiing and snowboarding flip, curl, cartwheel and otherwise contort themselves in the air during the Winter Olympics competition, many of us have probably wondered not only how the athletes managed to perform such feats but also why. Helpfully, a recent study of the genetics of risk-taking intimates that their behavior may be motivated, at least in part, by their DNA.

title: MDC Partners Buys Majority Stake in Canadian Proxy Solicitor
description: MDC Partners, an agency holding group, is expanding into a classic Wall Street business: proxy solicitation.

title: Wireless System Could Offer a Private Fast Lane
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In a spacious loft across the street from the Bay Bridge, Steve Perlman did something last week that would ordinarily bring a cellular network to its knees.

title: Corrections: February 19, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Word of the Day | marital
description: marital \mer--tl, ma-r-\ adjective

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: Noon (IFC) THE LIFE AQUATIC WITH STEVE ZISSOU (2004) Bill Murray, above center, is Steve Zissou, a flashy oceanographer far past his prime, who, after the death of his friend (Seymour Cassel), is confronted by his own sense of mortality, the sudden appearance of an airplane pilot (Owen Wilson) who may or may not be his son, an investigative reporter (Cate Blanchett) and a bond company stooge (Bud Cort) in this comedy from Wes Anderson, who wrote the screenplay with Noah Baumbach. In my ideal cinmathque, The Life Aquatic would play on a permanent double bill with The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times. Mr. Anderson and Stephen Hillenburg, Mr. SquarePantss creator, share not only a taste for nautical nonsense, but also a willingness to carry the banner of unfettered imaginative silliness into battle against the tyranny of maturity.

title: A Chilling Phone Call Adds to Hurdles of Publishing Xi Jinping Book
description: The exiled writer Yu Jie takes a bleak view of President Xi Jinping of China. In his latest book, still awaiting publication, Mr. Yu describes Mr. Xi as a thuggish politician driven by a dangerous compound of Maoist nostalgia and authoritarian, expansionist impulses.

title: Ukraine Leader Strains for Grip as Chaos Spreads
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Ukraine spiraled deeper into disarray on Wednesday as the government of President Viktor F. Yanukovych and several thousand grimly determined protesters, along with their supporters in Russia and Europe, faced off in a confrontation over the fate of this fractured country of 46 million.

title: North Korea Arrests Christian Missionary From Australia
description: HONG KONG  North Korea has arrested a Christian missionary from Australia, his family said on Wednesday, taking him into captivity even as it continues to face pressure to release an American missionary it has held for more than a year.

title: Ted Ligety Extends Reign With Giant Slalom Win
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Shut out at the 2010 Vancouver Olympics, Ted Ligety arrived at the Sochi Games as a medal contender in three events.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Feb. 19, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: Chinas Quick Slide to Curling Success
description: Updated, 1:04 p.m. | Chinas rise as an Olympic powerhouse is full of stories of athletes becoming champions in sports their parents could not have imagined playing. But perhaps the most rapid journey to the top has been in curling, a sport that has a mere 15-year history in China.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Tunisian B-Boys Biggest Battle: Keeping Youths From Extremism
description: In Tunisian B-Boys Biggest Battle: Keeping Youths From Extremism, Carlotta Gall writes about young men in Tunisia who see themselves as artists through free performances of dance, graffiti and theater.

title: What Crazy Adventure Would You Want to Take?
description: Have you ever wanted to take a break from your everyday life and do something out of the ordinary? Maybe kayak around Lake Superior or go hang gliding in the Outer Banks? Or, would you rather take a road trip across the country with friends, or hitchhike through Vietnam?

title: Rejecting Stereotypes, Photographing Real Indians
description: It started with a dream. Matika Wilburs great-grandmother, who had died years before, was urging her to return home.

title: A Look Back at London Fashion Week
description: Some images from the scores of runway shows and presentations staged for autumn/winter 2014 collections.

title: Pity Brazils Military Police
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  In Brazil, police officers kill an average of five people every day. In 2012, according to a security report from the Brazilian Forum on Public Security, 1,890 Brazilians were killed by the police, 351 here in So Paulo. That was around 20 percent of all homicides in the city. At the same time, 11 police officers were killed on duty here and around 100 were executed off-duty, allegedly by organized crime. Police officers are three times more likely to be murdered than the average Brazilian.

title: State Media Outlets Call Xi Jinping Cartoon a First
description: Outfitted in a simple, gray zip-up jacket and blue trousers, round belly in plain sight, President Xi Jinping of China made his cartoon debut in the state media on Wednesday.

title: Times Minute | Obama's Mexico Trip
description: President Obama meets with Mexico's president and Canada's prime minister. Also on the Minute, a look at the New Nordic food scene in New York City and the unique musical sounds of Tanzania.

title: Times Minute | Obamas Mexico Trip
description: In the Video

title: Daily Report: The Quest for Higher Wireless Speeds, Even in Crowds
description: A recent demonstration in San Francisco showed off a technology that Steve Perlman, a serial entrepreneur and inventor who sold WebTV to Microsoft for more than $500 million in the late 1990s, contends will give mobile users far faster cellular network speeds, with fewer dropped phone calls and other annoyances, even in stadiums and other places where thousands of people use mobile phones at the same time, Nick Wingfield reports.

title: New York Today: Olympian Dreams
description: Updated 10:04 a.m.

title: After Two Centuries, Peugeot Family Cedes Control
description: PARIS  The family business that grew into PSA Peugeot Citron got its start more than 200 years ago, making manufactured goods like pepper mills, bicycles and whale-bone corsets on its way to becoming the largest automaker in France. This week the Peugeot family, one of the countrys wealthiest, agreed to give up control of the company it had been running for eight generations.

title: Learning to Cut the Sugar
description: Dr. Robert Lustig became widely known as the anti-sugar guy after a lecture of his called Sugar: The Bitter Truth was posted on YouTube and gained widespread attention. In his talk, Dr. Lustig explains why all calories are not created equal, and why he believes those from sugar in particular are driving an epidemic of obesity and chronic disease.

title: Things End Badly for a Poet, but Quite Well for the Tenor
description: Last February, the German tenor Jonas Kaufmann had a triumph at the Metropolitan Opera when he performed the title role of Wagners Parsifal in the companys very bleak but theatrically riveting new production. On Tuesday night, a year later, Mr. Kaufmann was back at the Met in the title role of Massenets Werther on the opening night of Richard Eyres new production. It was another success for Mr. Kaufmann, currently the most in-demand, versatile and exciting tenor in opera.

title: A Scrappy Real Estate Broker Stakes Her Business on Flat Fees
description: Ati Okelo Williams, the owner of DC Home Buzz, a real estate agency in Washington, says she is not used to feeling fearful.

title: Renaissance Learning Draws $40 Million Investment From Google Capital
description: Roughly one year into its existence, Google Capital is wasting no time in putting its money to work.

title: Andhra Pradeshs Chief Minister Resigns to Protest Creation of Telangana State
description: HYDERABAD, Andhra Pradesh  The coastal and southern regions of this southern state were shut down Wednesday as political leaders called for a strike and denounced the lower house of Parliaments approval of the new state of Telangana, which will be created out of the northern areas of Andhra Pradesh.

title: British Pet Retailer Plans I.P.O., Hoping to Raise $459.7 Million
description: LONDON  Pets at Home on Wednesday became the latest company to join a pack of initial public offerings announced in Europe this week.

title: 2 Deadly Blasts Rock Beirut, as Violence Seeps From Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Two powerful explosions struck a busy area in southern Beirut near an Iranian cultural center on Wednesday, killing at least five people and wounding dozens in the latest in a series of bomb attacks on civilians here as violence continued to spill over from the war in neighboring Syria.

title: Acrostic
description: Acrostic puzzle for February 23, 2014

title: Signet Jewelers to Buy Zale in $900 Million Deal
description: Updated, 8:04 p.m. | The specialty jewelry retailer Signet Jewelers said on Wednesday that it would acquire its smaller rival the Zale Corporation, for $900 million in cash, significantly expanding its footprint in the United States and Canada.

title: Live Stream | Guccis Fall 2014 Collection at Milan Fashion Week
description: The latest womens collection from Gucci at Milan Fashion Week.

title: The Evolution of Neil Patrick Harris
description: Neil Patrick Harris has commanded big roles on both stage and screen. His next challenge will be to play the lead in Hedwig and the Angry Inch on Broadway.

title: Acrostic Answer
description: Acrostic answer for February 23, 2014

title: Loaves, Fishes, Hot Dogs, and Buns
description: Matthew Yglesias tries to explain why productivity growth has nothing to do with deflation using a parable of loaves and fishes. I did something kind of similar long ago, arguing against a naive view of technological unemployment in terms of hot dogs and buns.

title: As Far as Possible From His Sitcom
description: Sporting a Marc Jacobs tuxedo and fashionably mussed hair, Neil Patrick Harris sweeps into the Pierre Hotel looking super-duper, as he likes to say, but craving his usual pick-me-up, a sugar-free Red Bull. Its 7 p.m. on a Monday, and he has just finished his first rehearsal for the Broadway rock musical Hedwig and the Angry Inch, testing his vocal range against the shows thrashing score. Ahead are hours of schmoozing as the 2014 honoree of the Drama League, an organization that usually celebrates Tony Award-winning stars.

title: LinkedIn Wants to Be Your Soapbox, Not Just Your Rsum
description: LinkedIn has established itself as the digital rsum service for the white-collar world, with 277 million users globally. On Wednesday, it will announce features that will help users enhance their profiles with essays, work samples or industry manifestos to stand out from the crowd.

title: Carlyles Profit Soars on Rise in Performance Fees
description: Updated, 4:49 p.m. | The fourth quarter of last year was a robust one for private equity, and the Carlyle Group turned in particularly strong results, with its profit rising sharply from the period a year earlier.

title: London Fashion Week Street Style
description: Craig Arend of Altamira NYC takes over our Instagram account for London Fashion Week. Check out NYTimesFashion on Instagram for more.

title: Doubts About Candy Crushs Sweetness
description: SUGAR RUSH FOR CANDY CRUSH | King Digital Entertainments filing of a $500 million initial public offering on Tuesday had many investors salivating. But it remains to be seen whether the company behind the addictive game Candy Crush can sustain its sweetness and avoid the pitfalls of other game makers, Jenna Wortham and Michael J. de la Merced write in DealBook. Indeed, Candy Crush attracts 93 million players each day and accounts for nearly 80 percent of the companys revenue, which neared $1.9 billion by the end of 2013 from $164 million in 2012.

title: Amid Efforts to Expand Marine Preserves, a Warning to Focus on Quality
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A generation ago, when Tommy Remengesau Jr. went fishing off the beautiful island nation of Palau, the seas were so rich, he said, that I could see great stocks of fish. Such bounty has since dwindled, in Palau and worldwide.

title: U.S. Imposes Visa Ban on 20 Ukrainian Officials as Further Sanctions Are Threatened
description: BRUSSELS  Expressing alarm at the lethal escalation of political violence in Ukraine, the European Union and the United States scrambled for a quick response Wednesday, threatening punitive sanctions against senior figures in the Ukrainian government. The Obama administration later said it had placed 20 top Ukrainian officials on a visa blacklist.

title: Lehman Bankruptcy Judge to Join Morrison & Foerster
description: The judge who oversaw the largest bankruptcy in American history  the Chapter 11 case of Lehman Brothers, which lasted nearly four years  is joining the law firm Morrison & Foerster.

title: Greek Speakers Unite
description: Dear Diary:

title: R.B.S. Said to Place Trader on Leave Amid Currency Investigation
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland has placed a third foreign exchange trader on leave amid a series of investigations by regulators into potential manipulation of benchmark currency rates.

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Fall/Winter 2014 London Womens Shows
description: A glimpse at what gals are wearing this season.

title: This Kind of Picky Eater Is Made, Not Born
description: Six weeks ago in this space, I wondered: What is a picky eater? Is it someone who wont taste new things? Someone who knows exactly what they like? Someone who loves the spotlight? Are picky eaters made, not born?

title: Why Candy Crush I.P.O. Could be a Dangerous Game
description: Candy Crush is destined to be a heart breaker. The addictive mobile apps Europe-based maker, King Digital Entertainment, is ready to capitalize on the hype with an initial public offering in the United States. With its top hit Candy Crush Saga generating about 80 percent of revenue, though, investor infatuation would be a dangerous game.

title: Truth Is Beauty, and Beauty Can Be Subversive
description: BERLIN  For decades,  the Volksbhne theater, in the former East Berlin, has been at the heart of political theater in Europe. Its bold productions, often involving nudity, women in mens roles and anticapitalist rhetoric, have helped shape the avant-garde.

title: R.B.S. to Sell Structured Products Unit to BNP Paribas
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Wednesday that it would sell its structured retail investor products and equity derivatives business to BNP Paribas.

title: Lawyers for German at Center of Art-Cache Case File Appeal
description: BERLIN  Lawyers representing Cornelius Gurlitt said Wednesday that they had filed an appeal with German prosecutors demanding the return of hundreds of their clients artworks, seized two years ago as part of an investigation into tax evasion.

title: In Hockey Loss, Russian Pride Yields to Gloom
description: SOCHI, Russia  President Vladimir V. Putin and any other Russian who was asked made it plain that the Sochi Games success hinged on the Russian mens hockey team.

title: Gracie Golds Extras
description: Extras  small maneuvers before, during or after a major move  could give the United States champion Gracie Gold the boost she needs to reach the Olympic podium.

description: 1939: Vacation Plan to Aid Cinemas

title: Appreciating Skatings Spins, the Art Behind the Sport
description: SOCHI, Russia  Go right ahead with Olympic business as usual and keep obsessing over the jumps as the women compete in the final figure skating event of these Games.

title: Letting Lehman Fail
description: One of the really good things about teaching a new course is that the work you put into developing your lectures often leads you to stuff you didnt know about, missed, or had forgotten. Todays class was a sort of narrative walkthrough of the financial crisis, and in the course of preparing I found myself trying to recall who actually thought letting Lehman fail was a good idea.

title: Two Burches Branch Out with a Chic New Brand
description: Like the mountainous collection of trinkets scattered throughout Pookie Burchs East Village apartment, Trademark, the new womens wear line she started with her younger sister Louisa, is tempting to close-read. The collections influences  Donald Judd, Maine in the 1960s  are apparent but ineffable, abstracted to an obscure likability. The clothes are the product of two self-taught designers who embrace eclecticism without veering into quirk  and whose father just so happens to be the billionaire venture capitalist J. Christopher Burch.

title: Ligety Wins Gold in Giant Slalom
description: Ted Ligety, whose distinctive, hips-on-the-snow turns have redefined giant slalom, won the gold medal with a first run that put him well ahead of the field.

title: Gucci: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Milan

title: Man Pleads Guilty to Reduced Charge in Terrorism Case
description: Five days before his trial was to start, a Manhattan man accused of planning to wage a personal jihad against the United States with pipe bombs pleaded guilty on Wednesday to reduced charges in a deal with prosecutors.

title: Court in Thailand Limits Crackdown on Protesters
description: BANGKOK  Describing the movement to overthrow the Thai government as peaceful, a Bangkok civil court on Wednesday sharply curtailed the powers of the authorities and barred them from dispersing protesters, a decision that a prominent legal analyst described as one step closer to a full-scale judicial coup.

title: Clashes Continue in Ukraine
description: Antigovernment protests in Kiev continued overnight and into the early hours of Wednesday.

title: In West Asheville, N.C., Bistros Mix With Tattoo Parlors
description: Gritty is still an operative description for West Asheville, N.C., a section of this city where pawn shops, tattoo parlors and auto repair shops have reigned. But as Ashevillians move to this side of the French Broad River to escape downtowns escalating rents and tourism, the area has become a blue-collar hybrid with yoga studios and bistros joining longtime establishments along the main drag, Haywood Road. West Asheville has been called the Worst Asheville, said Jodi Rhoden, who owns a bakery, Short Street Cakes. So theres a sense of embattled pride and a determination to make it work.

title: Home-Front Heroines
description: Ten years ago, Cokie Roberts, the political commentator and contributor to National Public Radios Morning Edition, published Founding Mothers: The Women Who Raised Our Nation. Now she has distilled that much longer work about womens roles at the time of the American Revolution to create Founding Mothers: Remembering the Ladies, a picture book intended for children from 7 to 12, engagingly illustrated by Diane Goode.

title: An Awards Night Suited for Royalty
description: LONDON  As the minutes ticked down to the start of the Bafta Awards on Sunday night, Uma Thurman, magisterially dressed in a floor-length, strapless navy blue Atelier Versace gown, had a pressing question for one of the shows organizers: What should we do when Prince William arrives?

title: After an Apology Comes the Rebuilding of Trust
description: Updated, 12:03 p.m. |

title: London Fashion Week: Meadham Kirchhoff Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the London Fashion Week photo diary of Kasia Bobula.

title: Scene City: Glamor Reigns Over Bafta
description: Prince Williams and Stars at the Bafta awards, the British version of the Oscars.

title: F.C.C. Seeks a New Path on Net Neutrality Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Regulators are taking another crack at their effort to keep the web free and open, introducing new rules that would discourage Internet service providers from charging companies to stream their movies, music and other content through a faster express lane.

title: Below the Line: Editing Captain Phillips
description: The film editor Christopher Rouse has built an intimate collaborative relationship with the director Paul Greengrass over the past decade. Their partnership began with The Bourne Supremacy in 2004, and he won an Oscar in 2008 for his editing of The Bourne Ultimatum. Hes up for another Oscar for his work on Captain Phillips, based on the hijacking of an American container ship by Somali pirates. Whether Mr. Rouse is editing fiction features or ones based on true events (United 93), he is driven by the characters motivations.

title: The Audi S3 Cabriolet is Sporty, but Is Not Headed for U.S.
description: Audi released details Wednesday about its S3 Cabriolet, which will be equipped with a 300-horsepower turbocharged 2-liter 4 cylinder engine. The car is expected to hit dealerships during the summer.

title: When Work Disappears
description: At the risk of exhausting my readers, I wanted to return yet again to the debate over workforce participation, because a couple of recent pieces that arent directly about the recent Obamacare argument have been helpful in clarifying the deeper issues in play.The first one is from Martin Wolf of the Financial Times, a sensible man of the center-left, making recommendations for how the developed world might adapt to automation, computerization and the disappearance of low-wage, low-skilled work:

title: Repeated Good Fortune in Timing of C.E.O.s Stock Sale
description: This is the story of a company and its fortunate chief executive.

title: Classical Playlist: Jenny Lin, Joshua Rubin, David Aladashvili and More
description: STRAVINSKY: Solo Piano WorksJenny Lin, pianist(Steinway & Sons)Stravinsky may not have written that many works for solo piano. But he left pianists some astonishing scores, especially the Piano Sonata and the Serenade in A, along with many smart shorter works and charming miniatures. The excellent and inquisitive American pianist Jenny Lin, born in Taiwan in 1973, plays just about the complete Stravinsky solo piano music on this impressive release, from Steinway & Sons, which some years ago started a recording label. (Anthony Tommasini)

title: Immigrants Welcome Here
description: Earlier this month, John Boehner declared that it was unlikely that the House of Representatives would pass major immigration reform legislation this year. Given the desperate need for an overhaul of the system, the political gridlock is dismaying. But thankfully its not the whole immigration story.

title: A Content Company Weighs Becoming a Technology Company
description: TPR MEDIA creates and distributes medical-related messages and information to patients. Co-founded by Betsy Weaver in 2002, the company, which is based in Boston and has 20 employees, helps hospitals reduce the number of calls doctors receive from patients and keeps people informed of what to expect on their medical journeys.

title: The Lady Reappears
description: Nina Arianda made one of the more arresting New York stage debuts of the past decade portraying an actress with a will to power in the dark, sexy Venus in Fur.

title: Documentary on the Rapper Nas Will Open Tribeca Film Festival
description: The Tribeca Film Festival is bringing more hip-hop to the big screen. Time Is Illmatic, a documentary on the rapper Nas, will open this years festival, organizers announced Wednesday.

title: Detention of Snowden Journalists Partner by British Is Upheld
description: LONDON  The partner of Glenn Greenwald, the journalist who published information leaked by the former National Security Agency contractor Edward J. Snowden, lost his legal challenge on Wednesday over his nine-hour detention at Londons Heathrow Airport last August under counterterrorism laws. Mr. Greenwalds partner, David Michael Miranda, was stopped while in transit from Germany to Brazil and was told he was being detained under Section 7 of the British Terrorism Act.

title: A Look at the Shills, Skeptics and Hobbyists Lumped Together in Climate Denialism
description: In his contribution to the recent discussion of Secretary of State John Kerrys speech on global warming, David Victor of the University of California, San Diego, included this line:

description: Updates on the unrest in Ukraine. Also on the Minute, Neil Patrick Harris's Broadway transformation and the genetics of daredevils.

title: Can a Content Company Become a Tech Company?
description: We just published a case study about the owner of a company that delivers health care-related messages to patients via email and is faced with some big decisions. When Betsy Weaver started TPR Media in Boston in 2002, she was working with hospital maternity divisions to send emails to patients that explained what they needed to bring to the hospital, what medications to take, what happens after they see the doctor and more. Her service allowed physicians to cut down on the many patient phone calls they had been receiving.

title: Aides Emails Provide Detailed Look at Wisconsins Governor
description: Even as Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin looks ahead to 2016 and a possible presidential bid, his political past as Milwaukee County executive has come back to haunt him.

title: The Loyal Users of Google Plus Say It Is No Ghost Town
description: A front-page article last weekend called Google Plus a ghost town. Since then, dozens of the very passionate ghosts who hang out there have let me know that, in fact, it is a lively, conversation-filled place that is unlike any other Internet social network.

title: One Banksy Sells in Miami; Two Works From New York Do Not
description: Kissing Coppers, a mural by the British street artist Banksy, sold for $575,000 (including fees) on Tuesday, at an auction of graffiti-style art in Miami that failed to draw expected prices for three Banksy works.

Despair Is Looking Up
description: Real simple, the photographer instructed. No expression.

title: Today in Small Business: The Minimum Wage Debate Continues
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

description: Ted Ligety won the mens giant slalom and the Russian hockey team made an early exit on Day 14 of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia.

title: Morgan Stanley Chief Discloses Stock Gift
description: James P. Gorman, the chief executive of Morgan Stanley, gave away nearly $1 million worth of stock he owned in the bank last week.

title: How Tina Fey and Amy Poehler Inspired a Disney Princess
description: The Disney hit Frozen, considered a near-lock to win the best animation Oscar, was not always the story of two feuding but loving sisters.

title: CeeLo Green to Leave The Voice
description: The Voice has seen the last of CeeLo Green  at least as a regular coach on the hit NBC singing contest.

title: Preparing to Retire, Jeter Prefers to Discuss Work
description: TAMPA, Fla.  All but one person expected it to be a grand show, a well-attended farewell announcement for a revered sports figure, perhaps even ending in tears. But that one person was sitting behind the microphone, answering questions as if he were discussing just another Wednesday game in Cleveland or Chicago.

title: Russian Protest Group Members Assaulted
description: While performing under a sign advertising the Sochi Olympics, members of Pussy Riot, along with their supporters, were attacked by Cossack militia members with horsewhips Wednesday.

title: Members of Russian Protest Group Attacked by Cossacks in Sochi
description: SOCHI, Russia  Activist members of the protest group Pussy Riot were attacked in downtown Sochi on Wednesday by plainclothes police officers using an irritant spray and by Cossacks brandishing horsewhips.

title: Weight Gain and Older Women
description: Michelle Obama has done an excellent job mobilizing the nation to combat childhood obesity and encouraging kids to eat better and move more. But now her efforts may be needed on another front.

title: Wheelies: The Clearing Out James Bonds Garage Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Silver Is the Winter Color for a Summer Gold Medalist
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Lauryn Williams is not certain where her Olympic track medals are  she thinks the silver from the 2004 Olympics may be at her mothers house  so it was not hard to believe her on Wednesday night when she said that missing history by a measly tenth of a second was not especially disappointing.

title: Thin-Skinned Spies
description: Dan McCall, operator of the website Liberty Maniacs, uses the National Security Agency seal on T-shirts and mugs that say Spying on you since 1952 and The only part of government that actually listens. He also sells merchandise with a Department of Homeland Stupidity logo.

title: The Gun Report: February 19, 2014
description: About 60 more people than usual have been murdered with firearms each year since Missouri got rid of background checks for gun sales in 2007, according to a new study by the Johns Hopkins Center for Gun Policy and Research. The state has seen a 23 percent increase in firearm homicide rates, even as the murder rate dropped 5 percent nationally. The rise in murders occurred only for those involving a firearm.

title: Nerd Factor Aside, Bluetooth Headsets Are Useful on the Go
description: After about an hour of getting odd looks from co-workers, I felt compelled to explain myself. The Jawbone Era headset sticking out of my right ear, I said, was for this review.

title: Video From Kiev and Images of Violence in Other Ukrainian Cities
description: Updated, 4:10 p.m. | As my colleagues Andrew Higgins and Andrew Kramer report from Kiev, a violent standoff between protesters and the riot police continued on Wednesday in the center of the Ukrainian capital.

title: Harding-Kerrigan Rivalry, by Way of RuPauls Drag Race
description: With the world watching the Olympians in Sochi, television isnt skipping a beat in reviving another Winter Games story, the 20th anniversary of the Tonya Harding-Nancy Kerrigan rivalry.

title: New York State in Deal to Limit Solitary Confinement
description: New York State has agreed to sweeping reforms intended to curtail the widespread use of solitary confinement, including prohibiting its use in disciplining prisoners under 18.

title: Gucci: 60s Without the Sex
description: MILAN  What excitement at Gucci! Smartphones were waved deliriously, photographers fought for position and, above the melee, a black cap peeked out as if there were a soldier on parade.

title: Undeterred, Fed on Track to Temper Its Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  When Federal Reserve officials last met at the end of January, they were surprised by the strength of the economy, cheered by the optimism of consumers and convinced they should continue to dismantle the Feds economic stimulus campaign, according to an account the Fed released Wednesday.

title: Google Offers a Guide to Not Being a Creepy Google Glass Owner
description: Google is finally realizing what the rest of the world has known for some time: People who wear Google Glass can sometimes be creepy or rude.

title: London Fashion Week Street Style Wrap-Up
description: In the courtyard of Somerset House and the surrounding streets, for many the heart of London Fashion Week, all day long fashion enthusiasts, bloggers, students gather.
