description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Filippo Mutani.

title: If Acne Doesnt Bother My Son, Why Should It Bother Me?
description: My 15-year-old son doesnt care about his acne. This astonishes me. How could acne not ruin his life? When I was his age I thought it had ruined mine.

title: Celebrating a Building That Has Stood for Decades as a Symbol of the Press
description: The exhibition occurs within the genteel precincts of the Grolier Club on the Upper East Side. But the principal object is a muscular industrial fortress almost three miles downtown.

title: The Tall-Order Rental
description: In California, where they used to live, Beatrice Gomberg and Ray Barba had no trouble finding housing. We got offered every apartment we could have possibly wanted, Ms. Gomberg said.

title: Where Timelessness Meets Time Travel
description: With a head full of blond curls, and wearing a glittery blouse, Nellie McKay flounced into Caf Carlyle on Tuesday evening, ushering a gust of downtown freshness into this elegant uptown precinct. Ms. McKay, 31, has been a presence on the cultural scene for at least a decade. But she still wears the mystique of a willful prodigy who is smarter, more talented and hipper than everyone else: a performer who answers only to herself. Gifts that others spend years refining seem to come naturally to her.

title: Harper Lee Settles Lawsuit With Museum
description: Harper Lee, the author of To Kill a Mockingbird, is settling a lawsuit filed last year against a museum in her Alabama hometown claiming that it had sold merchandise featuring her name and the title of her novel without compensation.

title: House Hunting ... Outside Paris
description: A DUPLEX PENTHOUSE IN NEUILLY-SUR-SEINE

title: The Auditing Roadblock: Its Not Just China
description: The Public Company Accounting Oversight Board is out with a list of 58 international audit firms that it has been unable to inspect for at least four years. Those firms all audited companies registered in the United States, and  under American law  must be inspected by the board. The board has tried to arrange joint inspections with regulators from other countries, but a variety of impediments have arisen.

title: Lucks on Their Side, but Americans Dont Need It in Rout
description: SOCHI, Russia  The bounces seemed to go the Americans way on Wednesday.

title: A Case That Lets You Be the Designer
description: With a sea of device accessories designed by other people, one company, Caseable, is turning the tables and letting you be the designer.

title: Port Authority Official Deeply Sorry for Closed Lanes
description: Amid unyielding scrutiny into the role of Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey and his administration in the lane closings at the George Washington Bridge, a top official of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey apologized on Wednesday to the commuters who sat in manufactured traffic over the course of several days in September.

title: Still Life in Motion From a Road Trip Across South America
description: David Guttenfelder captures scenes along the Interoceanic Highway.

title: A Bloody Night in Cres
description: Not long ago, I spent a month with Aniza and Dinko Muskardin, residents of the Croatian island of Cres, enjoying their emphatic Balkan hospitality in exchange for a few weeks help around their farm. I was besotted by my elderly hosts. I helped Dinko cut oak and juniper, search the hills for lost sheep and bottle the evil-smelling yellow wine that he aged in a cracked, slimy barrel. I was so besotted, in fact, that I didnt hesitate when my host said to me, with an ominous gleam in his eyes, that it was time to kill the year-old pecorina. (Dinko was old enough to remember the Mussolini era, and we spoke in a pidgin of Italian.)

title: A Busmans Honeymoon
description: I had been cooking avidly for six years when, in the fall of 1976, thinking it was important to learn about French and Northern Italian, I flew to Rome with my new wife to begin what we called a sort of honeymoon.

title: Wet Hot Israeli Summer
description: In 1990, just before Saddam Hussein began lobbing Scud missiles at Tel Aviv and Haifa, my father and I paid our first visit to Israel. The men in my family can be adventurous: Before he emigrated from the Soviet Union, my father had taken to marching outside Leningrads Grand Choral Synagogue chanting: We! Are! Jews! with a group of fellow believers, a beautiful and lunatic gesture under an increasingly anti-Semitic regime. Likewise, the looming threat of Iraqi Scuds made us giddy at the thought of floating in the Dead Sea hoisting copies of The International Herald Tribune with its daily war cries by Saddams ever-present little buddy, Foreign Minister Tariq Aziz.

title: In the Company of Truckers
description: One summer in the late 1990s, I was driving across the country on Interstate 80, having just stopped to visit some friends in Des Moines. I was behind the wheel of a 1963 Chevrolet Impala I bought outside Asheville, N.C. The car ran well and was beautiful  champagne body with a cream top, no dents, no rust. It still even had these original plastic discs, like thin translucent washers, that fit between the window roller and the door panel to keep the upholstery from being indented or pinched. I was planning to sell it in Los Angeles, where a 63 two-door Impala in such cherry condition was the ultimate low rider and worth a lot of money.

title: We Were About Half a Mile From Shore, Naked and Drunk to a Man
description: On a sticky day in late June 2003, I was walking down West 16th Street in New York feeling sorry for myself  the only person in a city of eight million without Fourth of July plans  when I ran into a beautiful and sophisticated woman I slightly knew. She was sitting on a stoop with an equally glamorous friend, drinking iced coffee. She had been meaning to call me. She knew it was late notice, but she wondered if by any chance I was free for a party at a friends compound  compound!  in the Hamptons that weekend. Oh, um, well . . . yes.

title: The Braveheart Fantasy
description: Years ago, two friends and I rented a car and drove through the Scottish Highlands, stopping at bed-and-breakfasts and drinking whisky. The rental car had only a CD player, and one of the few CDs we had was the soundtrack to Braveheart, which Id brought with me as kind of a joke. (I say kind of a joke because I dont want you to think Im the type of person who brings the Braveheart soundtrack on a trip to Scotland. But I am.)

title: 5 Books to Take on Your Travels
description: 1. The Moronic Inferno: And Other Visits to America, by Martin Amis (1987)

title: Traveling From Ocean to Ocean Across South America
description: Before the passengers turned on the driver and began plotting a mutiny, the ride was smooth. The bus rolled out of the station in So Paulo at about 4 oclock on a Wednesday afternoon last July, and within an hour it had shaken free of the citys clotted tunnels, jammed overpasses and coded graffiti. By 6, we were barreling straight into a lurid sunset that endowed everything with the candied luster of fresh paint. Green hills, silver ponds, golden palms. Two parrots soared in tandem over a sugar-cane field, inviting us to drift into a pastoral trance.

title: An Instagram Travel Diary
description: Ive been to 55 places in the past year. I pick a spot and some dates, and then whoever wants to come can come, even if I dont know them that well. I look for naturally beautiful spots that Ive never been to before. There was a phase last summer when it was only swimming holes in upstate New York. And then after that, I wanted to go only to places with the biggest, weirdest rocks. Two specific memories come to mind from the past year: one is sleeping on a boat deck with my brothers under what felt like the darkest sky with the brightest stars in the Andaman Sea off Myanmar. And the other is standing with friends at the throat of an eroded volcano in New Mexico called Shiprock, right as the sun was setting on one of the last days of the year. Both places were shockingly beautiful and isolated and contained only a handful of people I really love.

title: A Tour of the Center of the World
description: Just head toward the 21-foot pyramid in the middle of the desert.

title: In Soweto, History From Those Who Live It
description: Three sounds competed to rule the Soweto night, at least as heard from the roof deck of Flossies B&B in Pimville Zone 1: a surround-sound chorus of crickets; the intermittent barking of neighborhood dogs; and cars zooming by on Chris Hani Road two blocks north. The roofs shiny railing arced out like an observation deck, but all there was to observe was the intersection of Dube and Gonsi Streets, a brick house with corrugated metal roof and satellite dish on the corner, other just slightly neater houses beyond.

title: Where the Worlds Greatest Photographers Go to Get Away
description: They may be off the clock, but they still have their cameras.

title: A Journey to the Center of the World
description: One morning in late January, Jacques-Andr Istel woke up at his home in Felicity, Calif., did 100 push-ups and 125 squats, swam in his elegantly lit lap pool, then went back upstairs, where he took a light breakfast in bed, as has been his custom since his boyhood in Paris. After breakfast, he dressed in a blue shirt and ascot and walked to his office at 1 Center of the World Plaza. It was Istels birthday; he was turning 85.

title: From England to the Edge of Africa
description: After graduating from college, Tom Allen searched for an escape from an unfulfilling, deskbound career. A plan to bike through a few countries snowballed into a four-year trip through 32 countries, from his home in England through Europe, the Middle East and down the northeastern edge of Africa.

title: Alberta Ferretti: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Milan

title: A Creativity Conference at the Cloister
description: The Cloister at Sea Island in Georgia has taken a cue from the popular TED series and will produce its own speakers event, the Creativity Conference, which organizers hope will become an annual attraction.

title: Nets Add a Guard and Pick Up a Victory
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Before the resumption of a wilting title chase came a minor retooling.

title: Signet and Zale Deal Casts 2 Other Deals in a Poor Light
description: Leave it to a couple of diamond dealers to show how to make mergers and acquisitions sparkle. The stock of the jewelry retailer Signet rose after it agreed to buy its smaller rival Zale at a 41 percent premium for an enterprise value, which includes debt, of $1.4 billion. Thats what happens when the cost savings effectively cover the purchase price. It makes the shareholder-unfriendly transactions involving Comcast and Jos. A. Bank all the more noticeable.

title: N 21: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Milan

title: Kim Seizes Lead; Then the Surprises Start
description: SOCHI, Russia  Her choice of music for Wednesdays short program, Send In the Clowns, might have suggested departure and regret instead of victory for Kim Yu-na of South Korea, the defending Olympic womens figure skating champion.

title: Lawmaker Urges U.S. Regulators to Scrutinize Mortgage Servicers
description: Representative Maxine Waters of California is urging federal banking regulators to scrutinize the sale of billions of dollars of mortgage-servicing rights to a fleet of specialty firms, a move that comes amid mounting concerns that some of the most vulnerable homeowners are facing fresh abuses in battles to save their homes.

title: Agreement Regarding Solitary Confinement
description: Read the full agreement regarding the decision to bar the use of solitary confinement for disciplining prisoners under 18.

title: Eric Church Hits No. 1
description: Eric Church, a country singer with a taste for big rock n roll riffs, opened at No. 1 on Billboards album chart with his latest release, The Outsiders (EMI Nashville). The album, his second to reach the top, sold 288,000 copies in the United States, according to Nielsen SoundScan.

title: Escape Plan: It Starts With the Dress
description: Bone-chilling temperatures, snow  and lets not even talk about the treacherous black ice. No one needs to tell us its time for an escape. A few personal days and an inexpensive ticket, and youre in a warm place. Heres what to take with you.

title: Elodia Prieto Transforms Backstage at Alberta Ferretti
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in Milan. Here, the model Elodia Prieto (left) and after (right) makeup by Lloyd Simmons and hair by Guido Palau.

title: A Freshman Representative Sizes Up Congress
description: Representative Gloria Negrete McLeod of California required less than a full term in the House to size up the place and decide it was better to go back home and run for a seat on the San Bernardino County Board of Supervisors. I doubt she regretted her choice when the fellow Democrat she had defeated in 2012, former Representative Joe Baca, denounced her as some bimbo for quitting.

title: Two Authors Ask Indian Publisher to Pulp Their Books
description: Penguin India drew strong criticism from authors earlier this month after it decided to withdraw and pulp the scholar Wendy Donigers book The Hindus: An Alternative History, thus ending a four-year legal battle with Hindu nationalists who argued the book violated Indian laws against giving religious offense.

title: Tony Blair Emerges as Figure in Tabloid Hacking Case
description: LONDON  Tony Blair is the latest high-profile person to surface in the British phone hacking trial, a high-stakes criminal prosecution of shadowy practices at Rupert Murdochs tabloid The News of the World.

title: Bill in Albany to Allow Lawsuits by Those Who Falsely Confess
description: The New York State attorney general proposed legislation on Wednesday that would allow people who have confessed or pleaded guilty to a crime they did not commit to sue the state for damages.

title: Fausto Puglisi: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Milan

title: Prison Ship Sets Sail With a Rebel on Board
description: Bound for Australia, the prison ship is packed with Irishwomen brought aboard in chains.

title: Winklevoss Brothers Offer an Index to Track Price of Bitcoin
description: Updated, 11:03 p.m. | Stock traders have the Standard & Poors 500. Bitcoin bettors will have the Winkdex.

title: Passage to Midlife on Broken Pavement
description: Bark, the title of Lorrie Moores disappointing new collection of stories, seems to refer to several things at once: the yelp of a dog, the peeling garb of a tree and the process of debarking from a plane. Each meaning can be taken to allude to the animal fact of human mortality, and the experience of loss and departure that marks the human condition. The multiple meanings also underscore Ms. Moores love of wordplay and puns  her hyper-awareness of language and her attunement to what one character calls the missingness of life.

title: Pushing Back Against Government Surveillance
description: As Edward J. Snowdens revelations of the extent of spying by the United States National Security Agency roiled the world last June, Xie Yanyi, a Beijing lawyer, asked the Ministry of Public Security to tell him about Chinese security officials spying on their own citizens, especially regarding online and telephone communications.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Lebanon, Thailand and India.

title: Self-Examination for All to See and Hear
description: We are all in the constant process of creating, refining or redefining our identities. Today, it has become practically a full-time job, as social networks spread like kudzu, and people spend countless hours considering how best to present themselves to the watching world. Who do you think you are? The question has become ever more pressing and ever more public: I Instagram, therefore I am.

title: Those Brand-Name Musicals
description: Back in the days of vaudeville  or to be precise, a 1959 musicals version of vaudeville  a wise old stripper delivered some immortal advice for anyone starting out in showbiz: You gotta have a gimmick, if you wanna have a chance. Thus spake the trumpet-tooting Mazeppa, addressing the title character of Gypsy.

title: Indian State to Free 7 Convicted in Rajiv Gandhi Assassination Plot
description: MUMBAI, India  The chief minister of Tamil Nadu said Wednesday that her government would free six men and one woman who were convicted of plotting the 1991 assassination of Rajiv Gandhi, the former prime minister of India.

title: Sochi Video Notebook: Ted Ligety
description: The American skier talked about not winning a medal at the 2010 Vancouver Olympics and winning a gold in the giant slalom on Wednesday.

title: Gucci  Go-Go
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: The Corcoran Gallery of Art May Cede Control of Its Collection
description: Facing mounting debts, a shrinking endowment and tens of millions of dollars in renovations, the long-struggling Corcoran Gallery of Art in Washington is exploring a plan to give up its independence as the oldest privately supported art museum in the nation to form a partnership with the National Gallery of Art and George Washington University.

title: Talent You Wont Forget
description: Helne Yorke

title: Zale Deal Highlights Private Equity Firms Unconventional Strategy
description: The jewelery retailer Zale was in a bind in 2010. Its sales were flagging in the recession, and stock market investors were turning their backs on the company.

title: Slam Swing at a Qualifier for Grand National Teams
description: The final stage of the Grand National Teams will take place in Las Vegas in July, at the start of the Summer North American Championships.

title: ScienceTake: Flying Snakes
description: An airborne serpent can be the stuff of nightmares or a delicious aerodynamic puzzle.

title: 'She Lit a Fire'
description: A new music video by Lord Huron.

title: Slithering Through the Air With the Greatest of Ease
description: Some people might view a snake that can launch itself from trees and glide through the air as their worst nightmare, something to be avoided, proof positive that human beings were not meant to venture out of doors.

title: And Surrogacy Makes 3
description: A month before their babys due date, Brad Hoylman and David Sigal got a call from the woman they had hired to have their child.

title: A New York Chefs Home-Cooking Essentials
description: Camille Becerra is no stranger to departures and homecomings. We actually lived here before, the chef and food stylist says, waving around her sun-filled TriBeCa loft. That day the towers went down, we physically left, she says of Sept. 11, which prompted her to flee with her then six-month-old daughter to the Brooklyn neighborhood of Greenpoint, where they lived for seven years. During that period in her new neighborhood, Becerra opened Paloma, a restaurant housed in a converted parking garage, which she named after her daughter. In 2008 the restaurant burned down, and Becerra returned to her beloved loft in Manhattan.

title: Derek Jeter Keeps His Cool, but His Outlook Has Changed
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Control was the defining issue. If he could ward off distractions, if he could make it all about the ball, the glove and his opportunistic bat, baseball would forever be the little boys game even when it was being played for riches once beyond his imagination.

title: Jimmy Fallons Audience Stays Large, but Where Will It Settle?
description: The falloff was predictable for Night 2 of The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon  down to 7.3 million viewers from 11.3 million viewers for his premiere on Monday.

title: Russian Riot Grrrls Beaten but Not Arrested in Sochi
description: There were signs of confusion in the official response to a new performance by the Russian protest group Pussy Riot on Wednesday in Sochi, as the activists were first set upon by Cossack militiamen and beaten with whips and pepper spray, but then allowed to retrieve their guitar from a trash can and leave without being arrested.

title: Forget the Fantasy, Keep It Friendly
description: The basement of the Palais de Tokyo was staged like a snowbound park at twilight. Lampposts glowed faintly throughout the sea of white. This winter wonderland during the rainy mens fashion shows in Paris last month was courtesy of Alexandre Mattiussi, the designer of the nascent label Ami.

title: Sic Transit New Jersey
description: After more than four years on the job and three massive foul-ups on his watch, James Weinstein is resigning as executive director of New Jersey Transit. Gov. Chris Christie has already announced his replacement, and we can only hope that Veronique Hakim, head of the states thruway authority,is independent-minded enough to worry first and foremost about commuters.

title: Facebook Enters $16 Billion Deal for WhatsApp
description: The frenzy to acquire fast-growing technology start-ups reached new heights on Wednesday as Facebook announced its largest acquisition ever, saying it would pay at least $16 billion for WhatsApp, a text messaging application with 450 million users around the world who pay little or no money for it.

title: Excerpts as Obama Signs the Farm Bill
description: President Obama on Friday signed the $956 billion farm bill into law. It replaces direct crop payments to farmers with an insurance program, and trims the food stamp program.

title: A Star From Norway Stands Alone
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  His tie with his countryman Bjorn Daehlie was broken, and Ole Einar Bjorndalen was posing for group photographs.

title: Obama Reacts to Unrest in Ukraine
description: President Obama commented on the continuing violence in Ukraine.

title: Safeway Says It Is Exploring a Sale
description: Shares of Safeway climbed in after-market trading on Wednesday after the supermarket chain disclosed that it was in discussions concerning a possible transaction involving the sale of the company.

title: Study Finds Drops Are Best Treatment for Ear Tube-Related Dripping
description: For children with ear tubes, topical antibiotic drops treat the leaky discharge caused by an ear infection much more effectively than oral antibiotics or observation, according to a study published in The New England Journal of Medicine on Wednesday.

title: James Patterson Giving Cash to Bookstores
description: Independent bookstores, with their paper-thin profit margins and competition from Amazon, have found themselves a Daddy Warbucks.

title: To Be Young in a Vienna Thats Headed Nowhere Good
description: Consider Desiree, a Viennese medical student in 1923: Young, sexually knowing and effortlessly good at her studies, she seems at first blush like a wunderkind in a red slip. But to Desiree, the future looks bleak. Bourgeois existence or suicide, she says, there are no other choices.

title: 350,000 Ways to Harness Energy From the Sun
Her Blog, Her Brand
description: On her popular blog, Maskcara.com, Cara Brook, 28, sings the praises of highlighting and contouring ones facial features, a process she refers to as HACing (pronounced hacking). She gleaned the technique, in which a color a few shades darker than the skin is used to create shadows on the edges and in the hollows of the face while a slightly lighter one plays up the high planes of the cheekbones, nose, forehead and chin, from books by the makeup artist Kevyn Aucoin, which she pored over as a teenager obsessed with the beauty business. Its a magical thing, she effused in a how-to video.

title: Derek Jeter Talks Retirement
description: The New York Yankees Derek Jeter held a news conference Wednesday to discuss his retirement at the end of the 2014 season.

title: Events and Sales Starting the Week of Feb. 20
description: Sales

title: The Nominees Are Blockbusters
description: The story in Frozen, the blockbuster Disney musical, did not originally center on two sister princesses. Based loosely on The Snow Queen fairy tale, it always had a pair of girls at its core, but it wasnt until several years into the production process, at a story meeting in the companys Burbank, Calif., headquarters, that someone suggested that Elsa and Anna be siblings.

title: This Phone Is Great, Till Its Time to Add Apps
description: If the tech business were fair, you would be considering the Nokia Icon for your next smartphone.

title: Selected Emails Released in Wisconsin
description: Thousands of pages of email messages were released on Wednesday in connection with a secret criminal investigation into whether campaigning had been conducted on government time in a county office once led by Scott Walker, now the governor of Wisconsin. These are just a handful.

title: An Invitation to Revel in Their Claim to History
description: WE WERE TALKING about getting older, Diane von Furstenberg said not long ago as she reminisced about a conversation she had shared over lunch with Anna Wintour. What are a few furrows and frown lines? Ms. Wintour said blithely. Were legends, you know.

title: Milan Fashion Week: N21 Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Founder of Citadel Pledges $150 Million to Harvard, Its Largest Gift Ever
description: Updated, 8:32 p.m. | When the billionaire hedge fund manager Kenneth C. Griffin was a sophomore at Harvard, he was betting on convertible bonds in his dorm room  thanks to a satellite dish he had hooked up on the roof  while his fellow students were going to classes.

title: A Mexican Showcase for Ambition
description: MEXICO CITY  Churning and wired, this city is a place of many devotions. Some of them revolve around art. Worshipers throng the Seora de Guadalupe shrine to gaze on a miraculous painting of the Virgin. Secular pilgrims on the hunt for saints crowd Casa Azul, The Blue House, Frida Kahlos home. Every tourist makes a must-see stop at the National Museum of Anthropology with its hair-raising sculptures of Aztec gods.

title: Times Minute | Fairness in Web Access
description: In the Video

title: Times Minute | News on Internet Access
description: Also on the Minute, changes to New York State's prison system and tight competition for the bronze in the ladies figure skating short program.

title: Advisers on Facebook Deal Could Earn More Than $80 Million
description: The two advisers who helped Facebook make its largest acquisition to date stand to earn tens of millions of dollars for their work.

title: Meet Lord Huron, a Musical Project That Is Also an Alternate Reality Game
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Ask Ben Schneider to name the inspiration for his band, Lord Huron, and he will name George Ranger Johnson, one of the more prolific Western adventure novelists youve never heard of.

title: L.B.J. and the Shadow of Vietnam
In Womens Figure Skating, Kim Carves Slim Lead for Gold Medal
description: The short program on Wednesday set up an unpredictable race for the Olympic gold medal in womens figure skating.

title: Makeup That Can Enliven Winter Skin
description: With the tan now a beauty boogeyman, some consumers are looking for different ways to enliven winter-dulled skin. Enter the illuminator, several new versions of which have come to market recently.

title: Which Is Better, Shower Curtain or Glass Door?
description: Q. I want my shower to look as high-end as possible, but Im on a budget: Which is better, shower curtain or glass door?

title: Preindustrial Design Meets Politics
description: Prima Materia, which opened this week at the Stedelijk Museums-Hertogenbosch in the Netherlands, is the first retrospective of the work of Studio Formafantasma, the partnership of Simone Farresin and Andrea Trimarchi.

title: A Treasure Trove of Wood-Block Prints
description: Though the technique of printing fabrics with wood blocks is ancient, Western Europeans adopted it only a few hundred years ago. Zucchi, an Italian textiles manufacturer, has amassed a collection of some 56,000 examples from 1785 to 1935, and has created a museum for them in Rescaldina, near Milan. Now the company has dipped into this trove to create a line of bedding, table linens, throws and area rugs.

title: Whatever Floats Your Soap
description: It looks like a teak salad bowl and costs as much as a new Honda. The Salish Sea is a wood bathtub by Seth Rolland, a furniture maker in Washington State. I live in Port Townsend, the wooden-boat-building capital of the West Coast, he said. He started building boats, but switched to furniture because it offered more artistic license. A table has to have a flat surface and be about 28 inches high, he said. After that, everything is open. Making the tub, for a client in Tennessee, involved 200 pieces of sustainable sapele wood, glued with epoxy, hand sanded, then waterproofed by a local wood kayak maker with layers of epoxy over an invisible fiberglass lining, on top of which went six coats of varnish. Shown above, it is 85 inches long and 36 inches deep. Prices start at $28,000. Information: sethrolland.com or 360-379-0414.

title: Paper Furnishings
description: Luca Nichetto is an Italian designer who grew up professionally among the glassmaking studios of Murano. These days, however, he often finds himself inspired by a humbler medium.

title: What Goes Beep in the Night
description: Machines that insinuate themselves into their surroundings, quietly monitoring your behavior, may be worrying, but as far as Im concerned, those that bombard you with reminders of their presence are more disturbing.

title: Some Bot to Watch Over Me
description: For a month now, I have been spying on my apartment.

title: If Its Icky, She Has the Solution
description: For a generation overwhelmed not just by dust bunnies, but by bong water on the carpet, pee stains on the ceiling and vomit seemingly everywhere, Jolie Kerr, 37, dispenses cleaning advice free of judgment. Writing first on The Hairpin, The Awls girlish sister blog, and now on Jezebel and Deadspin, Ms. Kerr gently cautions her readers to beware of their handbags, noting that researchers have found that the stuff banging around inside carries more bacteria than most toilet seats. But microbes are not the worst Coach-invader.

title: Sales at Company C, Module R and Mondo Collection
description: Discontinued rugs, pillows and bedding are 60 percent off at Company C, while supplies last (the Chevron Julep ColorSpree pillow, usually $65, is $26; a 5-by-8-foot Hyannisport aqua ColorSpree rug, usually $395, is $158; the Gidget multi pillow, usually $125, is $50); 800-818-8288, companyc.com.

title: Small World, Big Idea
description: OLYMPIA, Wash.  On Christmas Eve, Kevin Johnson received the following gifts: a bed and mattress, a blanket and sheets, a desk and chair, a toilet and sink, towels and washcloths, toothpaste and floss, and a brand-new house.

title: As Obama Vows to Act on Climate Change, Justices Weigh His Approach
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama in recent days has been announcing muscular executive actions to address climate change, making good on his promise to act on pressing problems with or without Congress. On Monday, the Supreme Court will consider the limits of that approach, in a case on greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Strikes and Spare Wood
description: Jim Malone, the owner of CounterEvolution, a Brooklyn company that makes furniture out of wood reclaimed from bowling lanes, discovered the material while sourcing kitchen countertops several years ago and has used it in his tables and slat-back chairs ever since. He began by selling pieces at the Brooklyn Flea and now produces furniture for Shake Shack and Starbucks; recently, the company opened a Manhattan showroom.

title: Securing Your Phone
description: Molly Wood recommends a few apps that will help you secure your smartphone communications.

title: A Plea From Ukraine
Banned in India
description: To the Editor:

title: Foster Care and Prostitution
description: To the Editor:

title: Stray Voltage Temporarily Electrifies Block in Chelsea
description: This winter, New Yorkers have been told time and again to look down and watch their step. And they have been told to look up for snow and ice tumbling from towering buildings.

title: Medical Marijuana
description: To the Editor:

title: Privacy Please: Tools to Shield Your Smartphone
description: Heres a thought: Maybe its O.K. to care about your privacy even if you have nothing to hide.

title: A Closetful of Memories
description: To the Editor:

title: Promoting Health With Enticing Photos of Fruits and Vegetables
description: Pity the poor beet.

title: Disneys Frozen Kingdom
description: Melena Ryzik explores the Disney animation studios and speaks with the creators of the Oscar-nominated film Frozen.

title: Facebooks Deal for WhatsApp: The Chatter on Twitter
description: Facebook made a huge splash in the tech world on Wednesday with a $16 billion deal to buy WhatsApp, a messaging start-up  the social media giants biggest acquisition by far.

title: Denver Museum Returns Artifacts to Kenyan Government
description: Museums hoping to return stolen cultural items to indigenous tribes that may have lost them generations ago often say they are stymied by the difficulty of identifying a rightful owner to take legal custody of the objects. But on Wednesday, one museum, the Denver Museum of Nature and Science, with a large collection of East African spiritual carvings known as vigango, resolved that problem by returning 30 of the artifacts to the Kenyan government.

title: For Super Bowl, Familiar Ads And Star Endorsements
description: AFTER each Super Bowl, there are lingering questions about the 50 or more commercials that viewers watched during the game on what is typically the biggest day of the year for advertising as well as for football. (This year, it was certainly the biggest day for television with a record average audience of 112.2 million viewers.) What follows are answers to questions about some spots in Super Bowl XLVIII.

title: Why Actors Act Out
description: THE recent erratic behavior of Shia LaBeouf, the 27-year-old actor best known as the star of the Transformers movies, has sent the press into a feeding frenzy. Though the wisdom of some of his actions may seem questionable, as an actor and artist Im inclined to take an empathetic view of his conduct.

title: Embracing Sticker Shock
description: Adhesive images covering two neighboring homes in Los Angeles offer privacy, and stop traffic, too.

title: The Power of Sticker Shock
description: The idea of wrapping a house in giant graphic stickers, like the ones used for ads on city buses, appealed to Eric Chu the moment his architect suggested it.

title: The Sochi Olympics, Frame by Frame
description: See the Winter Games in a series of composite images.

title: Edmunds, 15-Year-Old American Figure Skater, Is Still in Sight of Podium Finish
description: SOCHI, Russia  Its hard enough to be a 15-year-old girl.

title: Start-Up Site Hires Critic of Wall St.
description: Matt Taibbi, who made a name as a fierce critic of Wall Street at Rolling Stone magazine, has joined First Look Media, the latest big-name journalist to leave an established brand to enter the thriving and well-financed world of news start-ups.

title: Google Fiber, Ultrahigh-Speed Internet, May Expand to 34 New Cities
description: Google is taking steps to expand Google Fiber, its nascent ultrahigh-speed Internet service, to 34 cities in nine metropolitan areas across the country as it grapples with the challenges of working with local governments.

title: Russians Hockey Elimination Prompts Anger and Dismay
description: SOCHI, Russia  For the home-country fans here celebrating the first Winter Games on Russian soil, there could be no bigger debacle than failing to win a medal in hockey, the nations most popular sport.

title: Global Bond Frenzy Raises Concerns
description: Prospecting for oil in Brazil, manufacturing steel in Russia, erecting skyscrapers in China: Global bond investors have financed some of the grandest investment projects taken on by emerging economies in recent years.

title: Law and Politics
description: I first read about Robert A. Dahls death earlier this month in the Yale Daily News. Why would the editors of a student newspaper publish a Page 1 obituary of a 98-year-old political science professor who had retired from teaching well before any of todays undergraduates were born?

title: Year in Prison for Ex-Guard Who Had Child With Inmate
description: Nancy Gonzalez, the former correction officer who was impregnated by an inmate who was twice sentenced to the federal death penalty, was sentenced to a year and a day in prison on Wednesday for her role in the illicit relationship.

title: Hard Times Leave Some Greek Car Owners With Nothing but Rust
description: ATHENS  No longer able to pay for gas, Giannis Zgourakis parked his prized BMW on the street near his home and turned to a motorcycle. That was more than a year ago. Now, the car sits there a forlorn wreck, its battery dead, its tires ruined.

title: Bank of Americas Chief Receives $12.5 Million in Stock
description: Brian T. Moynihan, the chief executive of Bank of America, received about $12.5 million in restricted stock grants for 2013, according to a regulatory filing on Wednesday night.

title: Cheer Everyone? Russian Biathlon Spectators Are Still Learning
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  From their perch in the bleachers high above the shooting range, biathlon fans generally follow two unspoken rules: Stay quiet when a biathlete is shooting at the target, and do not cheer when a competitor from another country misses.

title: Loss Tapers at Tesla as Its Sales Still Climb
description: Nearly 20 months after delivering the first all-electric Model S sedan to customers, Tesla Motors is narrowing its losses as sales of its cars continue to climb.

title: The Bias Against Black Bodies
description: The Michael Dunn case has caused us to look once again at the American culture and criminal justice system, and many dont like what they see.

title: Disillusionment in Libya Over Vote on Charter Assembly
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  For the second time since the overthrow of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi two and a half years ago, Libyans are being asked to go to the polls to elect lawmakers responsible for preparing a new constitution. On Thursday, increasingly frustrated voters will directly elect a 60-member assembly to draft the charter after Parliament failed to appoint the body as originally planned.

title: Amid Toxic Waste, a Navajo Village Could Lose Its Land
description: CHURCH ROCK, N.M.  In this dusty corner of the Navajo reservation, where seven generations of families have been raised among the arroyos and mesas, Bertha Nez is facing the prospect of having to leave her land forever.

title: The Least We Can Do
description: Can we talk about the United Nations? I know, I know. But give me a minute. We dont do this very often.

title: Missing Costas? Fleeting Glimpses of a Lasting Presence
description: How much time would you guess Bob Costas spends on the air during one of NBCs prime-time Olympic shows?

title: A City Safe for Walking
At Lunar New Year, a Big, Red Target for Pickpockets
description: There is no red bunting on the front door of Helen Hsus home in Rego Park, Queens, no festive garlands or totems that often bedeck Chinese homes like hers during the monthlong Lunar New Year celebration, which began more than two weeks ago. If she were in her native Taiwan there would be fluttering red paper streamers, glinting mirrors and equine caricatures heralding the Year of the Horse. Here in Queens, though, Ms. Hsu has tacked up only military flags and a crest from her son, a United States Marine.

title: Gap to Raise Minimum Hourly Pay
description: In a surprising move, Gap Inc. informed its employees on Wednesday that it would set $9 as the minimum hourly rate for its United States work force this year and then establish a minimum of $10 next year.

title: A Piece of DNA
description: This is the fifth part of an eight-part series.

title: A Church So Poor It Has to Close Schools, Yet So Rich It Can Build a Palace
description: KEARNY, N.J.  Mater Dei Academy sits shuttered, blue drapes pulled across its windows, atop a hill in this working-class city. From its steps, you can peer across the mist-shrouded expanse of the Meadowlands to the distant spires of Manhattan.

title: Is That Sausage Worth This?
description: Modern factory farms have so much wrong with them, but a starting point is the practice of turning pigs into cannibals.

title: Calmer Streets, Safer City
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio on Tuesday released his plan to eliminate traffic deaths in New York City. Every preventable traffic death is unacceptable, he said, and New Yorkers deserve a systematic, citywide campaign for safer streets. Hes right on both counts.

title: Nationalistic Remarks From Japan Lead to Warnings of Chill With U.S.
description: TOKYO  A series of defiantly nationalistic comments, including remarks critical of the United States, by close political associates of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has led analysts to warn of a growing chill between his right-wing government and the Obama administration, which views Japan as a linchpin of its strategic pivot to Asia.

title: Brit Awards Red Carpet
description: View looks from Rita Ora, Kylie Minogue, Pharrell Williams, Iggy Azalea and more.

title: Ukraines Deadly Turn
description: Three months of confrontations in Kiev, Ukraine, erupted in sudden and brutal violence on Tuesday and Wednesday, leaving at least 25 dead and the heart of the capital city in flames.

title: Defendant in Terror Trial Gets Access to Detainee
description: A federal judge in Manhattan on Wednesday cleared the way for a terrorism defendants lawyers to question, in writing, Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, the self-described architect of the Sept. 11 attacks, to see if his testimony might help their clients case.

title: The Clear Benefits of a Higher Wage
description: Republicans sputtered with outrage when the Congressional Budget Office said that immigration reform would lower the deficit, strengthen Social Security and speed up economic growth. They called for the office to be abolished when it dared to point out that tax cuts raise the deficit or when it highlighted the benefits of health care reform. But now that the budget office has predicted (and exaggerated) the possibility that an increase in the minimum wage might result in a loss of jobs, Republicans think its gospel.

title: Violence in Ukraine Creates Deepening Clash Between East and West
description: MOSCOW  The two sides in what is developing into an East-West clash over Ukraine hardened their positions on Wednesday, with Russian officials denouncing what they called a coup by right-wing extremists, even as the United States and Europe threatened to impose sanctions on those responsible for the violence that has erupted in the capital, Kiev, and spread to other cities.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 19, 2014
Figure Skaters Battle for Steady Nerves and Legs
description: SOCHI, Russia  Usually, the legs are the first to go. They get tight. Or turn into jelly. Or in the worst case, they are unable to move at all.

title: Divorced From My Husband, and My Faith
description: I stood before the panel of rabbis, waiting to have a religious divorce conferred upon me. I was dressed as the Orthodox Jewish woman I was supposed to be, modestly, in a below-the-knee navy skirt and buttoned cardigan. But I felt exposed. What kind of shameful woman, I imagined the rabbis thinking, leaves her marriage; what kind of mother uproots her life?

title: What to Watch: Thursday, Feb. 20
description: WOMENS HOCKEY Canada and the United States traded wins and punches on their way to Sochi, but the Olympics have long been Canadas turf. The Canadians have won the last three gold medals, and they have not lost a game at the Olympics since 1998. They also beat the Americans, 3-2, in the teams first-round meeting here. So the gold is Canadas to lose. But it can happen. The last team to beat the Canadians at the Olympics? The United States, in the gold medal game in Nagano. NBC, noon

title: Federal Lawsuit Accuses For-Profit Schools of Fraud
description: LINWOOD, N.J.  It was the electronic monitor around a students ankle that first gave Kelli J. Amaya serious doubts about the Harris School of Business.

title: Getting Stares on the Streets of Cambodia: Buses for the Masses
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  This city of nearly two million people has many of the amenities of a modern metropolis  broadband Internet, automated teller machines and fancy restaurants, to name a few. But until this month, the capital of Cambodia had no public transportation system. To get around, residents had to inure themselves to perilous rides on motorcycle taxis or dust-smothered commutes in open three-wheeled tuk-tuks.

title: In Mexico Meeting, a Show of Friendship With Few Results on Immigration and Trade
description: TOLUCA, Mexico  They call it the Three Amigos summit meeting, and President Obama and his Mexican and Canadian counterparts played their parts on Wednesday. They shared a lunch, joshed about the Olympics, promised enduring cooperation, and took a staged stroll through a botanical garden, complete with requisite smiles for the cameras.

title: Paul Colby, Whose Club Helped Fuel Greenwich Villages Rise, Dies at 96
description: Paul Colby, the owner since 1974 of the Bitter End, a celebrated coffeehouse-cum-nightclub that helped make Greenwich Village a legendary place by showcasing young performers like Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, Billy Crystal and countless others, died on Feb. 13 at his home in Montclair, N.J. He was 96.

title: University of Maryland Computer Breach Exposes Records of Students and Staff
description: The University of Maryland said on Wednesday that more than 300,000 records for students, faculty and staff were stolen in a sophisticated cyberattack.

title: 57 Bits of Emotional Knowledge
description: Tell me. I want to know. I need to know. I have to know. Oh, Im sorry you told me. I wish I didnt know that.

title: Millard Fillmore and Company
description: Ulysses. Abraham. Millard. Be it here resolved that the presidents of the United States have had some pretty rad first names. Its a topic that comes up in this puzzle, coming as it does just on the heels of Presidents Day. Youll have to flip through your mental Rolodex of commanders-in-chief to come up with the one name that will explain todays theme.

title: Phnom Penhs First Buses
description: A Japanese-sponsored pilot project introduced a bus service to the chaotic streets of the capital of Cambodia.

title: Mike Stepovich, Who Led Alaska to Statehood, Dies at 94
description: Mike Stepovich, the last presidentially appointed governor of the Territory of Alaska, who helped lobby Congress for statehood, died on Friday in San Diego. He was 94.

title: 3 Opposed First-Degree Murder Conviction in Florida Trial, Juror Says
description: A juror in the Florida trial of a man who fatally shot a teenager in a dispute over loud music said in an interview broadcast Tuesday that three jurors believed the gunman had acted in self-defense, which negated any chance of a first-degree murder conviction.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, February 20, 2014
description: I have lost any desire to stay here any longer. There is no sense to stay. As for me, the Olympic flame can be put down as well.

title: Yahoo Introduces Service for Buying Mobile Ads
description: Yahoo introduced a new service for companies to buy different forms of mobile advertising, as it seeks to build its clout in two increasingly important parts of the advertising business.

title: California Health Insurance Enrollments Rise, but Hispanics Still Lag
description: LOS ANGELES  With six weeks left in the open enrollment period for insurance under President Obamas health care law, more than 828,000 Californians have signed up for private coverage through the states online health care exchange, state officials announced Wednesday.

title: F.B.I. Papers Yield Clues in Vanishing of Civil Rights Activist
description: Cheryl Robinson says she has waited more than four decades to find out what happened to her husband, an Alabama civil rights activist who disappeared, and now she thinks she has at least the beginning of an answer.

title: Shumpert Hurts Knee Amid Talk of a Trade
description: NEW ORLEANS  Iman Shumpert had a bad day. It started with seeing his name in trade reports, and about an hour before the Knicks faced the Pelicans on Wednesday night, Shumpert acknowledged what everyone else was thinking: that the game had the potential to be his final one with the Knicks. All he could do, he said, was play.

title: Labor Leaders See Focus on Wages as Key to Union and Democratic Victories
description: HOUSTON  Gathered for their annual winter meeting, the nations labor leaders say that what they see as the best theme for reviving the union movement  American workers need a raise  also would be a winning issue for their Democratic allies in this falls elections.

title: Latest Attacks on Doctors Prompt New Call for Deterrent Measures
description: On Monday, Sun Dongtao, an ear, nose and throat doctor at Qiqihar Beigang Hospital, in the northern province of Heilongjiang, was beaten to death with an iron bar by a patient unhappy with his treatment,  the state news agency Xinhua reported.

title: Corrections: February 20, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Animal Prints in Living Color
description: For resort, designers offered up a delightfully fresh interpretation of classic animal prints, switching the expected natural colors for a rainbow-hued, yet slightly subdued, palette. A zesty shade of lime adds punch to a sweater from Equipment and bag from Valentino, while cool-toned touches look refreshing on a phone case from Marc Jacobs, a ring from Marc Alary and brogues from Robert Clergerie. Acidic shades of apple liven up a DSquared2 slingback and Eugne Riconneaus skate deck, while Amaya Arzuagas draped miniskirt with lemon-speckled spots lets the print whisper and the silhouette roar.

title: The Art of Texting While Walking
description: This article appeared in the Feb. 23, 2014 issue of The New York Times Magazine

title: Study Finds Greater Income Inequality in Nations Thriving Cities
description: WASHINGTON  If you want to live in a more equal community, it might mean living in a more moribund economy.

title: Two Steps Forward and One Step Back for the Federal Reserve
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz professor of entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Scrutiny in California for Software in Schools
description: A leading California lawmaker plans to introduce state legislation on Thursday that would shore up privacy and security protections for the personal information of students in elementary through high school, a move that could alter business practices across the nearly $8 billion education technology software industry.

title: Word of the Day | wan
description: wan \wn\ adjective

title: U.N. Security Council Members Propose Resolution on Syrian Aid
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations Security Council hurtled toward a showdown over Syria, as members put forth a draft resolution late Wednesday to try to force the warring parties to let in humanitarian aid while Russia, the Syrian governments principal ally, warned about unduly politicizing aid.

title: Colorado: New Psychiatric Exam Is Ordered for Theater Gunman
description: A judgeon Wednesdayordered a new psychiatric examination for James E. Holmes, who killed 12 people in an Aurora theater in 2012, saying that an earlier evaluation by a state doctor was incomplete and inadequate. The ruling, by Judge Carlos A. Samour, orders the state mental hospital to have a new mental-health expert examine Mr. Holmes and offer an opinion on whether he was sane on the night of the shooting. Mr. Holmess lawyers have admitted he was the gunman, but argue he is not guilty by reason of insanity. The exam is to be completed byJuly 11, further delaying the trial.

title: Nebraska: Judge Blocks Pipeline Route
description: A judge on Wednesday blocked the Keystone XL pipelines planned route through the state, a new hurdle for the embattled project. The judge, Stephanie F. Stacy of the Third Judicial District Court, ruled that the law giving Gov. Dave Heineman, a Republican, the authority to approve a crude oil pipeline was unconstitutional. The governor said he would appeal. The proposed pipeline from Canadian oil sands in Alberta to Gulf Coast refineries has become a touchstone fight for environmentalists, and the State Department is considering whether to allow it to cross the border.

title: Airlines Warned of Possible Shoe Bombs
description: The Department of Homeland Security alerted airlines on Wednesday to a possible new threat from shoe bombs and urged carriers to pay extra attention to flights arriving from overseas. Intelligence officials recently detected what they considered credible warnings of terrorist efforts to strike passenger jets using explosives concealed in shoes. The threat information, first reported by NBC News, was not related to any particular airline, country or date, the officials said.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (Bravo) INSIDE THE ACTORS STUDIO James Lipton interviews Matthew McConaughey (above right, with Mr. Lipton) about his first major part, in Dazed and Confused; about the film that made him a household name in a single weekend; and about the homework he conducted for his leading role in Dallas Buyers Club, for which he is nominated for an Oscar.

title: Chinese Paper Links Ukraine Strife to Rapid Political Reform
description: The Chinese people should draw an important lesson from the turmoil engulfing Ukraine: Beware of rapid political reform, because it will only end in chaos and bloodshed.

title: Chinese Censors Have Kept Their Hands Off House of Cards
description: Mao is dead. And so is his China.

title: Elton John and Kanye West Among Performers Set for Bonnaroo Festival
description: It could be, like the man sang in Bennie and the Jets, weird and wonderful, or it could be just plain weird. But either way, Elton John will be one of the headlining performers at this years Bonnaroo festival, its organizers said on Wednesday, after several days of rumors that that best-selling pop pianist and showman would make a rare appearance at this annual outdoor music and comedy event in Manchester, Tenn. Hell have no shortage of competition for most outrageous eyewear at Bonnaroo, which will run from June 12 through June 15, and will also see Kanye West, Jack White, and Lionel Richie atop the bill. Other artists on the lineup, which is expected to include more than 125 bands, are Vampire Weekend, Ms. Lauryn Hill, Skrillex, Damon Albarn, Arctic Monkeys, Frank Ocean, Nick Cave & the Bad Seeds, Ice Cube, Wiz Khalifa and Neutral Milk Hotel. The announced comedians include Taran Killam of Saturday Night Live and Hannibal Buress, the standup comic and co-star of Broad City. More information can be found at the festivals official website, bonnaroo.com.

title: Politics Behind Move to Free Gandhi Assassination Plotters, Analysts Say
description: MUMBAI  The decision by J. Jayalalithaa, the chief minister of Tamil Nadu, to release seven people who plotted the assassination of Rajiv Gandhi, the former prime minister, has set up a showdown between the southern state and New Delhi.

title: Renewed Fighting Shatters Truce in Ukraine
description: A new wave of fighting broke out in Kiev early Thursday, hours after opposition leaders confirmed that a truce had been reached.

title: Air France-KLM Swings Back to Underlying Profit
description: PARIS  After more than 18 months of painful cost-cutting and staff reductions, Air France-KLM reported its first underlying profit in three years on Thursday, and confirmed that it was making steady progress toward reducing debt even as it steps up investment in premium-class service and new international partnerships.

title: Test Yourself | English, Feb. 20, 2014
description: Take the Quiz

title: 6 Qs About the News | Blaze and Bloodshed in Kiev
description: In Kiev Protesters Set Square Ablaze to Thwart Police and Ukraine Puts Extremists on Notice After Deadly Clashes, Andrew Higgins and Andrew E. Kramer write about the latest developments in the conflict in Ukraine.

title: Sochi Under Siege
description: SOCHI, Russia  ON Feb. 7, the opening day of the Olympics, several people walked out onto Red Square in Moscow. When they attempted to sing the Russian national anthem, all were arrested and taken to the nearest police station. We were holding small rainbow flags to show support for the L.G.B.T. community, wrote my protester friend, who found herself taken into custody for the first time in her life.

title: How Obamacare Could Unlock Job Opportunities
description: During college, Lauren Braun worked at a health clinic in Peru, where she spent an inordinate amount of time tracking down mothers in an effort to get them to bring their children in for vaccinations. The experience was frustrating, but through it Braun came up with a business plan: Make silicone bracelets that function as punch cards, to remind mothers about upcoming appointments. Back in the United States, she consulted with mentors and perfected the idea, but then, she set it aside after graduation, going to work for a large health-insurance company, taking a salary and benefits over the uncertain life of an entrepreneur.

title: This Aint No Disco. Its a Photograph.
description: A paradox of Studio 54 was that it was both the most exclusive party in town, stopping all but the chosen few at its impenetrable velvet rope, and the most accessible, bombarding the public with images of the glitterati and the high life inside. The club was a fantasy about which it was not necessary to fantasize, since torrents of ink and celebrity photographs did the work for you. If you wanted to know what it was like to rub shoulders (or more) with Halston or Liza or Name-Your-Boldface-Name, you could pick up a magazine that chronicled the rubbing. It was not just a place to see and be seen. In the miasma of sex and fame and money and pleasure that swirled around New York in the late 1970s, it was a place to be photographed, mass-produced and consumed as a shimmering commodity.

title: Deal Reached to Resume Expansion of Panama Canal
description: Work on the planned expansion of the Panama Canal was set to resume on Thursday after the construction consortium and the canal authorities reached a preliminary accord to pay suppliers and put an end to their dispute over $1.6 billion of cost overruns.

title: Should Terminally Ill Patients Be Allowed to Die on Their Own Terms?
description: When the term assisted suicide is used, many people think it should be illegal. But when aid in dying and death with dignity are used instead, support increases dramatically. But no matter what we call the practice, the idea is still the same. A small group of people face an outlook of imminent suffering and death. Should they have the option to end their life on their own terms?

title: Amid Hugs and Tears, Korean Families Divided by War Reunite
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Lee Beom-ju, 86, had little to say at first.

title: Pakistani Airstrikes Target Militants in Tribal Areas
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Fighter jets and helicopter gunships pounded areas believed to be Taliban hide-outs in the tribal regions of northwestern Pakistan late Wednesday and early Thursday, as the prospects for a peace initiative appeared to evaporate.

description: KIEV, Ukraine  Security forces fired on masses of antigovernment demonstrators in Kiev on Thursday in a drastic escalation of the three-month-old crisis that left dozens dead and Ukraine reeling from the most lethal day of violence since Soviet times.

title: Ukrainian Skier and Coach Withdraw to Protest Kiev Violence
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Two members of Ukraines Olympic team withdrew from the Sochi Games on Thursday in a show of solidarity with protesters who are locked in a violent conflict with their government in the capital city of Kiev.

description: Milan

title: Daily Report: Facebook to Pay $16 Billion in Deal for Popular Texting App
description: The frenzy to acquire fast-growing technology start-ups reached new heights on Wednesday as Facebook announced its largest acquisition ever, saying it would pay at least $16 billion for WhatsApp, a text messaging application with 450 million users around the world who pay little or no money for it, David Gelles and Vindu Goel report.

title: Every Business Has a Special Number, or Metric. Do You Know Yours?
description: Dane Atkinson used to own a bar. Like many bar owners, he occasionally had problems with shrinkage. When this happens, some bar owners measure liquor bottles and some employ fancy point of sale systems. Mr. Atkinson learned to track limes.

title: Peltz Renews Call for a PepsiCo Split
description: The activist investor Nelson Peltz is again pushing for PepsiCo to spin off its North American beverage business after the company announced that it had decided against such a split.

title: Advocate for Uighurs Seems to Have Foretold Detention
description: Ilham Tohti, the Uighur intellectual who disappeared into the black hole of Chinas security apparatus more than a month ago, appears to have prophesied his detention and what are expected to be charges of inciting ethnic separatism in the far western region of Xinjiang.

title: Facebooks $16 Billion Deal for WhatsApp
description: BIG DEAL: FACEBOOK BUYS WHATSAPP FOR $16 BILLION | When Facebook offered to buy Snapchat last year for $3 billion, the messaging app turned Facebook down. So this time, Facebook made it harder for its target to say no. On Wednesday, Facebook announced it would acquire WhatsApp, a text messaging application with 450 million users, for at least $16 billion in cash and stock, its largest acquisition by far and one that represents a new height in the frenzy to acquire popular technology start-ups, David Gelles and Vindu Goel write in DealBook.

title: Iran and 6 Powers Agree on Terms for Nuclear Talks
description: VIENNA  In what officials described as a serious, workmanlike and conversational atmosphere, Iran and six world powers have agreed on a timetable and framework for negotiating a comprehensive agreement to end the confrontation over Irans nuclear program, the European Unions foreign policy chief and Irans foreign minister said Thursday.

title: Womens Figure Skating Live Updates
Seeking a Break in a 252 Million-Year-Old Mass Killing
description: Sam Bowring is officially a geologist at M.I.T. Unofficially, hes a homicide detective trying to solve the ultimate cold case. Dr. Bowring wants to understand how an estimated 96 percent of all species on Earth became extinct at the end of the Permian Period 252 million years ago. It was the biggest of the five mass extinctions recorded in the fossil record. But because this killing happened so long ago, the culprit has evaded discovery for decades.

title: How a Family Spread Its Gospel
description: In the 1960s and 70s, black entertainers, politicians and sports stars visiting Chicago knew where to go for comfort food and warm conversation: to the home of the Staples family.

title: A Woman at a Crossroads
description: When Idina Menzel accepted the lead role in If/Then, a new musical that follows two divergent paths in one womans life, she thought she was getting that rarest of theatrical opportunities: a rich part in an original and emotionally complex show.

title: A Former Tech Titan Sets His Sights on a New Venture  Politics
description: BANGALORE  The man who once declared the world is flat is now readying himself for an uneven, uphill battle.

title: Video: Frozens Secret Rink
description: How does snow think? That was the question one of the story editors asked as the team behind Frozen struggled over years to shape the film into a relatable tale. In this video, the Carpetbagger goes behind the scenes at Disneys Burbank, Calif., headquarters to learn more about the inspirations  like Grumpy Cat and a hidden roller rink  behind the film and especially the hit soundtrack.

title: Back to the Future on Tech M.&.A.
description: With Facebooks deal for WhatsApp, the volume of technology mergers and acquisitions in the United States has risen to its highest level since the dot-com boom, Thomson Reuters data shows.

title: Credit Issuers Making It Easier to Know Your Score
description: It is fairly simple to get a free copy of your annual credit report. But you usually must pay to see your credit score  the three-digit number that summarizes your credit report for lenders, to help them decide if youre likely to repay a loan.

title: In Surprise Finish (All Upright), France Sweeps Mens Ski Cross
description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  Skiers do not have to jump through a ring of fire during the obstacle course that is known as the ski cross competition. But do not be too surprised if they add flames for the next Olympics.

title: Activist Begins Board Fight at Abercrombie & Fitch
description: Updated, 1:06 p.m. | The activist hedge fund that has been pushing for change at Abercrombie & Fitch stepped up its fight on Thursday by nominating five director candidates despite changes that the retailer had announced in recent weeks.

title: Profits Fall for Walmart and Nordstrom, and They Forecast Weakness Ahead

title: Alice Hoffman: By the Book
description: The author of The Museum of Extraordinary Things found a copy of The Catcher in the Rye on her mothers bookshelf. I hadnt known that a book could speak so directly to a reader.

title: The Lies That Doctors and Patients Tell
description: The doctor-patient relationship is ideally an intimate partnership where information is exchanged openly and honestly. That is seldom the reality, however. Deception in the doctor-patient relationship is more common than wed like to believe.

title: In WhatsApp Deal, Sequoia Capital May Make 50 Times Its Money
description: The hottest tech start-ups typically have a roster of outside investors hoping for a big return. In the case of WhatsApp, the messaging service that Facebook bought on Wednesday for $16 billion, there is only one: Sequoia Capital.

title: Zacharys First Shiva
description: My 9 year old, Zachary, is making his first shiva call. OK, technically it isnt a shiva, as the funeral is the next day. It is nichum aveilim  comforting the family. But there are people and food and nervousness, so he will remember it as his first shiva call.

description: This interview with Satya Nadella, his first since taking over as chief executive of Microsoft, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

description: KRASNAYA POLYANA, Russia  When Barbara Ann Cochran of Vermont won the Olympic gold medal in slalom in 1972, she was the first American to win the event in 20 years.

description: No algorithm based on terrestrial mathematics can make Facebooks WhatsApp deal compute.

title: Clashes End Truce in Ukraine
description: Antigovernment protests continued in Kievs Independence Square on Thursday. The fighting shattered a truce declared just hours earlier.

title: E.U. Imposes Sanctions Despite Russian Criticism
description: BRUSSELS  Brushing aside Russian criticism, the European Union agreed on Thursday to go ahead with sanctions that include travel bans and asset freezes imposed on those deemed responsible for the fatal escalation of violence in Ukraine.

title: Confusion and Courage at Olustee
description: We [are] off on another tramp, Cpl. James Henry Gooding reported to the readers of his hometown newspaper on Feb. 8, 1864, but with no knowledge of our destination. His regiment, the 54th Massachusetts, the first regiment of African-American troops recruited from the Northern states, had won fame six months earlier when they attacked Fort Wagner on the South Carolina coast. Since then, they had been involved in mundane siege operations around Charleston, and morale was sinking. However, now that they were aboard steamers heading south, Gooding noted, the excitement on board was intense.

title: Learning to Deal With Billboards
description: Its really fast, Matthew Hemerlein, an electronic pop musician who records under the name Lo-Fang, said of his recent career trajectory. In the next month, hell release his debut album, Blue Film; appear on the ABC drama Revenge; perform on the Late Show With David Letterman oh, and hell be opening for Lorde, the 17-year old Grammy winner, who handpicked him for a tour that kicks off on March 3. (Theyll be at the Roseland Ballroom in New York on March 10, 11 and 12.)

description: Craig Arend of Altamira NYC takes over our Instagram account for Milan Fashion Week. Check out NYTimesFashion on Instagram for more.

description: Freeskiing, which includes halfpipe and slopestyle events, is new to the Olympics this year. Skiers say the sport is different from any other.

description: The latest womens collection from Prada at Milan Fashion Week.

title: Europe Plans New Limits on Aid to Money-Losing Regional Airports
description: PARIS  The European Commission announced new limits Thursday on the amount of financial aid that member states can provide to money-losing regional airports, a move that could eventually lead to higher fares for passengers traveling to some out-of-the way terminals served by low-cost carriers.

title: NBC Expects Record Online Viewership for U.S.-Canada Semifinal
description: After nearly 800,000 people watched an Internet live stream of the United States 5-2 victory over the Czech Republic on Wednesday in mens ice hockey at the Winter Olympics, NBC officials began to wonder how many more would stream the United States-Canada semifinal Friday.

title: Darkness Arrives Onstage
description: Few operas are as challenging, or as cathartic, as Bergs Wozzeck, the 1925 setting of Georg Bchners play about an army private driven by poverty, illness and countless acts of humiliation, to murder Marie, his common-law wife. With its atonal score, poured into traditional forms that are as concise as they are eloquent, and passages of speechlike singing, its the early masterwork that defined and in many ways dominated 20th-century opera.

title: Today in Small Business: No Exit
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small business owners today?

title: Guantnamo Detainee Pleads Guilty in 2002 Attack on Tanker Off Yemen
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  A Saudi detainee at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, pleaded guilty on Thursday before a military commission to terrorism-related offenses involving a 2002 attack by Al Qaeda on a French-flagged oil tanker off the coast of Yemen. The plea deal will give him a specific sentence and a prospect of leaving the American military prison, where he has been held in indefinite detention.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Max Mara Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: Irans Judiciary Closes a New Pro-Government Newspaper
description: TEHRAN  An Iranian newspaper aligned with the countrys reform-minded new president was closed on Thursday by Irans judiciary, only six days after its first issue, local news outlets reported.

title: Graham Center Gets $1 Million for Dance Archive
description: One of the biggest revolutions in the dance world over the past century has been the use of technology to help preserve choreography and pass it on from one generation to the next. The Martha Graham Center of Contemporary Dance announced Thursday that its efforts in that direction had received a major boost: a $1 million grant from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation that will allow it to build on, digitize and organize its archive of materials on Graham dances.

title: A Look Inside Prada's Milan Boutique
description: As part of Milan Fashion Week, the brands boutique reopens with a Harlem Renaissance-inspired design.

title: Times Minute | Truce Shatters in Ukraine
description: The truce in Ukraine is shattered by battle. Also on the Minute, why the Affordable Care Act can create job opportunities and a new wave of sophisticated home surveillance.

title: Times Minute | Truce Shatters in Ukraine
description: In the Video

title: Indias Upper House Approves Creation of New State
description: NEW DELHI  After hours of shouting, paper-shredding and chanting in Indias upper house of Parliament, lawmakers on Thursday passed a bill creating a 29th state by dividing Andhra Pradesh, a large southern state, in two.

title: Hey, You Guys, Come and See This!
description: Roughly two-thirds of the theatergoers at Broadway shows are female, a disparity that many producers have tried to address. With its mullets and strip clubs, the hair-metal jukebox musical Rock of Ages made some progress in attracting men in 2009, and shows like The Book of Mormon and That Championship Season have aggressively courted them since. Several contenders on and Off Broadway are vying for the male demographic this season, flinging enough testosterone to make that Super Bowl takeover of Times Square look like a pillow fight. Still, by the final round (hint), the title belt (hint hint) for Ultimate Guy Show can go to just one contender, shadowboxing alone at the top of the TKTS steps (hint).

title: Milan Fashion Week: Fendi Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Milan Fashion Week photo diary of Russ McClintock.

title: Early Shot at Redemption for U.S. Hockey Team
description: SOCHI, Russia  The groom has fled the altar, leaving a jilted Russia, which paid $51 billion for the once-in-a-lifetime ceremony, only to watch one of the four groomsmen, none with blood ties, commandeer the celebration.

title: Parting Glance: Frank Espada
description: I went to El Barrio this week thinking of Frank Espada. On blocks where renovated tenements stood alongside luxury high-rises, I strained to imagine what he had witnessed more than a half-century earlier, before anyone thought this stretch of Manhattan would sit in the cross hairs of gentrification. When it was home to people like him, who came to this frozen city, exiled from the verdant hills of Puerto Rico. When it was among the few havens for the dispossessed.

title: An Open Letter on Homosexuality to My Fellow Scientists in Uganda
description: President Yoweri Museveni of Uganda is about to sign into law a vehement anti-gay law after medical experts presented a report that homosexuality is not genetic but a social behaviour, according to a tweet from Ofwono Opondo, a Ugandan government spokesman. It is sad and ironic that Mr. Museveni will do so just as scientists at the annual meeting of the American Association for the Advancement of Science report that they have robustly confirmed my original finding of molecular linkage between male sexual orientation and a specific genetic region, Xq28.

title: In Store | Pradas Harlem Renaissance Homage
description: With its ongoing Iconoclasts project, Pradahas commissioned some of the worlds top fashion stylists to reinvent its flagship stores with immersive themed installations. Tonight, as part of Milan Fashion Week, the brands boutique there reopens with a Harlem Renaissance-inspired design  complete with Art Deco bar and handpainted flapper mannequins  by the creative director Edward Enninful. Here, a video documents the process of transforming the space from minimalist gallery to lavish speakeasy  and provides an up-close look at the rich textures and details of Pradas just-arrived spring collection.

title: Buyer & Cellar Gets a New Star
description: The Off Broadway understudy Clancy OConnor drew attention and full audiences last month when he went on for Michael Urie in the hit play Buyer & Cellar, but he didnt end up with the permanent gig when the time came to recast the one-man show. The producers announced on Thursday that Christopher J. Hanke, who played Bud Frump in the 2011 Broadway revival of How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying, will begin performances on March 18 as Alex More, a struggling actor who takes an unusual job working for Barbra Streisand.

title: Parallels Seen in Two Jet Crashes in 2013
description: WASHINGTON  The crew of a U.P.S. cargo jet that crashed on approach to Birmingham, Ala., last August had planned to land by using a method that was rare for them, following a computer-generated path to give vertical guidance, according to testimony given Thursday at a National Transportation Safety Board hearing. But the crew changed its strategy in the last minutes because the onboard computer did not perform as they had planned, investigators said.

title: Art Auctions Without the Attitude
description: EILEEN OGLE of Brooklyn comes so often to shop at Hutter Auction Galleries on West 55th Street in Manhattan that she admits she may have a bit of collectivitis.

title: Street Style in Shoreditch, London
description: The Broadway Market and Columbia Flower Market in East London are vibrant weekend shopping hubs, where you can find anything from Cornish pasties to vintage clothing. The cobblestone streets are packed with merchants and shoppers until sunset, when the action moves to the pubs.

title: Hotel Review: Shangri-La Toronto
description: Rates

title: Wall Street: Working for the Weekend or Through It?
description: Last month, Bank of America Merrill Lynch told its junior bankers to take four days off a month, on the weekends. Credit Suisse discouraged its analysts and associates from working on Saturdays. Last year, Goldman Sachs recommended that its analysts take weekends off whenever possible.

title: A Homey Addition to a Dallas Hotel
description: Hotel ZaZa, the more-than-decade-old 165-room luxury hotel in the Arts District of Dallas, recently expanded with the Bungalows, a collection of 12 suites on a separate residential leafy street near the main property.

title: Worst Spill in 6 Months Is Reported at Fukushima
description: TOKYO  About 100 tons of highly radioactive water leaked from one of the hundreds of storage tanks at the devastated Fukushima nuclear plant, its operator said Thursday, calling the leak the worst spill at the plant in six months.

title: Little Happens, but Much Changes
description: More than 30 years since its premiere, Athol Fugards Master Harold ... and the Boys endures as an understated yet meaningful study in racism.

title: Sid Caesar on Dick Cavett
description: The comedian, in character, during one of his good periods.

title: Promotion for CBSs Head of Programming
description: CBS rewarded its long-time programming president, Nina Tassler, with a new contract and a new title Thursday, elevating her to chairwoman of CBS Entertainment.

title: The Other Big Winner in the WhatsApp Deal: Your Wallet
