A 2011 photo of him with his daughter at a Starbucks in the Seattle airport, carrying his own backpack, was widely circulated on Chinese social media sites. Many praised Mr. Locke for his apparent humility  carrying his own bag and trying to pay for his drink with a coupon. Others, including some state media commentators, questioned whether Mr. Lockes behavior was a carefully calculated display.

title: Test Yourself | History, Feb. 25
description: Take the Quiz

title: An Art Event Incorporates Itself in the Spaces of New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  On a bright, crisp February afternoon, I hadnt exactly planned to sit in a hall full of strangers listening to intense conversations on death and dying  and in the process, becoming part of a discursive installation by a German artist in Indias capital city.

title: 6 Qs About the News | How a Kingpin Above the Law Fell, Incredibly, Without a Shot
description: In How a Kingpin Above the Law Fell, Incredibly, Without a Shot, Damien Cave writes about the arrest of Joaqun Guzmn Loera.

title: Creativity Inspired by Family and Nature
description: Suzy Menkes speaks with Antonio Marras about the importance of his Sardinian roots and his new collection inspired by howling wolves.

title: Reversing Course, Japan Makes Push to Restart Dormant Nuclear Plants
description: TOKYO  The government of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe made its biggest push yet to revive Japans nuclear energy program on Tuesday, announcing details of a draft plan that designates atomic power as an important long-term electricity source.

title: Buying Into Hawaiis Promises of Paradise
description: The gentle sound of lapping waves mingles with woozy notes from a distant steel guitar as a fruity cocktail beckons  paradise, right?

title: How Much Control Do You Think You Have Over Your Fate?
description: We like to think that we have control over our destinies. But what if our fate was determined by our ancestors hundreds of years ago?

title: Times Minute | Searching for @GSElevator
description: Also on the Minute, new evidence that global warming is the main cause of retreating glaciers and some of the most memorable scenes from Harold Ramis.

title: Times Minute | Searching for @GSElevator
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: Biking Through the Snow
description: Good Tuesday morning to you.

title: Infighting Poses Hurdle to Formation of New Coalition in Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Struggling to form a new majority coalition in Parliament, and under excruciating pressure because of a looming economic calamity, Ukrainian lawmakers decided Tuesday to delay for two days the naming of an acting prime minister and a provisional government.

title: Pistorius Trial in Large Part Can Be Aired on Live TV
description: LONDON  A South African judge ruled on Tuesday that substantial parts of the trial of Oscar Pistorius, the double-amputee track star accused of murdering his girlfriend, may be televised and photographed, and that all hearings would be broadcast on radio.

title: Daily Report: Bitcoin World Is Shaken by Apparent Theft at Exchange
description: The most prominent Bitcoin exchange appeared to be on the verge of collapse late Monday, raising questions about the future of a volatile marketplace, Nathaniel Popper and Rachel Abrams report.

title: Introducing a New Shipping Policy  and Pondering How to Sell It
description: Id like to thank everyone who took the time to contribute their thoughts on my recent post about shipping costs. Lots of good input there, with a wide range of viewpoints. I showed all of them to my salesmen and we came up with four options:

title: Intersection: Rainy Day Style in Milan
description: In Milans Navigli District, locals embrace vintage clothing and bright colors.

title: @GSElevators Big Reveal
description: @GSELEVATOR EXPOSED | For three years, Wall Street has been trying to identify the employee behind the Twitter account @GSElevator, which reported anonymous snippets purportedly overheard in elevators at Goldman Sachs. But it turns out, the tweeter doesnt work at Goldman and never did, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column. In fact, the tweeter is a 34-year-old former bond trader in Texas named John LeFevre.

title: Britain Arrests Ex-Detainee Freed by U.S.
description: LONDON  The British police said on Tuesday that they had arrested Moazzam Begg, a former detainee at the American prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, along with three other people on suspicion of terrorism offenses related to the war in Syria, where, intelligence officials say, hundreds of British militants have been drawn to the fight against President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Knicks Felton Faces Gun Charges
description: The Knicks were grinding their way to another brutal loss in a season full of them Monday night at Madison Square Garden. The game came down to a last-second heave by the Mavericks Dirk Nowitzki, which caromed high off the rim before falling through for the winning shot.

title: In Beijing, Complaints About Smog Grow Louder and Retaliation Grows Swifter
description: Nearly a week into northern Chinas latest airpocalypse, the skies over Beijing are murky and acrid with a heavy smog that shrouds the sun. On social media sites, the yellow, choking air has become something of a meme, as residents post depressing photos of their blackened air purifier filters and hazy urban vistas with comments like #nuclearwinter.

title: This and That | Sock Hop
description: The most overlooked of knits get asked to the fashion dance.

title: Tricky Little Things
description: Hyphens cause us no end of confusion, perhaps because the only overarching rule is this: Use them when they are needed and dont when they arent.

title: Disney Throws Open the Gates to Its Own Digital Movie Service
description: LOS ANGELES  As consumers display increased interest in owning movies digitally, a habit considered crucial to Hollywoods future, Walt Disney Studios unveiled a service on Tuesday that aimed to make collecting its films easier.

title: Bonderman Says TPG Is Considering Going Public
description: BERLIN  David Bonderman, the co-founder of the private equity firm TPG Capital, said on Tuesday that his firm was considering going public but had not committed to doing so.

title: Video: The Ranch Where Star Wars Exploded
description: Before there was a here here, I was here, said Randy Thom, the director of sound design at Skywalker Sound, part of George Lucass Skywalker Ranch complex outside of San Francisco. It used to be called Sprocket Systems, in the earliest days, and it became Skywalker Sound in the mid 80s, said Mr. Thom, who first worked with the company on The Empire Strikes Back.

title: A Pakistani Militant Leader Stirs, Worrying the Indian Government
description: NEW DELHI  When a new administration takes over after national elections in May, one of the first challenges it is likely to face will come from the Kashmir Valley. Adding to the Indian governments worries about the return of violence in the region, particularly among the youth, is the reappearance of Maulana Masood Azhar, the leader of the Pakistani militant group Jaish-e-Muhammad.

title: Kravis Says Private Equity Does Poor Job of Discussing Its Benefits
description: BERLIN  Henry Kravis, the co-founder of the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts, and other industry leaders think the private equity sector has a bit of an image problem.

title: Ava Smith Transforms Backstage at Dsquared2
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in Milan. Here, the model Ava Smith (left) and after (right) makeup by Gordon Espinet and hair by Sam McKnight.

title: Cartoons in the Elevator
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Preschool Parent Interview: An Elevator Pitch for My 2-Year-Old
description: Wed just completed the school tour, and, with six other parents, were being escorted into a boardroom. Jon and I had spent the morning asking endless questions. (Do the ages mix? How do you handle separation? Wheres the coffee? No Danish?) Finally, I thought, we could sit back and listen to the preschools spiel, doodling with their branded pads and pencils. But the director, sitting at the head of the long table like a C.E.O., began. Lets go around, she said. One by one, describe your child in one word. Then, explain why this school is a good fit. My heart galloped. She was asking us to pitch our kids  in public? Though this environment was contrived (some might say insane), it brought up a question Id been contemplating: What is the best way to talk about my child?

title: Feminist Tales, Up to a Point
description: PARIS  The list of important 20th-century female ballet choreographers isnt long, but Birgit Cullberg, often forgotten today, is certainly on it. Cullberg, for whom the Swedish government formed the eponymous Cullberg Ballet in 1967, was regarded as a major choreographer well into the 1980s. Today, however, her work is almost unknown outside her native country. (Her son, Mats Ek, has achieved far greater renown).

title: The Sorry State of Campaign Finance in Albany
description: Campaign finance reform is incredibly important, but, frankly, its not very sexy. How do you rouse a full-throated rallying cry for a system that could clean up politics by encouraging more people to run for office? Its not a bleat against new taxes. Its not a tale of two cities.

title: Second Act | Once More, With Feeling
description: A historic London recording studio gets reborn as a stylish movie theater while staying true to its rock n roll roots.

title: The Secret to a Bulletproof Antidoping Test?
description: In the lab of Yannis Pitsiladis, a physiologist in Scotland, athletes spend their days injecting synthetic EPO, a popular performance-enhancing drug that tricks bone marrow into churning out more red blood cells, allowing athletes bodies to absorb more oxygen. Pitsiladis hasnt gone rogue. Hes at the forefront of an effort to revolutionize the hunt for dopers in sports by scouring his subjects blood cells for a distinctive, long-lasting genetic fingerprint left by the drug.

title: At Private Equity Conference, a Debate Over the Benefits of Going Public
description: BERLIN  The benefits of going public remained a hotly debated topic among private equity leaders as they gathered at SuperReturn International, the private equity gathering in Berlin.

title: WWS 594, Economics of the Welfare State: Trying to Help Workers
description: Slides here (pdf).

title: ECO 348, The Great Recession: The Stimulus
description: Slides here (pdf).

title: Egypt Names Industrialist and Minister as Premier
description: CAIRO  An industrialist who rose to prominence during the Mubarak era was named as Egypts new prime minister on Tuesday, a day after his predecessor abruptly announced the resignation of the military-backed government that had managed the country since July.

title: Down the Up Staircase
description: James Surowiecki makes an important point: if you want a society in which everyone has a decent life, you need to construct a society in which everyone has a decent life  not a society in which everyone has a small but equal chance of living the lifestyle of the rich and famous.

title: Dallas Promotion Brings $1.98 Gasoline to Manhattan for a Day
description: In an effort to create publicity for the premiere of the third season of Dallas, TNTs reboot of the 1980s nighttime soap, the network on Monday dressed up a filling station in Manhattan to look as if it were owned by the shows fictional Ewing family. But the fresh Ewing Energies logos decorating the awning over the fuel pumps were only part of the promotion.

title: The Read Around: Video of B. J. Novak
description: In The Read Around, a weekly video feature, authors discuss the when, where and how behind their books. Above, the writer and actor B. J. Novak, whose debut collection of fiction is One More Thing, talks about the freedom of following ideas wherever they might lead.

title: In Our Pages: February 26
description: 1914: Women Fail to Vote in Chicago

title: Venezuelan Opposition Leader Tweets at the President
description: Updated, 12:40 p.m. | If, on Monday, President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela had something pressing to say to Henrique Capriles, the countrys most prominent opposition leader, he would have to save it for later. Mr. Capriles, after initially indicating that he would attend talks on Monday with Mr. Maduro and other elected officials about the growing unrest in the streets, had a very public change of heart.

title: Defending Bitcoin, Andreessen Says Mt. Gox Is Like MF Global
description: The apparent collapse on Monday of Mt. Gox, the most prominent exchange for Bitcoin, spooked many holders of the virtual currency, as they tried to determine whether the problems pointed to larger flaws in the Bitcoin system.

title: Lloyd Webbers New Musical to Close in London
description: The theater gods have at long last taken revenge on Andrew Lloyd Webber for the ubiquity of Cats, Phantom of the Opera and Evita. His latest musical, Stephen Ward, which opened to mixed reviews in London in December, and has had mediocre ticket sales ever since, will close on March 29, the BBC reported on Tuesday.

title: Milan Fashion Week Street Style Wrap-Up
description: Craig Arend of Altamira NYC takes over our Instagram account for Milan Fashion Week. Check out NYTimesFashion on Instagram for more.

title: Repsol in $5 Billion Settlement With Argentina
description: LONDON  Repsol, the Spanish oil company, said Tuesday that it had agreed to a $5 billion compensation deal with Argentina for the seizure of the companys operations in that country, ending a bitter two-year dispute.

title: 2 Allies Meet Before 50th Anniversary of Israeli-German Ties
description: JERUSALEM  Israel and Germany began preparations to mark 50 years of diplomatic relations with a joint meeting here on Tuesday between the Israeli government and most of the German cabinet, an event analysts said was both symbolic and a practical reflection of the strong ties between the two countries.

title: The Goldman Sachs Elevator Stalker Is Revealed  as a Fibber
description: Its safe to talk on the elevator again at Goldman Sachs. The author of a snarky Twitter feed  @gselevator  has been revealed as John LeFevre, 34, of Texas, described as a former bond executive. As it turns out, he doesnt work at Goldman and never did.

title: Today in Small Business: The Best Apps for Start-Ups
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today?

title: A Leading Analyst of Global Food Solutions Gets a Deserved Honor
description: I cant find an unjustified line in the Heinz Award citation for Jonathan Foley, the director of the Institute on the Environment at the University of Minnesota. An excerpt is below, along with links to background on the four other winners of this annual prize, which honors the memory of Senator John Heinz and is given to people improving the human condition and environment through work in areas ranging from poverty alleviation to the arts and sciences.

title: Times Minute | Inside Yanukovych's Home
description: Ukrainians explored the compound of their ousted president, Viktor F. Yanukovych. Also on the Minute, swelling protests in Venezuela and a look at mussels that pose threats in the United States.

title: Times Minute | Inside Yanukovychs Home
description: In the Video

title: Scene City: Partygoers Come Out of Their Shell
description: Art-world types and night-life denizens support the Turtle Conservancy.

title: F.D.A. Weighs Fertility Method That Raises Ethical Questions
description: GAITHERSBURG, Md.  The Food and Drug Administration is weighing a fertility procedure that involves combining the genetic material of three people to make a baby free of certain defects, a therapy that critics say is an ethical minefield and could lead to the creation of designer babies.

title: Image of the Day: February 25
Former City Ballet Dancer to Lead Academy in Los Angeles
description: The dancer Jenifer Ringer, who retired this month from New York City Ballet, has been appointed head of the Colburn Dance Academy, a new division of the Colburn School in downtown Los Angeles, The Los Angeles Times has reported.

title: A Brooklyn Inspiration for Frozen
description: The Oscar-nominated composers Kristen Anderson-Lopez and Robert Lopez say that in some part, inspiration for the songs they wrote for Frozen came from Prospect Park.

title: Long Island Developer Recovering; Gunmans Identity Remains Elusive
description: A day after being shot in the head by a masked gunman, Gary Melius, a well-known Long Island developer and prominent political patron, was recovering on Tuesday, and remarkably lucid.

title: BlackBerry Chief Demurs on Sale of Messenger Service, for Now
description: BlackBerry has had a rough couple of years. But the prospect of a deal for its messaging service, on the heels of Facebooks blockbuster takeover of WhatsApp, has helped buoy the ailing smartphone makers fortunes.

title: Arguments Against God
description: This is the second in a series of interviews about religion that I am conducting for The Stone. The interviewee for this installment is Louise Antony, a professor of philosophy at the University of Massachusetts at Amherst and the editor of the essay collection Philosophers Without Gods: Meditations on Atheism and the Secular Life.

title: Seen on the Street | Outside the Fall/Winter 2014 Milan Womens Shows
description: A glimpse at what gals are wearing this season.

title: John Lennon Manuscripts Go to Auction
description: More than 100 John Lennon manuscripts, including short stories, poems and line drawings, most of them produced for the two books Lennon published during his lifetime, In His Own Write (1964) and A Spaniard in the Works (1965), will be auctioned at Sothebys in New York on June 4.

title: Newcomers in Bidding Fight for Catskills Casino Weigh Site Closer to New York City
description: The battle to build a potentially lucrative $500 million casino resort amid the wooded hills and craggy economy of the Catskills has been a gentlemanly affair, with a half-dozen rivals gently competing for one, if not two state licenses for the region.

title: At Helmut Lang, a Changing of the Guard
description: The guard has changed at Helmut Lang. The label announced today that its creative directors, the husband-and-wife team Michael and Nicole Colovos, will leave after eight years in the post.

title: No Bailout for Bitcoin Holders
description: Imagine that the leading stockbroker in a country closed its doors without giving any reason. Its clients would be in a panic and customers of rival firms would be very nervous. That is exactly what has happened to Bitcoin, the leading pseudo-currency.

title: Lexus Ranked No. 1 on Consumer Reports Annual Brand Report Cards
description: For the second year, Lexus, Toyotas luxury brand, earned the top overall score in the Consumer Reports Car Brand Report Cards, the publication announced Tuesday. Hondas Acura luxury division took second place, and Audi was third.

title: Study Links Temperature to a Peruvian Glaciers Growth and Retreat
description: Sitting on a flat volcanic plain 18,000 feet above sea level, the great Quelccaya ice cap of Peru is the largest piece of ice in the tropics. In recent decades, as scientists have watched it melt at an accelerating pace, it has also become a powerful symbol of global warming.

title: Navalny Is Convicted of Resisting Arrest at Moscow Protest, Despite Video Evidence
description: Updated, 5:31 p.m. | As my colleague Andrew Roth reports from Moscow, the dissident blogger Aleksei A. Navalny was sentenced to seven days in jail on Tuesday after a judge found him guilty of resisting arrest at a protest in Moscow the night before. The conviction of the activist lawyer, despite visual evidence posted on his blog that appeared to show him going peacefully into custody, raised concerns that Mr. Navalny could face a much longer term in jail in one of the other cases filed against him for what he insists are political reasons.

title: Are the New Golden Age TV Shows the New Novels?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Adam Kirsch and Mohsin Hamid discuss whether TV shows like The Sopranos and The Wire can be compared to the novels of writers like Charles Dickens and Henry James.

title: California Endangered Species: Plastic Bags
description: LOS ANGELES  On a recent drizzly day, Esha Moya found herself standing outside a grocery store in South Los Angeles, her half-dozen paper bags falling apart in the rain, wishing she had a few small items that had been free and plentiful her entire life but are now banned in this city: plastic shopping bags.

title: Late Night Gets Sunny, and a Family Tree Grows
description: Jimmy Fallon felt the need to explain how a monologue works when he became the new host of The Tonight Show. Seth Meyers, 40, who on Monday took Mr. Fallons place on Late Night, was more relaxed and self-mocking, telling viewers not to expect anything too new. Or, as he put it, Im going to shake stuff up and open this thing with a monologue!

title: Audra McDonald to Return to Broadway as Billie Holiday
description: The five-time Tony Award winner Audra McDonald will make an unexpected return to Broadway this spring  in time to qualify for the 2014 Tonys  to play Billie Holiday in the musical play Lady Day at Emersons Bar & Grill, its producers announced on Tuesday. While the show had been in the works for the 2014-15 theater season, the unusually swift closing of the Broadway play Bronx Bombers provided a theater, Circle in the Square, which also happened to suit the intimate nightclub setting of Lady Day. Performances will begin March 25 with an opening night of April 13. It is a limited engagement, scheduled to run for 10 weeks, or 70 performances.

title: Venezuelans Document Unrest
description: The student protests that began just a few weeks ago in Venezuela have swept the country, as my colleague William Neuman reports, evolving into the biggest demonstrations seen since the death of the longtime leader Hugo Chvez last year.

title: Geithners Book Has a Title: Stress Test
description: For the title of his memoirs, Timothy F. Geithner has employed a somewhat wonky phrase evocative of the financial crisis: Stress Test.

title: Apollos Co-Founder Sees Opportunities to Invest in Distressed Debt
description: BERLIN  Despite a frenetic period of sales and spin-offs, Leon Black, the co-founder of Apollo Global Management, said Tuesday that there were still attractive opportunities for private equity firms to invest in distressed debt.

title: Nissan Recalls 13,500 Frontier Pickups for Potential Fire Hazard
description: Nissan is recalling about 13,500 Frontier pickup trucks from the 2012-14 model years for a possible fire hazard, the automaker said in a report posted on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration website.

title: Whats Happening off the Runway During Paris Fashion Week
description: Paris Fashion Week begins today. And while the fashion set may be feeling the lag of the final leg of shows, the City of Light is geared up to stimulate and pamper wary showgoers when theyre off duty. Here, a guide to surviving (and enjoying) the festivities.

title: Sri Lanka Denounces Push to Open War Inquiry
description: NEW DELHI  Sri Lankas government on Tuesday forcefully rejected a call for an international war crimes investigation into the countrys bloody civil war, adding to tensions with the United Nations human rights body.

title: Aid Group Sees Daunting Obstacles to Health Care for Afghans
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The patients in the four hospitals run by Doctors Without Borders in Afghanistan are the lucky ones, by all accounts, having arrived at well-stocked facilities that maintain international standards with high-quality free care.

title: Truth and a Prize Emerge From Lies About Hoffman
description: Herding his three younger sons out the door to school on Feb. 5, David Bar Katz was stopped for a moment by his eldest, who was browsing the Internet.

title: Elliott Raises Bid for Riverbed to $3.3 Billion
description: Updated, 3:48 p.m. |

title: Orange-Currant Scones
description: Julia Moskin shows how to master the art of making sweet, tender scones with a firm crust and a soft, crumbly texture.

title: Cdric Charlier: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: In His Words | Stillness in the Move
description: Teju Coles new book extols the streets of Lagos, Nigeria, where he spent his youth. Here, he expounds on whats so great about living in New York.

title: Tax Overhaul Plan Faces Key Hurdles
description: WASHINGTON  The proposal by the top Republican on the House Ways and Means Committee to overhaul and simplify the nations tax code is already coming under scrutiny from fellow Republicans, with at least one party leader, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, saying the plan has no chance.

title: Sochi Performances That Deserve a Mention, if Not a Medal
description: SOCHI, Russia  The first Winter Olympics by the Black Sea ended Sunday after 98 events, abundant sunshine, occasional fog and one more gold medalist than expected because of a tie in the womens downhill between Tina Maze and Dominique Gisin.

title: Biscuits and Scones Share Tender Secrets
description: The American scone is a confection in crisis. Puffy and pale, supersized and supersweet, it has lost its purpose. Is it a muffin? Is it a pastry? Does it exist to be frosted with icing, or spread with jam  or only to crumble into the crevices of car upholstery?

title: Brazil Real Estate Start-Up Draws U.S. Investment
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Amid continuing concerns about Brazils sputtering economy, the Dragoneer Investment Group of San Francisco has made its first investment in an Internet company here, leading a $12.75 million round in VivaReal, an online real estate classifieds start-up, the companies said on Tuesday.

title: In Ukraine, Both Sides Exploit Jewish History
description: Thanks to extermination and emigration, the Jews of Ukraine, who numbered about 2.7 million at the beginning of the 20th Century, are now down to perhaps 250,000 and falling. But their history is playing an oversized role in the drama of revolution unfolding in Kiev, as both sides exploit them and their memory to gain an upper hand in public opinion.

title: Justices Rule on Home Searches and Defendants Frozen Assets
description: WASHINGTON  In a pair of 6-to-3 decisions, the Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that the police may sometimes search homes over the objections of one of their residents and that criminal defendants are not entitled to hearings to try to gain access to frozen assets to pay their lawyers.

title: U.S. Game in Ukraine Is Moved to Cyprus
description: Ukraines soccer federation announced Tuesday that it would move a March 5 friendly against the United States mens national team to Cyprus from the eastern city of Kharkiv. The federation said it had agreed to move the match out of Ukraine, after a request from U.S. Soccer, for safety reasons.

title: It Remembers, You Fold: Packing-List Apps
description: Can a smartphone help you pack for a vacation?

title: Cranbury, N.J.: One Town, Many Personalities
description: When the Helstrom family decided to downsize last summer, they moved just nine houses away from the home they had been living in for 10 years in Cranbury. Jane Helstrom said it felt as if they had moved not just to a new neighborhood but to another region of the country, such as from New England to Nebraska.

title: Rajoy Vows to Cut Taxes, Saying Spain Is Recovering
description: MADRID  Mariano Rajoy, the Spanish prime minister, on Tuesday announced an income-tax cut for low earners and a reduction in social security contributions by employers, citing an economic recovery he said would let Spain shift away from austerity measures.

title: With Drone to Home Service, Netflix Uses Satire Against Amazon
description: Netflix on Tuesday released a satirical video promising Drone to Home delivery of DVDs to customers, taking an obvious swipe at Amazons plan to deliver items to consumers via small octocopters, a.k.a. drones.

title: Lucy Kirkwood Wins Blackburn Play Prize
description: The playwright Lucy Kirkwood has won this years Susan Smith Blackburn Prize, given to recognize women who have written works of outstanding quality for the English-speaking theater, for her play Chimerica. The award, which is to be presented by the director Phyllida Lloyd on Tuesday night at a ceremony in London, comes with $25,000 and a signed print by the artist Willem de Kooning.

title: White House Meeting Turns Into a Lightning Round for Obama and Boehner
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama and Speaker John A. Boehner sat across from each other for an hour on Tuesday in the leather-bound chairs of Mr. Obamas office and quickly ticked through a remarkably long list of issues.

title: Bustan Opens on the Upper West Side
description: Headliner

title: Anthony Vaccarello: Fall 2014 RTW
description: Paris

title: The Gun Report: February 25, 2014
description: Yesterday, the Supreme Court declined to review two cases involving the rights of those under 21 to own handguns. One case involved a Texas law that bars nearly all 18-, 19- and 20-year-olds from obtaining a handgun permit. The other involved a federal law that prohibits licensed firearm dealers from selling handguns to people under 21, which was instituted in 1968 and aimed at diminishing violent crime. Both appeals were filed by the National Rifle Association.

title: Share Your Experience With Race on Campus
description: For my article today on racism on college campuses, I spoke with students from around the country about how race is still very much an issue for young Americans despite openness to interracial dating, marriage and friendships. I also read dozens of posts on Twitter and other social media platforms and used Facebook to help find people to interview.

title: Day After Ugandas Antigay Law Is Signed, a Tabloid Publishes Names
description: In October 2010, a tabloid newspaper in Uganda called Rolling Stone published a front-page headline: 100 Pictures of Ugandas Top Homos Leak. Hang Them.

title: Considering a New G.M.O.: Baby
description: From Fear of Designer Babies as F.D.A. Weighs Fertility Procedure:

title: G.M. to Expand Small-Car Recall to 1.4 Million Vehicles
description: General Motors will more than double the size of a recall issued this month for an ignition switch defect in some of its small cars, the automaker said in a news release Tuesday. The expansion brings the number of vehicles covered by the recall to nearly 1.4 million in the United States.

title: Fresh Maine Scallops; Hefty Sandwiches and a Wine Club in Manhattan
description: To Sear: Sea Scallops That Taste Just Like Maine

title: Starring a (Reluctant) Journalist
description: In the race for the Oscar for best feature documentary, so much attention has been paid to The Act of Killing and The Square  the first about mass killings in Indonesia, the other about the revolution in Egypt  that a third film about international politics has been overshadowed. But Richard Rowleys Dirty Wars is even more global in its focus, examining clandestine American military operations in places like Afghanistan, Somalia and Yemen.

title: Creative Writing, via a Workshop or the Big City
description: The four most influential young literary magazines in America, each founded within a few years of the turn of this century, are n + 1, based in Brooklyn; McSweeneys and its sibling The Believer, both based in San Francisco; and Tin House, based in Portland, Ore. Tell me which you prefer, and I will, more or less, tell you who you are.

title: Model-Morphosis | Magdalena Frackowiak at Anthony Vaccarello
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2014 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Magdalena Frackowiak (left) and after (right) makeup by Tom Pecheux and hair by Anthony Turner.

title: Another Dingell Is Expected to Run for Congress in Michigan
description: WASHINGTON  Debbie Dingell, the wife of Representative John Dingell, the Michigan Democrat and longest-serving member of Congress who announced his retirement on Monday, is expected to announce a bid for her husbands seat.

title: In Idaho, Thin Snow Means Fat Tires
description: Snow has been so scant in Idaho this winter that bicycles started showing up in shop windows in the middle of January, and cyclists began booking ski huts during a season when its usually backcountry skiers who are seeking accommodations.

title: Roy Simmons, 57, Lineman Who Later Came Out as Gay, Dies
description: Roy Simmons, a former offensive lineman for the Giants and the Washington Redskins and one of only a handful of N.F.L. players to have said publicly that they were gay  all after their playing careers ended  died Thursday in his apartment in the Bronx. He was 57.

title: InterMune Lung Drug Is Successful in New Trial
description: A drug being developed to treat a fatal scarring of the lungs has succeeded in an important clinical trial and could become the first medicine to be approved for that disease, known as idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

title: Who Can Consent to a Warrantless Search?
description: Have you ever been in a home the police urgently wanted to search? What if you disagreed with someone under your own roof about whether to let the cops in without a warrant? Thats the position Roxanne Rojas found herself in one October day in 2009, stuck quite literally in between an abusive boyfriend and police officers in the heat of a robbery investigation.

title: Obesity Rate for Young Children Plummets 43% in a Decade
description: Federal health authorities on Tuesday reported a 43 percent drop in the obesity rate among 2- to 5-year-old children over the past decade, the first broad decline in an epidemic that often leads to lifelong struggles with weight and higher risks for cancer, heart disease and stroke.

title: Regulators Weigh In on Online Educational Services
description: As school districts around the country increasingly turn to online educational services that can collect and analyze details about how individual students learn, some parents and legislators have been raising questions about whether the personal information collected by such programs is federally protected from being shared or sold by technology vendors.

title: A Digital Detective
description: Alison Chung followed her lifelong love of solving mysteries to found a forensic technology firm.

title: Kiev in Chaos: Teaching About the Crisis in Ukraine
description: Updated: March 3, 2014

title: Paris Fashion Week: Cdric Charlier Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Alfredo Piola.

title: Ladies and Gentlemen, the Polls Are Almost Closed
description: This is it. Soon the equivalent in Oscar circles of the checkered flag  will be waved: at 5 p.m. Pacific Standard Time, voting ends for the 86th Academy Awards. All ballots are due in  the paper versions that some members still prefer, or the online ones, which the majority of the Academy now uses.

title: Watching TV Without Paying for Cable
description: Q. Is it possible to dump cable and still view my television, even if it is just local channels? I am really tired of paying the cable prices.

title: An Inside Look at Cooking and Dining in Tel Aviv
description: Six years ago, Tel Aviv tapped into its inner voyeur when it joined the international movement Houses from Within, a festival in which residents of some of the citys most interesting (and opulent) homes fling open their doors and allow the public to visit.

title: In Performance: Bebe Neuwirth
description: The actress sings Nowadays from the Kander and Ebb musical Chicago, on Broadway at the Ambassador Theater. She is appearing in the show through March 9.

title: Mixed Results, but Strong Outlook, for Home Depot and Macys
description: Home Depot and Macys, two of the countrys biggest retailers, reported mixed earnings for their fourth fiscal quarters on Tuesday, both partly blaming an unusually cold and stormy January for slow sales. Compared with many retailers, however, the companies did fairly well.

title: Keyboard and Function Keys Returning to BlackBerry Phones
description: Last year, BlackBerrys vision of the future was an all-touch-screen phone. Now John S. Chen, who became chief executive and executive chairman after that plans spectacular failure, is proposing a return to BlackBerrys past as its path to the future.

title: Religious Experience and the Modern Self
description: I have a couple of posts coming that arent quite direct follow-ups to what I wrote last week about Adam Gopniks New Yorker essay on atheism and belief, but deal with issues related to the whole modernity/belief/atheism tangle. For the first one, I wanted to juxtapose two pieces whose intended audiences dont necessarily overlap that much  a London Review Books essay on Japan and the ghosts of the tsunami, and a Grantland career retrospective on the Dutch director Paul Verhoeven, of Robocop and Showgirls fame.

title: First Lady Announces After-School Initiative
description: WASHINGTON  Michelle Obama on Tuesday introduced a broad, five-year initiative to make after-school programs a healthier, more active environment for millions of children, saying the changes would also help the childrens performance during the other hours of the day.

title: Unlikely Partners: Rookie Agents and Gay Player
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Joe Barkett loves to play chess, appreciating how the game rewards those who can think four or five steps ahead, an approach he has applied to his fledgling career as a sports agent. Yet for all the well-prepared plans that Barkett made with Cameron Weiss, his business partner and college friend, their unimaginably sudden rise began with a single, serendipitous keystroke.

title: G.M. Report Shows Recall Investigation Took 10 Years
description: Alan Batey, president of General Motors North America, said Tuesday that the automakers nearly decade-long investigation of a defect for which it is now recalling 1.4 million vehicles  and which is related to 13 deaths  was not as robust as it should have been. The admission came as the automaker tried to explain to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration why it took so long to recall the vehicles.

title: In 1930s Britain, an Office Lothario and the Women Who Endure Him
description: In the early 1930s, when the Great Depression had the planet in its grip, the playwright John van Druten could be counted on to provide Broadway audiences with a particular brand of escape: sophisticated modern comedies set amid Londons privileged classes.

title: Many in China Can Now Have a Second Child, but Say No
description: BEIJING  After three decades of a Chinese policy that limits most families to one child, many families say they will not take advantage of a major change allowing a second child because of the rising cost of child-rearing.

title: A Good Ratings Night for Another New NBC Late-Night Show
description: NBCs introduction of its new late-night lineup continued in high gear Monday night as the first edition of the Seth Meyers version of the Late Night show opened with strong ratings numbers.

title: Islamist Militants Blamed for Deadly College Attack in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  After herding the female students into a classroom, Islamist militants from the group Boko Haram fatally burned or shot dozens of male students in an attack late Monday on a state college in northeastern Nigeria, officials said on Tuesday. It was the fourth school assault attributed to the group in less than a year.

title: Mozilla Hopes to Reduce Smartphone Prices Radically
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Can a cellphone maker produce a smartphone for just $25?

title: A Respite From the Season and the Scene
description: Lately Ive been keenly aware of needs I didnt realize I had, like dress shoes with ice cleats, an age-appropriate ski cap, self-shoveling sidewalks and a car that can hop sideways over snowbanks into empty parking spots. With the first bite of my first course at a new restaurant in Brooklyn called Dover, I knew Id been missing something else, too.

title: Credit Suisse Helped U.S. Clients Hide Billions in Assets, Senate Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  An elevator controlled remotely. A bank office referred to by its code name. A sheaf of bank statements hidden in the pages of Sports Illustrated.

title: The Theater of Faith and Doubt, Love and Pain
description: Craig Lucas has a romantic comedy about a not so funny topic opening on Thursday at the Cherry Lane Theater. Ode to Joy, produced by Rattlestick Playwrights Theater, is about addiction. Mr. Lucas, the prolific writer of Reckless, Prelude to a Kiss, Longtime Companion and the musical collaborations Marry Me a Little and The Light in the Piazza, also directs the new play, his follow-up to The Lying Lesson of last season. In an interview, he talked about the tricky art of keeping things light when the truth is hard to hear. Excerpts from the conversation follow.

title: Frailty, Thy Name Is ...
description: Theres something distinctly unpromising about the Australian comedian Jim Jefferies, or rather, the fictional version of himself he plays on the FXX comedy Legit: paunchy, with a peculiar ridge of hair and the hesitant manner of a man expecting disaster.

title: Battle Over London Market Raises Development Issues
description: LONDON  Trying to renovate a Victorian market and tack on some offices hip enough for Google in the oldest part of this ancient city is not a task for the weak of heart. Just ask Geoff Harris.

title: Pictures of the Day: Chad and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Chad, Turkey, North Korea and India.

title: Canadian Firm Buys Tower on Park Avenue
description: A Canadian investment firm has agreed to pay $575 million for a 33-story office tower at Park Avenue and 57th Street in the latest indication of a soaring real estate market spurred by foreign investment.

title: Apple Issues Fix for Security Problem on Macs
description: Apple has finally issued a security update to its OS X Mavericks software for Macintosh computers, patching a bug that could have let hackers eavesdrop on supposedly encrypted connections and steal everything from usernames and passwords to location data.

title: The Official, if Possibly Unnecessary, End of Acetaminophen Use During Pregnancy
description: This is the kind of research result that changes behavior.

title: S.&P., in Lawsuit Defense, Seeks Documents About Obama-Geithner Meetings
description: Updated, 8:25 p.m. | For Timothy F. Geithner, the former Treasury secretary, meetings with President Obama were nothing out of the ordinary.But one such meeting has taken on outsize significance for Standard & Poors, the ratings agency that is defending itself against the governments claims of fraud.

title: Beauty in the Details
description: LONDON  Watching Elizabeth McGorian and Thomas Whitehead performing the Queen and Cattalabutte in The Sleeping Beauty at the Royal Opera House, its easy to think, Only with the Royal Ballet. The Queen is the loving, solicitous mother of Princess Aurora, the heroine whose finger prick casts the court into a hundred-year sleep; Cattalabutte is the fussy, officious master of ceremonies, whose oversight enrages the fairy Carabosse, causing all the trouble.

title: Why Most Small-Business Owners Will See Premiums Rise Under A.C.A.
description: A new report from the federal government that says more small employers will see premiums increase than fall under the Affordable Care Act appears to have put the Obama administration on the defensive once again. But the report is remarkable as much for what it reveals about the current state of the small-group market as for how it might look under Obamacare, as the law is commonly known.

title: You Think You Know Your Neighbors, but ...
description: The Americans, which returns Wednesday on FX, has a sly title that suggests how deeply deceptive this thriller is at its core.

title: A Wasteland, With Aliens
description: Almost Human, a cheap-looking amalgam of Fire in the Sky (1993) and Philip Kaufmans vigorous 1978 remake of Invasion of the Body Snatchers, should not be confused with the Fox television drama of the same name. That show features quirky writing, confident actors and at least one character who inspires empathy; this project, on the other hand, has clearly diverted too much of its small budget toward special effects.

title: Stars! Or So They Can Seem
description: Before a recent performance of iLuminate, I felt like a schoolgirl whod stolen an advance copy of the final exam. Having seen the shows first version six months ago and read its publicity material, I knew what was going to unfold.

title: Curtain Call | Milan Fashion Week
description: To mark the conclusion of Milan Fashion Week, we catalog the bows  some proud, some playful, some humble, some all of the above  of 14 fashion visionaries.

title: After Inquiry, SAC Capital Says It Intends to Hire a Trading Monitor
description: Updated, 8:01 p.m. |

title: Plaza-Saving Efforts Earn Honors for Groups
description: For their efforts to save Peavey Plaza in Minneapolis from the wrecking ball, the Preservation Alliance of Minnesota, the Cultural Landscape Foundation and the Minnesota chapter of Docomomo US have received the Advocacy Award of Excellence, one of three inaugural Modernism in America Awards. Established by Docomomo US, a nonprofit conservation organization dedicated to the modernist movement, the juried awards honor those working to preserve and rehabilitate midcentury architecture and design.

title: Hiding in the Shadows, Scavenging for Clues in Every Drawer
description: On a widely discussed and admired recent episode of HBOs True Detective, Rust Cohle, played by Matthew McConaughey, escaped from drug dealers, white supremacists and law enforcement through a series of improbable actions. He hid between two scraggly bushes, sneaked beneath a clothesline, paused behind a tree trunk, dashed into the shadowy section of a street and occasionally persuaded his pursuers to give up the chase by beating them into submission. At one point, Cohle waited quietly, gun aloft, against a wall as four armed men burst from a nearby door  only to run in the opposite direction.

title: Curtain Call | The Designers of Milan Fashion Week Take Their Bows
description: Designers project their personalities not only through their collections but also in their appearances at the end of their runway shows. To mark the conclusion of Milan Fashion Week, we catalog the bows  some proud, some playful, some humble, some all of the above  of 14 fashion visionaries.

title: Obama Announces New Manufacturing Hubs
description: The president said two new manufacturing institutes would be located in Chicago and Detroit in an effort to create high-quality jobs.

title: Morgan Stanley Reaches Agreement With S.E.C. on Mortgage Bonds
description: Morgan Stanley has tentatively agreed to pay $275 million to resolve a federal securities investigation related to subprime mortgage bonds the investment firm underwrote in 2007.

title: A Buyout Offer That Raises Questions of Board Fairness and Duty
description: If you happen to control a public company and want to buy out the remaining shareholders, avoid the mistakes made by the American Financial Group in its attempt to squeeze out the minority at the National Interstate Corporation.

title: Choose Your Monetary Adventure, Mt. Gox Edition
description: Bitcoin was, of course, created in part to cater to libertarian dreams  to provide a way to store your wealth where governments cant steal it through taxation or currency debasement.

title: Tours Director Criticizes New Annie
description: The $12 million Broadway revival of Annie closed last month as a critical disappointment and commercial failure. But it turns out that the musicals hard-knock life continues.

title: Knights in Shining Opera, at the Met
description: They did a Haydn opera about a supposed trip to the moon at the Hayden Planetarium, a rare Baroque piece featuring a decadent Roman emperor at a decadent downtown nightclub, and a Daniel Catn opera set in a poisonous garden at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

title: Times Minute | U.S. Colleges and Race
description: Racial tension at United States colleges. Also on the Minute, The National Enquirer settles a libel suit surrounding an actor's death and Disney launches a new movie app.

title: Times Minute | U.S. Colleges and Race
description: In the Video

title: Argentina Takes Its Debt Case to the U.S. Supreme Court
description: Argentina has now staked the future of its debt, and perhaps its financial fate, with the United States Supreme Court. Yes, you read that right. Argentina wants the nine justices to weigh in on a case involving its obligations to holders of its government bonds and to resolve the mess created by a handful of federal judges.

title: A View From Iran: Respect Rather Than Sanctions
description: To the Editor:

title: Lessons From Google, in School and at Work
description: To the Editor:

title: Study Finds Limited Benefit to Some Medical Homes
description: You may have heard the term medical home to describe a way of organizing doctors practices to provide more comprehensive, less costly, patient-friendly treatment. Insurance companies often offer more money to practices that become recognized as medical homes, which use a team approach to coordinate care. States are even looking to medical homes to help save money in their Medicaid programs.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Cdric Charliers Side-Swept Locks
description: For the Cdric Charlier runway, the hairstylist Laurent Philippon created a look based on a severe part. Starting above the left eye, he divided the hair all the way back, in a perfect line, to the bottom of the neck  a style inspired by the coifs of film noir heroines and silent-movie stars. To the left of the divide, tousled locks were tucked behind the ear and draped naturally over the shoulder. And on the right, they were pushed forward over the ear for what Philippon described as a rock n roll twist. I loaded the hair with Bb.Gel from Bumble and Bumble, he explained while combing the product through and then ruffling it with his fingers. To finish, he used Bumble and Bumbles new City Swept spray, which provided beautiful natural shine. The texture of this look is in fact quite stiff, but it offers the illusion of soft, wet hair. I would have left it wet, Philippon noted, but we had fur.

title: As Rest of Economy Weakens, Chinese Exports Surge
description: GUANGZHOU, China  The vast steel mill here on the south bank of the Pearl River was supposed to have closed more than three years ago, its labyrinth of rusty chutes and sheds bulldozed and its huge cranes with gigantic steel claws dismantled for scrap.

title: Restaurant Worker Wages
description: To the Editor:

title: Wheelies: The Non-Jeep Maserati S.U.V. Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Andrew Silberfein
description: Mr. Silberfein, 49, is the chief executive of Rouse Properties, a publicly traded real estate investment trust based in New York. The company owns and operates 34 malls in 21 states, or around 24.5 million square feet of retail property.

title: Ukrainian Journalists Launch YanukovychLeaks
description: Viktor Yanukovych may have vanished early Saturday from Ukraines presidential palace outside Kiev, but not without a trace. His entourage left behind security-camera images of a hasty flight from the lavish compound, and something else  tens of thousands of apparently incriminating documents that were still floating near a dock at the waterfront residence when journalists and curious spectators arrived.

title: Bank of America Discloses 2 New Investigations
description: Bank of America said that it was facing two new investigations related to its activities in foreign currency exchange markets and its handling of government-backed mortgages in the United States.

title: Ukraines Crisis, and the Russia Card
description: To the Editor:

title: Solar Industry Jump-Starts a Revival in California
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Back in 2009, when Danny Kennedy was looking for office space for the fast-growing solar services company he had co-founded, his venture capital investors recommended setting up shop in one of the Twitterville kinds of areas south of Market Street in San Francisco.

title: Abolitionist or Terrorist?
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N.Y.  ON Feb. 15, a group of activists in Charleston, S.C., unveiled a life-size statue of Denmark Vesey, a black abolitionist who was executed in 1822 for leading a failed slave rebellion in the city.

title: With Syria, Diplomacy Needs Force
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  THE conventional wisdom about Syria is that nothing can be done. It is said that military action would be either perverse  bringing the jihadists in the opposition to power  or futile, failing to tip the balance against the government of President Bashar al-Assad. Using force, it is argued, would also jeopardize other strategic objectives, like securing a lasting nuclear deal with Syrias supporter Iran.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: Recent Sale

title: Paris Fashion Week: Anthony Vacarello Fall/Winter 2014
description: Scenes from the Paris Fashion Week photo diary of Sonny Vandevelde.

title: U.S. Orders Tests on Rail Shipments of Oil
description: Federal regulators on Tuesday ordered shippers to properly test and classify crude oil from the productive Bakken region before loading it onto freight trains, a move meant to tighten regulatory standards after a spate of derailments and explosions that highlighted the hazards of carrying crude oil on rails.

title: For Hotels.coms Campaign, the Answer Was Obvious
description: TO the pantheon of brand mascots that includes the Most Interesting Man in the World, who pitches Dos Equis beer, and the Wisest, who peddles Campbells Soup, a website for booking accommodations is hoping to add an advertising character meant to be regarded as the Most Obvious Man in the World.

title: How the West Can Shape Ukraine
Trust Eroded, Obama Looks Beyond Karzai
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, apparently resigned to President Hamid Karzais refusal to sign a long-term security agreement with the United States before he leaves office, told him in a phone call on Tuesday that he had instructed the Pentagon to begin planning for a complete withdrawal of American troops from Afghanistan by the end of the year.

title: A Luxury for the Mets: Two Promising Catchers
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  With the 35th overall pick of the 2012 amateur draft, the Mets chose Kevin Plawecki, who was among the top catchers in college baseball. He was polished at the plate and behind it. He could get on base, flash some power and manage his pitchers. He had all the makings of a major league catcher.

title: A Nonprofit Lender Revives the Hopes of Subprime Borrowers
description: WASHINGTON  About 200 people struggling to become homeowners filled the pews of Plymouth Congregational church on a recent Saturday morning. Some were self-employed, others short on a down payment, many branded by credit problems. Mortgage lenders would have thrown money at them a decade ago. Now, the chastened industry turns them away.

title: The Bane and the Boon of For-Profit Colleges
description: Marc Jerome, the executive vice president of Monroe College, says his business is being unfairly targeted as corrupt.

title: Turks Are Glued to a Sensational Drama, This One Political
description: ISTANBUL  Turks have always loved a good soap opera. Years ago the fixation was Dallas, and Turks of a certain age still refer to a woman who drinks too much as Sue Ellen, the boozy character on that show. More recently, the Turkish drama The Magnificent Century, about palace intrigue and romance in an Ottoman sultans harem, became an obsession here and in the Middle East.

title: Back on His Feet and Leading a New Team
description: Mike Lonergan, then the coach of Vermont, was scouting an A.A.U. tournament several years ago when he noticed Maurice Creek, a 6-foot-5 guard. Creek was on the same team as a player Lonergan was trying to recruit, and as Lonergan watched Creek effortlessly convert jump shots, some thoughts crossed the coachs mind: He is a really good shooter, but I will never coach him. He is too highly rated.

title: Nuclear Waste Repository Set to Reopen After Leak
description: Almost two weeks after an unexplained puff of radioactive materials forced the closing of a salt mine in New Mexico that is used to bury nuclear bomb wastes, managers of the mine are planning to send workers back in and are telling nearby residents that their health is safe.

title: Ivan Nagy, Star of American Ballet Theater, Is Dead at 70
description: Ivan Nagy, a dancer of riveting noble presence who became one of American Ballet Theaters most popular stars in the 1970s as an acclaimed partner to great ballerinas, died on Saturday in Budapest. He was 70.

title: Authors Unmasking Wont Stop Book
description: In a book proposal recently sent to publishers, the writer known only as @GSElevator  a popular Twitter account consisting of things purportedly overheard inside Goldman Sachss elevators  bragged about being aggressively recruited by the bank.

title: Dont Just Do Something. Sit There.
description: With Russia growling over the downfall of its ally running Ukraine and still protecting its murderous ally running Syria, there is much talk that were returning to the Cold War  and that the Obama team is not up to defending our interests or friends. I beg to differ. I dont think the Cold War is back; todays geopolitics are actually so much more interesting than that. And I also dont think President Obamas caution is entirely misplaced.

title: Tentatively, European Union Weighs Its Options on Support for a New Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The European Unions foreign policy chief, Catherine Ashton, spent two days here promising unspecific support for a new Ukrainian government but urging it not to break close trading and cultural links with Russia. Ms. Ashtons deft dance was inevitable  the European Union and the West are not willing or capable of bailing out Ukraines economy, especially if Moscow retaliates with new punitive tariffs, higher prices for natural gas and a cutoff of significant ties to Ukrainian factories and businesses.

title: Long-Suffering Royals Regain Confidence
description: SURPRISE, Ariz.  Dayton Moore has been coming here for eight years as the general manager of the Kansas City Royals, roaming the practice fields on sun-kissed February mornings, watching his prospects and imagining a better tomorrow. Now, he believes, it is here.

title: Rethinking Our Rights to Dangerous Behaviors
description: In the last few years, its become increasingly clear that food companies engineer hyperprocessed foods in ways precisely geared to most appeal to our tastes. This technologically advanced engineering is done, of course, with the goal of maximizing profits, regardless of the effects of the resulting foods on consumer health, natural resources, the environment or anything else.

title: Lincoln and the Cannibals
description: While America was embroiled in a bloody civil war for its very survival, a little over 5,000 miles away from Washington, in the middle of the South Pacific, the people of the Marquesas Islands were in a struggle of their own over slavery.

title: De Blasio Says New York Can Add 29,000 Pre-K Seats
description: One of the biggest questions surrounding Mayor Bill de Blasios push for a higher income tax to pay for more prekindergarten seats in New York City is whether he could create enough seats to justify the increase.

title: Clinton Makes Kentucky Appearance
description: The former president spoke at a fund-raiser in Louisville for Alison Lundergan Grimes, a Democratic Senate candidate.

title: The Education of a Long Island Conservative
description: Who says old politicians cant reinvent themselves, jettison long-held beliefs and emerge from ideological cocoons, fresh as butterflies?

title: Ex-President Ventures Where Some Might Not
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  When Alison Lundergan Grimes, Kentuckys Democratic Senate candidate, welcomed former President Bill Clinton to a fund-raiser here Tuesday, she offered a rendering of recent political history suited for red-state Democrats: Mr. Clintons tenure was showered with praise, former President George W. Bush was mildly scorned, and President Obama was implicitly rebuked.

title: North Koreas Atrocities
description: The world has long been aware of North Koreas repression and brutality against its citizens, through the stories of escapees and reports by human rights groups and the State Department. But a study by a special United Nations commission has produced the most authoritative indictment yet.

title: At Steinbrenner Field, Heisman Winner Is Star Attraction
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The Yankees have had encounters with college football stars, including one who played at Florida State University. That was Deion Sanders, nicknamed Prime Time, who signed his minor league contract with a dollar sign for the S in his name, as General Manager Brian Cashman recalled.

title: Trading Site Failure Stirs Ire and Hope for Bitcoin
description: The apparent collapse of Bitcoins best-known and once-dominant trading platform has provoked outrage among its users, but it has also stirred hopes that the way may now be clear for more established players to transform and rein in a largely unregulated market.

title: A Military Budget to Fit the Times
description: The Pentagons proposals to reduce the Army to pre-World War II levels and modify some benefits for troops and retirees may seem unsettling to a nation that prides itself on having the worlds most capable military. But these ideas, part of Defense Secretary Chuck Hagels 2015 military budget, reflect a necessary and more prudent realism as America ends 13 years at war.

title: Christian University Resumes Inquiry in Handling of Sexual Abuse Reports
description: An investigation into Bob Jones Universitys handling of sexual abuse complaints will be allowed to resume, the university and investigators said on Tuesday, after the school endured two weeks of criticism for cutting off the inquiry, without explanation, as it neared completion.

title: An Unfinished Ukraine Palace and a Fugitive Leaders Folly
description: LASPI, Ukraine  Chased from his sumptuous villa outside the Ukrainian capital and last sighted searching for a sanctuary here on the Crimean Peninsula, Viktor F. Yanukovych, the former president, suffered a final indignity on Tuesday: The masons and electricians he had hired to build a Pharaonic seaside retreat in a historic, old-growth forest decided that he would never pay his bills and started hauling away their equipment and materials.

title: Christies Budget Proposes Sacrifices but No Big Solution to Labor Costs
description: TRENTON  A diminished Gov. Chris Christie sought to reclaim the mantle of fiscal sobriety that helped catapult him to Republican stardom, releasing a budget on Tuesday that called for new sacrifices from public employees, offered a painful payment to New Jerseys indebted pension system and abandoned his cherished plan to cut the state income tax.

title: Crude Weapons Help Fuel Unrest in Bastion of Venezuelan Opposition
description: SAN CRISTBAL, Venezuela  No one here is hiding the heavy artillery, such as it is. Students camping out on an intersection of this city, which has become a battleground between the authorities and antigovernment protesters, have a variety of homemade weapons  mortars to lob small, noisy explosives, miniature firebombs, slingshots, clubs and nasty-looking things called Miguelitos made from hoses festooned with nails.

title: Pioneering Aside, Collins Just Tries to Learn Plays
description: LOS ANGELES  Jason Collins was longing for a sense of normalcy Tuesday at Nets practice.

title: After Career of Firsts in Air Force, G.O.P. Challenger Has a New Mission
description: TUCSON  The Air Force Associations Cochise Chapter had fallen into a rapt silence as Martha McSally  the first female fighter pilot to fly a combat mission and command a fighter squadron  recounted a tale from her days in the military, the time when what was supposed to be a routine reconnaissance mission in Afghanistan went awry.

title: Parade Marches Backward
description: I have long been opposed to gays marching in the St. Patricks Day Parade on Fifth Avenue.

title: Justice Dept. Informs Inmate of Pre-Arrest Surveillance
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department has informed a former Brooklyn man who is serving a 15-year prison sentence over a terrorism-related conviction that his communications were subjected to surveillance without warrants before his arrest.

title: Shell Game
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Today marks the debut of crossword constructor Ruth B. Margolin, whose first-ever New York Times puzzle has been rated a Wednesday difficulty. Not bad for a newcomer.

title: El Chapos Arrest Unlikely to Break Mexican Cartel
description: To have a crack at an international kingpin, undercover officers from Boston and New Hampshire went from the mountains of northern Mexico through the Caribbean to Spain, where they discovered operatives of the powerful Sinaloa cartel setting up new routes and new markets.

title: Toxicology Expert Lifts Kerry Kennedys Defense
description: WHITE PLAINS  On the second day of Kerry Kennedys misdemeanor trial on charges of driving under the influence of a sleeping pill, the prosecutions pharmaceutical expert said that the drug, a generic version of Ambien, could render users incapable of recognizing that their driving was impaired.

title: 17 Brokerage Firms Agree to End Analysis Previews
description: Seventeen brokerage firms, including Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Merrill Lynch, have agreed to stop participating in money management surveys aimed at tapping into research analysts changing views on companies before those opinions are publicly issued.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Feb. 25, 2014
Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, February 26, 2014
description: Why does he need a palace every few kilometers? He thought he was a czar.

title: The Wilfred Complaint: Salazar et al. v. The Dept. of Education
description: A lawsuit filed in federal court contends that the government should cease collection of loans for students who were falsely certified for enrollment at Wilfred Academy.

title: Suit Seeks Relief for Trade School Students With Years of Debt but No Career
description: The Wilfred Academy promised her everything youll need for your beauty career. When she enrolled, Ana Salazar, a single mother of four, then 40, believed it was a ticket out of her minimum wage job as a security guard.

title: Hired to Fight Pirates, but Doomed by Boredom
description: PORT OF VICTORIA, Seychelles  The night before their lifeless bodies were found inside a cabin on a cargo ship, Jeffrey Reynolds and Mark Kennedy enjoyed the night life here, at tourist haunts called Le Rendez Vous and the Pirates Arms.

title: Corrections: February 26, 2014
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Honorific Streets, Now Cataloged
description: For a brief moment, a woman named Zenita Thompson enjoyed a small dollop of immortality. In 2006, City Councilwoman Letitia James of Brooklyn introduced legislation to rename half of a two-block-long street in Crown Heights, McKeever Place, for Ms. Thompson.

title: 2 Hollywood Stars on Capitol Hill
description: WASHINGTON  Television and the movies cannot seem to resist juicy Washington settings  House of Cards (intrigue!), Scandal (high drama!) or maybe Veep (zany!)  but on Wednesday, Capitol Hill will provide the background for two Hollywood stars with real-life missions.

title: Russian Opposition Leaders Get Jail Terms
description: MOSCOW  A municipal court on Tuesday jailed several Russian opposition leaders, including the activist and blogger Aleksei A. Navalny, for resisting arrest during a rally near the Kremlin that ended with more than 400 demonstrators detained by the police.

title: Lawyers for American Couple Seek Inquiry in Qatar
description: Lawyers for an American couple, held in Qatar for more than a year on charges that they murdered their adopted African daughter by denying her food and water, have formally asked the countrys attorney general to open an investigation into medical evidence used by the prosecution, asserting that it was fabricated.

title: New Twist Emerges in 86 Murder of Swedish Premier
description: LONDON  Ever since Prime Minister Olof Palme of Sweden was gunned down on a Stockholm sidewalk in 1986, theories about his unsolved murder have proliferated, with suspicions that Kurdish separatists or apartheid-era South African hit teams were behind it.

title: Hong Kong Editor Whose Ouster Stirred Protests Is Slashed
description: Updated, 2:58 a.m. E.D.T.| The former chief editor of a Hong Kong newspaper whose dismissal in January stirred protests about press freedom in the Chinese territory was slashed Wednesday morning, the police said.

title: New Coalition Takes On Indias Two Biggest Parties
description: NEW DELHI  Eleven political parties, including seven regional parties, formed a coalition on Tuesday in hopes of drawing voters away from Indias two main national parties in the general elections in May.

title: Britain: Police Error Frees Bombing Suspect
description: A man accused of killing four British soldiers in a bombing in London in 1982 will not face trial because he was mistakenly told that he was not wanted by the police. John Downey, 62, from Ireland, was arrested at Gatwick Airport last year and charged with four counts of murder. A court in London was told that Mr. Downey, who had denied the charges, was one of 187 suspects who were assured that they would not be prosecuted as part of moves to resolve the conflict in Northern Ireland. In a statement issued Tuesday, the Metropolitan Police said that Mr. Downeys letter was sent incorrectly in 2007 but that it respected a court ruling that he should not face prosecution.

title: Imperfect Already?
Why the I.R.S. Scandal Wont Go Away
description: In the continuing battle over Republican allegations that the Obama administration pressured the Internal Revenue Service to obstruct Tea Party applications for tax-exempt status, three well-known political figures are among those likely to benefit: Karl Rove and David and Charles Koch.

title: Optional Seating
description: Object of art? Perch for books or a drink? Bedside table? Chairs this good looking transcend their function through exceptional form.

title: How to Get Fit in a Few Minutes a Week
description: High-intensity interval training, a type of workout that consists of very brief bouts of very strenuous exercise, has become enormously popular in recent years. A main reason is that although such workouts are draining, they can be both very effective and very short, often lasting only a few minutes.

title: The Affordable Care Acts Multiple Taxes
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: Word of the Day | cant
description: cant \kant\ noun and verb

title: Whats on Wednesday
description: 11:35 A.M. (Starz Cinema) A SEPARATION (2011) In this Oscar winner for best foreign-language film, a couple (Leila Hatami, above, and Peyman Moadi) must decide whether to leave Iran for the sake of their daughter or stay to care for a parent with dementia. Either option could end their marriage. It is a rigorously honest movie about the difficulties of being honest, a film that tries to be truthful about the slipperiness of truth, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this drama, written and directed by Asghar Farhadi and starring his daughter, Sarina, as the couples child. It also sketches a portrait  perhaps an unnervingly familiar picture for American audiences  of a society divided by sex, generation, religion and class.

title: As Steel Mill Closes, Guangzhou Loses a Piece of Its History
description: Few steel mills in China have as storied a history as the Guangzhou Steel mill. Rival factions during the Cultural Revolution engaged in gun battles in and around the sprawling complex. Local residents say that young men and women hoping to flee Chinas poverty and chaos in those days prepared for the all-night swim through shark-infested waters from Shenzhen to Hong Kong by practicing in the murky waters of the Pearl River next to the factory.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Feb. 26, 2014
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: Airbus to Increase A320 Production
description: PARIS  Record demand for new commercial jets drove a 22 percent jump in profit at Airbus Group last year, prompting the European plane maker on Wednesday to announce a 10 percent increase in production of its most popular single-aisle plane.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The Star Quality of Jennifer Lawrence
description: In Being Human Seems Enough, the Times film critic Manohla Dargis writes an appreciation of the Oscar-nominated actress Jennifer Lawrence.

title: The Sublime Combination of Butter and Soy
description: Who knows who first mixed soy sauce and butter and discovered the pleasures the combination provides. Try the mixture on warm white rice, a steaming pile of greens or an old sneaker  regardless, the taste is a sublime velvet of sweet and salty, along with a kind of pop the cognoscenti call umami, a fifth taste beyond bitter, sour, salty and sweet. Soy butter provides warmth and luxury, elegance without pomp. It raises recipes to heights almost indescribable in the telling.

title: Chris Lehane Out-Washingtons Washington
description: On a hot Sacramento morning, Chris Lehane burst into a conference room filled with trial lawyers, lobbyists and one aggrieved mother, and laid out his battle plan: How to force California to raise its 40-year-old ceiling on medical-malpractice awards. Lehane, who is 46, spent six years working in the Clinton White House, battling the ethical scandals that seemed to confront the administration every day  typically by discrediting the accuser or leaking a document to undercut an impending news story critical of the president or the first lady. Now Lehane uses similar strategies  opposition research, attention-grabbing antics, the crafty manipulation of old and new media  for groups like this one, the Consumer Attorneys of California. The campaign to raise the cap on damages for pain and suffering in medical malpractice suits, which was set at $250,000, might have been handled legislatively, but much high-impact law in California is made at the ballot box, in the form of well-publicized voter initiatives. Influencing voters with his own extreme brand of performance politics has become Lehanes specialty.

title: Empowering Photographers to Embrace an Uncertain Future
description: With a torrent of images from the mundane to the momentous on social media and online, Susan Meiselas has been thinking about how to empower and excite photographers about an uncertain future. Ms. Meiselas, a member of Magnum, was a guest editor for the latest issue of Aperture magazine, where she highlights how photographers can embrace their new tools to make new choices and start new conversations.Everyone has a smartphone and everyones a photographer, she told the Lens co-editor James Estrin. So those who have committed themselves to developing the visual language of photography over these decades have to ask, How can we continue to contribute? Their conversation has been edited.

title: Is Your Generation Really Postracial?
description: According to Urban Dictionary, postracial is a term used to describe a society or time period in which discussions around race and racism have been deemed no longer relevant to current social dynamics. Popularized after the election of Barack Obama to the presidency of the United States of America in 2009.

title: Milan Looks
description: Fur, fabrics and fancy dominated the runways during the Italian fashion week.

title: Times Minute | Childhood Obesity Drops
description: Also on the Minute, why Clinton is a campaign staple and a push to ban plastic bags in California.

title: Times Minute | Childhood Obesity Drops
description: In the Video

title: New York Today: Bundle Up, Its Almost March
description: Good Wednesday morning to you.

title: Most Democrats Want Clinton to Run in 2016
description: More than 8 in 10 Democrats say they want Hillary Rodham Clinton to run for president in 2016, showing a level of interest in her that no other potential candidates  Democrat or Republican  come close to matching among their partys voters, according to a New York Times/CBS News Poll.

title: I Have Been Told That Im Different
description: Alison Chung of Chicago is not wired like most people. This can present challenges socially, but from a business perspective its her competitive advantage as the owner of a consulting firm that is essentially a digital detective agency.

title: Daily Report: As Mt. Gox Falls, Bitcoin Looks to the Future
description: The apparent collapse of Bitcoins best-known and once-dominant trading platform has provoked outrage among its users, but it has also stirred hopes that the way may now be clear for more established players to transform and rein in a largely unregulated market, Rachel Abrams and Nathaniel Popper report.

title: Poll Results
description: The full results of The New York Times/CBS News Poll.

title: Private Equity Leaders See Opportunities in Europe
description: BERLIN  Private equity leaders expressed optimism on Wednesday about the prospects for investments in Europe as economies recover.

title: A Silver Lining in Bitcoins Stumble
description: BITCOINS SILVER LINING | The apparent collapse of Mt. Gox, the most prominent Bitcoin exchange, late Monday night naturally stirred outrage and panic. After all, a document circulating widely in the Bitcoin world said the company had lost 744,000 Bitcoins  about 6 percent of Bitcoins in circulation  worth more than $300 million at current exchange rates. But Bitcoins latest troubles did little to shake the confidence of many, and indeed, the virtual currencys stumble may provide just the spark it needs to become a more mature part of the financial system, Nathaniel Popper and Rachel Abrams write in DealBook.

title: Carlyles Co-Founder Says More Private Equity Firms Likely to Go Public
description: BERLIN  David M. Rubenstein, the co-founder of the private equity firm Carlyle Group, said on Wednesday that he believed more private equity firms would seek to go public in the next few years.

title: In Performance: Bebe Neuwirth of Chicago
